sequence: Well, okay, maybe not perfect, but it was pretty close. This movie jumped from crime drama to romantic goofball comedy and back again so quickly all the way throughout that it seemed like two different movies that played simultaneously and then joined up again at the end. But they did it smoothly, and some in the theater found the bloody parts (like the scalping scene) to be funny as well. I just about threw up, but I guess that's just me. Greg Kinear is perfect as a soap opera actor.

I must say it was a let down. Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the issue of schizophrenia, I am not much knowledgeable on this and got whatever it was depicted in A Beautiful Mind, and here too its interesting portrayal.But the thing that caused the let down for me was the artificial dialogues and over use of English. Its true that a new class is being formed/ has been formed in India which talks in English even at home, but I am sure its not as formal as in the movie. Moreover, Waheeda Rehmaan did not seem very comfortable talking everything in English.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store. when i went to buy it they told me it was out of print and i couldn't order it so i just today thought i would look. and then i found it they put it out in Spain on DVD under the name "Algo Mas Que Amigos" and you can buy there it is in English and Spanish on the DVD....hope this helps ..... i know how hard it is to find movies that we love that they haven't Released to The U.S Market.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way!! When I first tuned in to America's Next Top Model, I expected to be bored, and to find it very very stupid. I didn't. This show is actually serious fun. I read on one of the other reviews that it makes you wonder if you have what it takes to be America's Next top model. And it so does! Who doesn't love the glamour and excitement that come with being a model? On ANTM you get to see what it's REALLY like.

The four signs on the road say `` If You 're Looking For Fun ..... You Do n't Need A Gun. ' '
They were put up by the NRA to counteract a similar sign by a gun-control group. That's really funny ! I thought it was funny too. I know what I'll do tonight. I'm going to go to my garage, take all my guns and shoot 'em off. Maybe I'll run over a few kids with a car, too. It'll be lots of fun. Shooting guns is fun !

Fuckland is an interesting film. I personally love the Dogma movement. I wish it had lasted longer. It seems to have already died. Many critics tried their damndest to shut it down. I don't know why. It's the most interesting movement to happen in the cinematic world since the French New Wave. Besides Fuckland, I've seen the first three in the series, Festen, Idioterne, and Mifune. They were all great, Festen being a masterpiece, in my opinion. Fuckland isn't up to those others. I was just fascinated with the filmmaking.

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that. I got all the tapes, DVD's and audiobooks and every time i watch/listen to them its brand new. The film. The film is a re run of certain episodes, Man and the hour, Enemy within the gates, Battle School and numerous others with a different edge. Introduction of a new General instead of Captain Square was a brilliant move - especially when he wouldn't cash the cheque (something that is rarely done now).It follows through the early years of getting equipment and uniforms, starting up and training.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross trying to plan one big robbery. There's not a whole lot of plot to this film, it's mostly the characters trying to get the money they need to pull off the big heist. It was filmed in Australia, so you can see a few recognizable Aussie faces and landmarks. The acting in this film isn't particularly good. Not the greatest script in the world also, but this isn't one you're going to watch a lot of times.

I 'm a fan of independent film . Dialogue driven , character study pieces are where it 's at for me . I also really dig animation. I have an amazing group of artists , producers , editors & musicians. I work with some amazing people that have a great deal of talent . If you want to make a film , you should talk to me . If we can get your movie made , then I would like to help you in the distribution arena . I 'm also very active on social media and have a strong following . I am very active in my community .

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really do n't approve of pornography all that much....but that is besides the point of this story. This is one of the best porn stories out there, in my opinion. Some of the reviews on here are a bit harsh. I can see how a first time reader would be a little disturbed by some of the imagery. But as a fan, i love it. The characters are really well written, and the dialogue is superb. I find myself going back and re-reading it over and over again because it is so well written.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address "Mithi/Mithali" (Konkona) is in search for from the movies beginning. "Prof.Anu" (Shabhana Azmi)is Mithi's extremely caring and loving half sister from Mithi's mom's earlier marriage. The movie revolves around these characters and looks into the life of a schizophrenic patient (Mithi). The director tries to explain to the viewer the imaginary world of Mithi, through her continuous blabbering to Anu and others. Konkona deserves not one but thousands of awards (which I am sure, she will be getting)for this rendition of Mithi in this movie.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic "Alive", there already was the legendary Mexican exploitation director René Cardona who used the same drama as an outline for his ambitious film "Supervivientes de los Andes". The unforgettable fatal flight of Fairchild 571 that crashed in the Argentinian Andes on October 13, 1972. This terrible accident cost the lives of many passengers, most of them members of a professional rugby team. But 16 people of them were eventually rescued thanks to their strong will to survive and because they fed on the mortal remains of their unfortunate fellow-passengers.

`` Americans Next Top Model '' is the best reality show ! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time, and I never thought I would actually watch a whole season of it because I thought it was going to be too predictable. This show blew me out of the water because of the unpredictability of the contestants. As far as reality TV goes, this is definitely the most unpredictable I have watched, and is also the only one that I have actually liked. As far as reality shows go, this is in my top 3, and this is only because of the unpredictability of the competition.

It has been recorded that John Ford made the `` big , blockbuster '' movies so that he could afford to make his little movies. I believe this. John Ford movies, with their high level of quality and their low level of box office gross, were made for a much smaller but far more dedicated audience than his Westerns. I would say that Ford's ``little '' movies were about as far from Hollywood movies as it would be possible to get, and yet the Hollywood studios were able to turn a profit from them.

The Lone Ranger & Tonto set out to bring to justice a band of hooded raiders who have killed three men on a train, and robbed it of gold and money. The pair track their quarry to a small town on the Mexican border. The masked outlaws demand that the town's bank open its safe; the Ranger and the Tonto interfere, and are arrested. A posse gathers and pursues the bandits to a canyon where they kill the leader. In the town, the banker gives the Ranger an account of what happened with the safe and gold.

I couldn't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character. I laughed for days just thinking about this show. Having finally seen the pilot I guess I will stick around for a few more episodes. Assy is pretty funny and the whole crew of police show characters are around, but Assy is hard to understand and that was a little frustrating. Most of the humor revolves around the fact that the title character is literally a walking ass with nothing else but legs that sport socks with garters and feet with traditional wing tips.

There are a few things in life that we can't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. Especially if we're living in a foreign country and in a apartment with 6 wackos from 6 different countries. Xavier the main character leaves his tidy life in Paris, his ex-hippy mother and his beautiful girlfriend and goes to Barcelona to study spanish in order to get a job at the embassy. He falls in love with the wife of a french doctor and he makes friends that make him look at things differently.

Ok , maybe Posse ca n't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies . But that 's because it did n't try to be one. It tried to be different. When it came out most people weren 't expecting anything big or good. But they were surprised, and the movie did very well . It has a great cast of well known actors ,and a great sound track. The story is great . It shows what can happen when you let your feelings and emotions control your life. But in this case it shows how the main character is able to overcome this.

As I was reading through the comments, I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was "not very profound." I have to disagreethis has to be one of the deepest and most thought-provoking films I've ever seen. Yes, the acting and the music were excellent; they have been praised over and over in the reviews. However, I also praise the heart of the movie. It resonates with deep meaning and feelingit is a story of redemption. It is about two very different and very flawed characters, beaten down by life but too strong to lie down and die.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films. It's got action, adventure, comedy and romance all rolled up into one (and a bit of zen thrown in for good measure). Like much Australian film, the plot is easy to follow yet wonderfully engaging, and Jordan should justly feel proud of his work.Anyway, it was on TV just now on Channel 4 in London, and my two favourite comedy scenes of not just this movie, but indeed any movie, had been cut out!

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when it comes to food and clothes. The Germans are starving and they haven't had bread in a long time. The train leaves Stockholm with one hundred and seven Swedish children, a hundred and three adult men and twenty-six adult women. They were all volunteers. The Swedish government asked the Swedish women if they would give up their children in order to take care of the sick, the old and the homeless people in Berlin.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie. Is hilarious and the actors uses local expressions that are so much fund to listen.It shows a different face o Bogotá and I think that's very important because Colombia is a diverse country and we need to show that to the world This is the first movie of the director Felipe Martinez and I really except this movie will be the beginning of a great career as a film director.We need to continue support Colombian filming industry, because this movie and others good films are the beginning of something big.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen this year. Neil Labute's terrific casting and cynical direction keeps this film from becoming too sentimental while Renée Zellweger and Morgan Freeman's authentic performances give it a soul. Violent, provocative and humorous at the same time with a truly wonderful ending. Chris Rock, Greg Kinnear Aaron Eckhart, Crispin Glover and Allison Janney all give uproarious, tongue in cheek performances. The greatest spoof of soap operas since the movie Soap, but better and smarter. 9 out of 10.

Minor spoilers follow , but nothing you wo n't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by an overwhelming ensemble cast, this movie is a joy to watch and leaves you wondering what would happen next if they decided to make it a movie franchise. In short, I think they should. I'm always suspicious when an actor or actress says they'll do any movie just as long as they have creative control, but in this case, I think the cast had it right. The casting was just so perfect , and the creators really seemed to know the characters and where the story could go.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster (a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV's "Land of the Lost") creates a computerized watchdog called C.H.O.M.P.S. (an acronym for Canine Home Protection System) for his boss Mr. Ralph Norton (nicely played by Conrad Baain), whose home security business is floundering. A rival company hires a pair of inept criminals to get their grubby hands on C.H.O.M.P.S. ; said task proves to be easier said than done. Director Don Chaffey relates the endearingly dopey story at a constant brisk pace, maintains an amiably silly and lighthearted tone throughout, and stages the goofy slapstick gags with considerable flair.

Guess a few upscale film directors were sitting around sipping their absinthe, grappa, aramangac or jungle juice some night in the 80's during the Cannes or other film festival and one said "Hey, guys let's do a movie where each of us creates a segment around a world class aria." Welllll...it kind of sort of worked. Clearly someone was smart enough to select some of the best recordings of the arias chosen, for example Bjoreling's Nessun Dorma, so if you were blind and lying on the floor just listening to the DVD you got more than your money's worth.

With all the dreck out there , this is a gentle movie about young love . Yes , it 's a bit predictable , but so what . It's like comfort food . I don't think this movie was made to be the best of the year but it's nice to sit down for 2 hours of escapism , if that's what you need . The movie is well acted and directed , the music and cinematography are nice . And it 's not over the top . This is not a perfect movie , but it's a nice way to end the year .

Do n't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit , crisp dialog or clever social commentary . This time, Austen is just one among many contributors , not the driving force . The movie could be better if they had a stronger director. It is not a perfect movie by any means , but is still better than most of its ilk. I recommend this movie to everyone , especially to the people who are fan of this genre. The movie runs for 95 min , was released in the year 2013 and is one of the greatest piece of work ever made in the history of motion picture.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years . As a boy , my brother and I traveled back to our mother’s country , England , once a year, and every year , our mother took us shopping in Birmingham, where the factory of the shirt maker was located. The factory was no longer there, and all that remained was a plaque in front of the store, which told the story of the factory, and the shirts that we bought in the 60’s .

First love . Teenage love . We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the song says or as it is portrayed in films. I did not have much experience in the romantic front but it was a lot like what the songs and movies describe. So when I saw the teaser I was all excited about the song. And the song had all the elements that I had read about or listened to in the 80s. Then the song was released. And I was so disappointed with the song. But I was happy that I was not the only one who thought that.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster ( a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV 's `` Land of the Lost " fame) and his equally brainy pal, A.J. (Kim Richards), come across an unusual pair of sunglasses in a cave. When they put them on, they find themselves in another world where everything is topsy- turvy -- and they're the only ones who can save the place. With this premise, which could have made a great episode of `` The New Mickey Mouse Club ," the filmmakers, unfortunately, have made one of the worst films to be produced at the Disney Studio in years.

The philosophical , meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind . I 'd give it 100 % stars if I could !! 16 of 18 people found this review helpful. Was this review helpful to you? I don't know why the ratings on this movie are so low . There are very few movies out there that I can say have had a profound affect on my life . This is one of them . In fact I would say it's the only movie that's done that . This movie changed my entire perspective on life .

Robin Hood: Men in Tights (1993) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks. He has the assignment of spoofing the Robin Hood legacy and the couple of movie dealing with the mythical honorable thief of English folklore. Cary Elwes stars as Robin Hood. He's looking for a few good men who'll join him in his quest to topple the evil sheriff of Nottingham (Roger Rees) and win the fair hand of Maid Marian. Robin also has to deal with Prince John (Richard Lewis).as well.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values, but very surface and slightly altered biography. Dramatizes Richard's discovery of "We've Only Just Begun" and Karen's marriage troubles admirably (the "Superstar" montage was a nice touch), yet notably leaves out the disagreement with Neil Sedaka, the contribution of Tony Peluso's guitar solos, etc. Gibb is sweet in her Karen persona, but it doesn't include the tomboyish and gutsier sides of the real Carpenter's personality.

This is what porn used to be, this is a true classic. I mean, it is an x-rated musical based on an actual book! There is a real plot to it and how many x-rated movies can boast that these days? This belongs in an exclusive short-list of true pornographic movie classics, including Debby Does Dallas, Deep Throat, and Behind the Green Door. I think the problem with "pornographic movies" these days is that it's all about the "pornographic" and not about the "movie".

First of all - I 'm not one to go all sappy over movies . I saw Friends in the Theater the first time with my best friend, who is also my soul mate, it's her birthday and my first year anniversary. The perfect way to celebrate . It was the first time I had gone to the theater in years. I used to be a cinephile . Then I had kids and lost my ability to sit in one place for more than five minutes and then I could never make it past ten minutes into a movie.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen . To explain my experience , let me say that this movie has its own special kind of weirdness . To start , I was told that The Box was a sci-fi/horror movie . I wasn't quite sure how it was gonna be scary , but it did turn out to be that . But it is a weird movie , and I was a little worried . The movie starts with an old lady , and her husband who seems to be having trouble with his back .

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations , discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional conflict . I was totally wrong in making that judgment . This one is an intense story about the complex relationship between a mother and daughter as well as a sister and sister . The movie moves on a slow paced narrative that makes the character and their emotions quite believable. The story is based on an Indian family living in a posh locality of New Delhi . The main character is an educated mother of two children – a son and a daughter .

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film : Who are the crazy people ? The answer become less and less simple as we move forward in time and get to see more of their backgrounds and their thoughts. But whatever the answer, the result is that the viewer's sympathy inevitably changes from one person to the other, so that one ends by feeling sympathetic for all the characters. The main character is Nada, who is unemployed at the beginning. She lives in a small room in a rundown house in which she and a number of other women are exploited by the two men of the house.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment ! It is an energetic performance with traditional music and Irish dance. It starts with a solo dancer in black, dressed up in a kilt and a red waistcoat. He gives a speech about Irish dance, about the myths surrounding it as well as Irish traditions and then he introduces the first group of musicians and dancers. The musicians are playing the music while the dancers are doing a traditional Irish dance. Afterwards they are dancing together. The show starts to get faster and more intense and at some point the music gets faster as well.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film. It was when I was a teenager, I think (I'm 37 now). I started watching it as a late night movie sometime in the mid to early 80s, and so much of it has stayed with me ever since. Seeing other comments, I had NO idea it was shown at theatres, or that anyone else even new it existed. I don't think I've even mentioned the movie to anyone else.But half a lifetime later, I still remember much of the movie that I watched late at night so long ago.

there 's only so much that i can take of Filipino films , especially nowadays where the trend is sex comedy. I don't understand why they are making this kind of movies just to please the crowd, to make money and not for the people to appreciate the goodness of this country. I am sure the producers of this movie knew that there's a lot of good films in the market and that the audiences already had enough of this so called comedy. But of course, this kind of movies sells and if you don't take advantage of it, someone would.

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of "slasher" movies in the early 1980's, that a few good ones might slip through the cracks. This is a great "rare" film from Jeff Lieberman, who insured his cult status with his memorable 1970's films "Squirm" and "Blue Sunshine".Five young people head into the Oregon mountains (this movie was actually shot on location) to do some camping and check out the deed to some land that one of them has acquired. Before long, they will predictably be terrorized by a bulky killer with an incredibly creepy wheezing laugh.

Having just watched this with my mother (Who got it for Christmas) i was thrilled to find something different to the usual stuff i usually watch. All of the stories were detailed and you are able to feel strong emotion towards each character from the very beginning. Every storyline is followed through brilliantly, making you feel completely different things for every single character. The cast is amazing, my personal favourites being James Read and Lesley-Anne Down, as George Hazard and Madeline Fabray/LaMotte/Main. The whole thing is in depth and wonderful, making very compulsive viewing, i recommend it to almost everyone.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time . We loved it so much . It’s too bad that it got canceled . I remember it being on TBS . It has so many Black actors . It was great to have us on TV in a show like that ! I miss this series…it used to air on TBS and I was a little girl but loved it. I wish they re-run it again and again. We need more series like this. Where the actors look and talk like real blacks. I miss this series a lot and I really hope they will bring it back.

I get really fed up with sitcoms; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be funny. On the other hand, Hi De Hi, you rarely know what is coming and it's laugh out loud funny. I have just purchased the second set of the series, (series 3 -4)and I am surprised at just how much I am enjoying it all - again. I have nothing but praise for the writers or the actors (or the many unseen crew members) because the entertainment they provide is well worth the wait.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years. Great production design, appealing stars, great lines ("Miss Bender, I don't care if you beat it out on a native drum! ", says Joan Crawford's Amanda Farrow to Hope Lange when Lange incredulously asks how she is expected to read a summarize a large amount of manuscripts in a very short time). If you've seen this movie panned and scanned on TV and not in the letterboxed version on pay-TV or AMC (American Movie Classics) you haven't really seen it.

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission he decides to go after him. But he doesn’t realize that there’s a lot more at stake for Young and for Peck. But he’s determined not to let Peck get her. Gig Young as J.B. Books
Elsa Lancaster as Mrs. Fletcher
Margaret Brayton as Aunt Katherine
This film is based on the story by Edward Anhalt. The only thing that really sticks out to me in terms of story is Peck being in a car chase and the scene where Peck falls to the ground.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch the bits I missed whilst bending over holding my stomach! The critic who reviewed this film for this site challenged anyone with an IQ over their shoe size to find this film funny, well my IQ is approx:135...I challenge this person to question me and then eat his own words! This film is brilliant and if the critic above wasn't such a boring idiot, he might smile for once in his life and take things as lightly as they're meant!!

I 'm seen this documentary in its feature-form , in a movie theatre . And ... wouah ! The pictures were really great ! I had to see this movie in the cinema , it was my choice , even if my friends were not sure that I'm not the right person to see this movie . But, at the end, we all agree , that this movie was the perfect choice . And , in my option , the movie could have been a bit more violent , a bit more blood , a bit more aggressive. But I like it as it is , it is not an horror movie .

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist, I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out. When I first saw the trailer for 'Black Snake Moan' I laughed and thought, "Great. Another 'Snakes on a Plane' Samuel L Jackson movie". But of course, I wanted to see it for the laugh factor. Many people have judged this movie too quickly based on the innuendo in the title, the images on promotional ads and on the fact that Justin Timberlake is in the film. Personally I loved every second of this movie.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty , easily one of the most charming , off-beat , and lighthearted comedies to be released in a while. Betty ( Renee ) works in a diner and her only interest is in her boyfriend , who she thinks has been killed in an automobile accident. In the meantime , there is a car accident near Betty's house and she thinks she is in a dream. She sees the man from her dreams sitting in the back seat and she gets into his car. Betty ends up kidnapped by a drug dealer named Krodel.

If there 's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other , It 's the Bob Clampett Porky series. I can 't really recall the first one I saw; I remember seeing them in the ' 60s and ' 70s, but that 's not the kind of stuff that sticks in your brain. All I remember is how much I loved them when I saw them on TV when I was very young. I used to look for them on Saturday mornings and hope that I would see one.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off. For the first solo adventure of the Kettles a new writing team and director is introduced. Leonard Goldstein, associate producer of The Egg and I, was producer of The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle. With many of the characters played by the same actors and actresses the focus from the MacDonalds to the Kettles works very well. There is a reference to Ma beating Birdie Hicks for first prize at the fair for her quilt, an import scene in The Egg and I.

Hallelujah!!!! Finally, a true Colombian film crosses the border(s) to shows how Bogotá and Colombia really are! I am an American of Colombian and French heritage sick and tired of seeing Colombia so perversely and ignorantly portrayed by Hollywood and others.How many of you are aware that Colombia is the second oldest, uninterrupted democracy in the world (after the USA), or that it has a vibrant film and television industry (-to say nothing of Ugly Betty), that it's capital, Bogota (Pop.

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain ( of course , because it 's so sensational to show someone getting hung) that I feared I was in for a horror film. This is a drama. And one that is quite compelling. Yes. I know. It has some elements of the horror genre. But only a couple. I am glad that this film dealt with a serious subject in a way that was compelling and real. This is what I look for in my drama's. The story line and characters are well written.

I Love this movie ! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie , but I was very happy when I was watching it and I was happy to be a part of it, so thank you all who made it ! It was a great movie and all of my favorite actors were in it. You all did great jobs and I was happy to have a part in the movie as well . This movie was so amazing !!!!!!!! I love it , it was so happy !!!!!!!!!!!

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful. I liked the movie. Can anyone tell me how I can get hold of the songs from this movie? Even the soundtrack will do. If that's not possible, can I at least get the names of the songs with their respective singers? I tried to look up amazon.com but its not there. I tried CD baby, not there either. I browsed through Google to get some details but there weren't any. I would appreciate it if someone could give me the answer to my question.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot . Bugs of Daffy . He 's unsure because he loves his two buddies in a way but he has to choose for a better life and for that he must decide one of them to kill . This is the story of Elmer and Daffy and of course the other character that will make the difference . This is a short story but really funny , especially if you love the Warner Bros cartoons !!! Enjoy it . Lasagna is a dish that you can find in many countries but the way that they prepare it is different in every country .

After `` Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman '' with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as sexy as men onscreen, many films followed to showcase the new female sexuality. It seems that the whole world has been infiltrated by aliens from other galaxies, or at least that is what seems to be in the 1950s, with the films that had been released with alien plots. One of the most successful alien themed movies of all time is `` Earth vs. the Flying Saucers '' directed by Fred F. Sears. It is about a UFO that lands in a cornfield in the middle of nowhere.

I shot this movie . I am very proud of the film . It was a great experience which shows in this film . I did the editing . Thanks for sharing your experience on the production of the movie. It sounds like a challenging project, but it is always a joy to see a movie done well. I was wondering if you could provide some background information on this project. It seems to be some sort of student production, but I didn't really find any more details about the production on the net.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make a banquet of beauties into a delightful meal day to day, this movie hits the mark. Good afternoon fare. I understand that Louis Jordan wanted to work in this movie to play opposite the quintessential GORGEOUS Suzy Parker. Everyone wanted to be in and I believe it has done well and held up over time. Best on screen kiss between Hope Lange and the late Stephen Boyd.It may not appear that anything of this is plausible but actually it was and probably still is even given the scare of sexual harassment.

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that . I got all the tapes , dvd's and video's etc , but there's is one show i've been after for some time now . It's the Dad's Army feature length film , i've been offered some on e-bay but they are a little out of my price range so to speak. Does anyone know of this film or any where i could get hold of it ? I believe that I have seen it on tv but not since it was originally shown on the B&W channel.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts. This one was leaps and bounds ahead of the others in terms of quality of acting, directing, filming and originality of story. It comes together with a professionalism often lacking in short films.This is a great short film for the following reasons: 1. Amazing performances. The 2 actresses are both compelling and believable instantly. Their chemistry is palpable; the depth of their relationship is conveyed, even though the film is 10 mins long. The acting and directing are very powerful.2. Beautifully shot.

Wow ! An amazing , lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one . This video has been on my wish list of lost items to be restored for years . I've watched it in its unrestored state for years , and the original footage has not been seen anywhere in the public domain since. I was lucky enough to make a new video edit from the original footage . For the full story of the 70s Glam Film and how it went missing, go to my YouTube channel . For the unedited 32 minutes in its original form , go to my Glam Video blog .

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements . I think they were trying to capture what you 'd see if you looked at the stage from an oblique angle. But the sound mix was a little wonky. I didn't hear much in the way of a lead singer's voice. I didn't hear a lead singer's voice, but I definitely heard someone playing the drums. The other instruments sounded fine. I'd guess the guitar sound was a little bright for the rest of the instruments. The lead vocal sounded like it was placed on the right hand side of the stereo mix.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert , and its influence on them is clearly visible. It’s also worth noting that George Miller directed this, as well as the aforementioned Road Warrior, in between Mad Max films. Miller’s style of filmmaking really comes through here, and he’s obviously been honing it for quite a while. This film is much less gritty or hard to follow than the others in the series. I think it has to be the least violent, and even that violence is tame by comparison to later Mad Max films.

I just watched this movie on it 's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia . I liked (and disliked ) the movie for numerous reasons. Let me point them out. 1. I'm glad that this movie is finally on screen after so much hue and cry around it . 3. The story, the plot and the dialogues were simple and straight forward. 4. I liked the way how they showed some of the very basic, simple and important things that every kid learns in the course of his growing years through this movie .

Most of these reviews are dead on , so I 'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of questions before I get into the gist of it: Do I think the movie is worth watching: yes, I found it quite entertaining as a film fanatic and a movie lover with an unquenchable thirst for cinema! Is this film a great movie? No! Is this film Oscar material: Not a snowball 's chance in hell! Do I think the film does a great job at explaining what's in the book or what it is all about? Not really!

First of all - I'm not one to go all sappy over movies. I saw Friends in the 70's when it was first released. I was about 17 years old at the time. Even now, at age 50, I still can remember some of the scenes. The movie is sweet and sad and may actually be too tame for teenagers today but I loved it. The story is about innocence, the purity of young love and the determination of 2 young people to make a better life for themselves then they had at home.

What can I say ? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception to the rule. Although I do not believe in God and have never believed in the Christian God, I must admit that the story of Jesus is fascinating to me. Maybe it is not a story of one man but of a collective need to find purpose in a world that seems so unjust, so indifferent or so hostile to your cause and beliefs. I must confess I am not the religious type and have always wondered why people are so religious or need religion in their life.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world. There’s the sophisticated Maggie, the beautiful Linda and the innocent Polly. It follows them on their careers and personal lives in the world of publishing, with lots of singing and dancing in the streets, at work, and on the subway, and at the various parties. I was 17 when this was released, and I went to the cinema to watch it on my own. I found it quite enjoyable and went to a second showing that week.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature doesn't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with enough rough and tumble action and moves along at a good clip. The Ranger looks into a series of mysterious murders which have a sinister pattern to them with peaceful Indians being the victims of a gang of hooded killers. There are more killings and violence usually associated with Lone Ranger adventures and the film has an undercurrent of racial insensitivity, the comments of which are sprinkled throughout the screenplay. The Ranger uses disguises as only he can to piece together clues and expose the outlaw band and bring them to justice.

With Nurse Betty (2000), acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute (In the Company of Men, Your Friends & Neighbors) makes his breakthrough into the big-budgeted (Betty's $24 million as opposed to Company's measly $25,000), mainstream realm -- and yet remains true to his roots. While his cast is now composed of A-list Hollywood names (Renee Zellweger, Morgan Freeman, and stand-up comedian Chris Rock), his material remains just as bizarre and quirky as his first two features, proving that he just may be the next big thing.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie. How surprised I was! This is a great, beautiful, twisted movie which will give your mind a good work-out! It's not simple. If you only enjoy Police Academy style, no-brains movies, this is not for you. The Cell is a deep, complex film with influences from movies like Cube, Silence of the Lambs and The Lawnmower Man, along with lots of completely new ideas. Wonderful, twisted environments, good acting and a compelling story makes this one of the best films I have seen in a long time!

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say "french culture". I thought the way it was filmed and the editing was real good but mostly it was entertaining especially the guy that played Wendy's brother. Also the story line was really good as well as it was believable and yet adventurous as well.Favorite Part: When William is making fun of the German guy studying and when he acts out how flies reproduce! :) My french isn't that good but with the subtitles i could pretty much get what was going on. WATCH IT!

Onstage John Osborne 's adaptation of `` Picture of Dorian Gray '' is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde 's satire of artistic pretension, but offstage it has been a different matter. The show has been beset by problems, ranging from the failure of the lead actor to turn up to the theater until 10 minutes before curtain, to the refusal of the producers, David Merrick, to pay the cast for two weeks' performances. In the show, which opened Oct. 22, Jason Robards plays the decadent young man, Basil Ransom, in the London of 1890.

This is a "revised" Riverdance presentation, staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City. Of the three Irish "dance" musicals that I watched during the mid to late '90s (which includes the first "Riverdance" and "Lord of the Dance") I liked this one the best.I thought it was better than the original, held in Dublin, Ireland, because it adds segments that are mostly good, it has a more varied and colorful stage setting and it eliminated apiece for two from that original that wasn't good to begin with.

One of the best ! As being a fan of the civil war , I was very pleased with the book, the pictures are excellent,and the story was very well written and easy to follow along. I would recommend the book to any fan of history or just a fan of photography. The images in this book bring the time period to life in a way I've never seen before in any history book. Beautiful photography and superb storytelling make this volume one of the all-time best photo books I've seen of the Civil War era.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies, along with Spaceballs(although I will openly admit to not having watched many others, at least yet). It's very silly and thoroughly funny, there are hardly more than a few minutes throughout the entire two hour run-time, where you aren't entertained. Almost all of the gags have a great comical effect, few of them fall flat. I saw this movie right after seeing and reviewing Spy Hard, and comparing these two spoof movies, I realize exactly of how high quality this movie really is.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

Just watched Conrack for the first time . Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, I found it very engaging overall. There's something very powerful about a young teacher who sticks with his students, despite all the obstacles that the school system presents. I'd be interested in reading about what you think of this movie, especially the teacher's role in the school. The movie left me with a lot of questions about the role of teachers and how we do or don't have the power to affect our students.

This is how I interpreted the movie: First things first. There was not a single scene in the movie where u see the bad guy (Taylor) torturing or nailing Ben's hands to the wall. However the same cannot be told of the gals. In the end too, u see Taylor disappear as he walks. Looks like the message there was "There was no Taylor". And the whole movie was a figment of imagination of Ben. Also, there was no scene during the torturing moments wherein any of the gals confront or are in the same frame as Ben.

My favorite film this year. Great characters and plot, and the direction and editing was smooth, visually beautiful, and interesting. Set in Barcelona, the film follows a year in the lives of six foreign graduate students and assorted others. Cultures and languages clash but hearts and lives intertwine. The leading role would never have been cast in Hollywood, but he carried the part perfectly. The characters were nicely developed and their interplay was honest and accurate. There were two especially noteworthy scenes, the climax was truly inspired.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. I’ve been looking for a copy for years. I finally got lucky and got a pirate copy from the internet. I finally watched the film a few nights ago and I’m still speechless by how much I like this film and how well it is made. What a great film. It’s a classic film in my eyes. The storyline is about a group of people who have to go to a deserted island after a plane crash.

spoiler--In 1993, African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with "Posse". The film was co-written and directed by Van Peebles, who also stars as the main character, Jessie Lee.Plot: The film begins at the turn of the 20th century, when the United States was embroiled in the Spanish-American war. Apparently a time when the U.S. justice system could send convicts into military service, Jessie Lee finds himself an unwilling enlisted man, serving with an all-black cavalry troop in Cuba.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts . This one was leaps and bounds ahead of the other ones in all aspects. I’d go as far to say that the cinematography and editing make this film. They are the best in the bunch. In fact this film may have the best cinematography I’ve seen in any film this year. Its just so beautiful I don’t have words. Also, it was a nice change to see a romantic story where there was no conflict between the couple. They were great together and supported each other.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V. and came across this film. I don't ever remember seeing this or hearing of it. What a fun and interesting one to watch. Well, my meeting was pushed back, because I couldn't get out of this film. It had some real interesting things in it that marked it's time in history, and some fun things that they don't have people do in today's film because it's not pretty. Well, there was a lot of realism in it.

Sure , it has its pretentious moments , it plays like art-house , live-action Fantasia , but it also has its moments of surrealism , and even though it looks and feels like an animated movie , it’s very much an independent one , it has its fair share of heartbreaking moments , it has characters that are likable in their oddness , it even has its fair share of humor , it’s a strange , wonderful movie , and if I must choose between a live-action or animated movie , I’d go with animated movie every time .

Jimmy (Heath Ledger) is given a simple job by Pando (Bryan Brown) a underworld kingpin to deliver money to a particular address, but when no one answers the door Jimmy decides to take a dip at the beach to pass some time, but he notices that his clothes on the sand have been messed up and the 10 grand is gone. Jimmy rings Pando to tell him the problem, but he doesn't want to hear it. Pando and his boys try their best to locate Jimmy, meaning no more Jimmy if they get their hands on him.

Wagon Master ( 1950 ) Dir : John Ford Production : Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings us back to the days when there were good-guy villains and bad guy good-guys. John Ford has also been criticized in the past for making movies in which the Indians were portrayed as evil. If you are a John Ford fan this movie will not disappoint. A group of people are heading West from Arkansas to California looking for gold. The lead characters are an older gentleman who has been on many wagon train journeys and is now the leader, his son and his son’s fiancee’.

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries , I did n't expect much from 'Two' when it came out last month but, like a lot of people, I was impressed, and pleasantly surprised by its strong story and strong acting. I was impressed that such a short movie could have a decent plot, with realistic dialogue and emotions, as well as two credible and memorable characters, while at the same time not taking up an hour and a half of my time, as some movies are prone to do.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits, and was released on 9/20/45. This is my 2nd favorite short of the three, and it was also nominated for the Oscar for Best Short Subject, Cartoons, but lost to Bugs in Boom Town. Here is the original cartoon, without music, with no dialogue other than the narrator's, and with the original opening:
Bugs is seen sitting on a fallen log by the water's edge when he hears Daffy say, "What say we go rabbit hunting?

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm, wit, and charm. At age 16 Lorelai Gilmore gave birth to Rory Gilmore. She left her parents house and got a job. Now, Lorelai and Rory have a relationship that many mothers and daughters envy. They are best friends. The girls have an extensive knowledge of movies, and TV shows, and are constantly quoting them. In the first season, Lorelai needs money to send Rory to Chilton ( a very highly rated high school), so she reluctantly has to turn to her parents.

Okay , where to begin . Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous stars but they refused the role of the robots ? You probably didn't realize that the part of the evil queen was originally offered to Tina Turner and that's only one of the many interesting facts that I found out when reading the book ' The making of ' Walt Disneys classic films ' by J P Miller . You know I'm a big Disney movie lover and that's why this book was a must buy for me once I found it .

I love to see a female protagonist , in this movie her name was Rose . Rose brought out a very unique and interesting character . Rose was smart , courageous and strong . Rose has a sense of humor and her character made this movie even better . I really liked how this movie gave us a female role that we could relate to . If you want to feel inspired watch this movie . It is very interesting to see a strong female protagonist that is so different than the stereo typical ones that we usually see. I would definitely recommend this movie as a good family movie !

This film blew me away. I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot. After watching this, I see I knew nothing. The story is told through the relationship between the attorney and the black inmate. Both the personal story of these two men and the unfolding courtroom drama were riveting. The flashback sequences in the prison were awesome. It's hard to believe it wasn't documentary footage it was so real. It was not only a great piece of drama, it was an incredible lesson in an important chapter in American history. I'm with Ebert and Roeper.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script , good camera work and transitions , good directing, good performances by the actors , interesting and suspenseful with an ending that ties the story together . If you like RKO Saint films, you will enjoy this one. Well-directed with good camera work. An RKO Saint entry with an original and interesting script, very good directing, suspenseful, well-acted and good camera work. This Saint film offers a good script, direction and performances. An excellent Saint movie with many original details and suspense .

Honestly, when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana, I did not expect much. I went to this movie only because I figured hey, it's a WWE movie it'll be good for a laugh. Then I sat down and watched it and saw why they chose Glen Jacobs (Kane) to play Jacob Goodnight. He is probably one of the freakiest guys on the big screen (much worse in my opinion than Freddy or Jason) and has one big advantage to other movies that attracts me to a horror movie.

Awww, I love this! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon doesn't really need an synopsis, as that's what it is... the cat chasing the moon, to a Spanish poem. It's the artistry that's interesting. In fact, there was this animated short called the Fan and the Flower that was an Academy Award winner last year (2005)... yeah, almost same thing, which leads me to believe it might just be a rip off.But this is a really good short, with stark black & white shapes shifting and transitioning into beautiful motion and poetic seduction...

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this . I have been searching for the past few weeks and cant seem to find it anywhere . Is there anyone who knows where I could get the movie? Does anyone who have watched the movie know where I would be able to buy the dvd? I've tried ebay and Amazon but there is no information on it whatsoever! I know that it has been over a year but I've been trying to buy this DVD since I first found out about it and have no clue how to find it anywhere.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $ 300,000 of gold , along with a banker Clayton , who 's responsible for the transfer . The train passes a small, isolated station called Blackwell. While the train is on station , a few bandits decide to stop the train and kill all the passengers. A mysterious man, known by the name of Blackwell , enters the train. He shoots the criminals and saves the passengers. After that, the mysterious man leaves the train, but not before giving a message to the engineer . The next day, the train arrives at Blackwell.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks (Jamie Bartlett) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofor).A member of the South African Parliament who cant remember the torture he once endured as a captive political activist.South African born attorney Sarah Barcant (Hilary Swank), meanwhile, returns to her homeland to represent Mpondo.As well as Steve Sizela, Mpondo's friend who was arrested along with him, and never heard from again.This film is one of the best films to come out about the South African regime of Aparthied, in the past.Everybody should watch it.

I saw it in Europe-plex. Great movie!! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the Flesh in modern times. Protagonist Jim Kirk, drives an unwieldy RV across America, stopping often to fill his gas-guzzling tank. He is middle-aged and confused . He fuels his thick, diabetic body with cups of coffee and radio chatter. He is the Flesh: agitated and sometimes spaced out, fairly oblivious to the growing tension around him but feeling it as twinges of discomfort. The Spirit suffuses the film through speeches and other sounds, as well as what appears and goes by in the visual field.

This if the first movie I 've given a 10 to in years . If there was ever a movie that did everything right it was this movie . The action, the story, the cast, and the music . This movie has everything I want in a movie . I will be buying it and it will be on my permanent movie collection shelf and will be watched often . I love this movie so much i would rate it a 20 out of 10 . It was very enjoyable and had great action scenes and good story lines . It is one of my favorite superhero movies .

America's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense. It has a great hostess, has great guests, a great production and some of the best professionals of the modeling world contributing for something they hadn't achieved yet: present a true America's Next Top Model. Of course this is not something easy to do, therefore USA and the world already would have 10 top models concurring and fighting between themselves in this cruel world.But it's obvious that its intention is not to present the America's next top model, but yes, the America's Next Pop Model.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with `` Valley of the Kings . '' These movies starred Tom Conway who portrayed the debonair gentleman sleuth Mr.
George Sanders who played Mr. Sanders' brother in the films is a much better actor but Tom was still quite adequate. Both Sanders brothers had a knack for playing sophisticated characters on a low budget in the mid forties. They were not the first brothers to play detectives though. Thomas Chandler Halliburton wrote a series of books about two brothers, both named William Gillette , who were private detectives in San Francisco and later in London in the late forties/early fifties.

spoiler -- In 1993 , African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with the film Posse , a western-style action/drama about five friends who become involved in a bank heist and subsequent killing of a police officer. They become fugitives, with the media and police hot on their trail as the film unfolds from several points of view. The title refers both to the five heroes (called "Posse") and to the five witnesses to the bank-heist murders, who are also being hunted by the police. Posse featured a diverse cast of actors.

Most of these reviews are dead on, so I'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of questions I've seen on here.While the characters seem and look young (hence the controversy), the actor/actress themselves were 17 and 18 at the time and so obviously over the 16 barrier. Here in the USA, that's still somewhat controversial but the simplicity and innocence of the film does much to offset it.I'm sorry not to have seen more by Sean; in this movie at least his expressions are demonstrative and obvious; you know exactly what the character is feeling whether he's angry, afraid, or confused.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year . It was a truly moving experience . I was there with my family. My two brothers, a sister , and my Mother. We are all in our 70's , but I think we all felt we were 19. This film made me laugh and cry. It was a beautiful experience. I would like to see it in theatres. Please bring it to my town. I saw this movie in Toronto and would love to see it in a theatre here in Montreal!

The above summary really isn't meant as a slam against this film, as the series followed a very similar format. As usual, Simon Templar ("The Saint") meets a lady in distress and comes to her aid. He also comes to the aid of a police detective who was framed of accepting a bribe. Along the way, he meets some interesting supporting characters (this time, Paul Guilfoyle as "Pearly" Gates) and during his unraveling of this not especially compelling mystery (none of them really are), Templar is extremely erudite and just plain cool!

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award . It was the second year that the award was presented at the Festival. Wonderful story of a girl and her father and what he does when she asks him for one last wish, and he gives his all to grant the wish. The story is one that you'll remember. Director and co-writer Timothy Bjorklund has assembled a cast that make this story even more enjoyable and believable. You're not just watching an actor play the role, you're seeing someone live the story.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me . I loved Orry and George but I always knew how it would end which is why I love the movie. The music was also really good as well. This film is a story about two brothers living in South Carolina, Orry Main and George. The movie is about how the Civil War affected this family. In the end George's life is taken. My favorite character is definitely Orry because he was just a good man who wanted nothing for himself, he was a kind and generous person.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little. I am not a doctor but do have an interest in the field of medicine and have some medical knowledge that I think is worth putting out there. Firstly I am a nurse and have worked in Hospitals, Psychiatric and Geriatric units for 14 years. I can say that I have never heard a doctor or any health care professional state that a 30 yr old should not be allowed to smoke because it may lead to her getting lung cancer.

Unlike some of the former commentators, I was (and am) an avid fan of the Carpenters. Face it, Christmas would never be Christmas without The Carpenters. That said, I believe the movie did a good, not excellent, job at depicting Karen's life. The movie was enjoyable to see on primetime TV, but the content fell a little short. I suggest that you all look into getting some of the Carpenters specials that were shown in the 70's. You cannot believe how awesome a drummer Karen was. Cynthia did not capture the extent of Karen's talent.

honestly.. this show warms my heart, i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season has started i'm even more hooked than before.. the characters are so well-developed and their relationships are so real.. i would recommend this show for any woman or mother and daughter.. the Lorelei's are super fast talking witty girls that will, truly inspire you and the show is hysterical at times and never too too serious, but serious enough for it to be completely addicting.. it's an hour long which is a major PLUS because you can't ever get enough Gilmore!

In `` Black Snake Moan , '' writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me wonders if he isn't using his movie as an excuse to work out some issues of guilt. If he were, that would make sense. There's an abundance of sexual and violent imagery in his story about a young black man, Lazarus, who is left at the altar on his wedding day. Cleared of murdering his fiance's father when she drops the charges, Lazarus is told he has a disease that'll make him crazy if he doesn't marry his fiance'.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance , women-on-the-verge psychodrama , work place sexual harassment , adultery , and fashion . All of these elements make this movie very interesting, but don’t be fooled by all of the interesting elements. The characters themselves are rather flat. The film takes itself very seriously (as if this were the greatest romantic drama to hit the screen in years), but then the whole thing falls to pieces in the last 20 minutes. But what you get from the beginning to that last scene is enough to make The Other Woman an interesting film.

This movie just might make you cooooo. The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town. Betty (Renee Zellweger)is the lone "acceptable" soap groupie out there. Her character is SO charming and SO convincing that you find yourself in forgiveness over her being such a goof. I might even allow myself to get lost in Bettys' adorable fantasy, if it weren't for the fact that Dr. Ravell's real name is George... And speak of the devil; "looker" Greg Kinnear fills his role VERY well.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim , California in the early 90s. It had been out in the theater for a short while and was just released on VHS . The movie had just come out in November of 1986 and it was one of the first VHS I owned. Even at the age of 13 I was hooked to it. A few years prior to this movie I had seen a TV movie on ABC called SHOWDOWN (1981), about a group of bikers held hostage by a crazy old man.

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter 's voice , there is that old familiar feeling of 70 's blues . When it comes to music Karen Carpenter always has her own way around it . She has her own personal way of doing the songs . Karen was one of the main people behind the success of Carpenters in the early 70's . When I look back it was always Karen's voice that captured my attention on Carpenters songs . Karen's voice had a soothing touch to it that would always get me in a mood for some blues .

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me. I loved it so much and I was dying to get my hands on it.In 2002, I remembered that this movie existed but I had no idea what it was called, so, I went to the I Need To Know section on IMDb and explained what the movie was about and tried to get the name of it. Anyway, eventually someone on IMDb told me, so I researched and tried to buy the movie.

I 'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things . However , SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of literature. I loved it ! I was completely absorbed from page 1. It's a very complex book with so many different layers that it just kept pulling me deeper. The story starts off with some very strange and creepy stuff happening in a young man's life which leads up to some very disturbing things happening in his childhood. His story is interspersed with a current day plotline that follows a cop and a woman who is trying to make her way home.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one. I really can't come up with one. I think it's because most of the films that take on this topic (war, peace, violence) are in a fixed documentary style.There are some terrific ones out there, all of them better known than USA T.M., I'm sure, but they are intended to be informational and to bring your emotional response to the surface through intellectual means. This DVD, in some ways may seem more intellectual but it really isn't.

I didn't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn. I don't know why I keep buying these slasher movies when I know it's all the same every time. Maybe I'm a bit masochistic? Anyway, I'm glad I bought this one. Yes, it's all the same. No, it has nothing original. Yes, it's about a little group of teenagers going in the woods to camp, drink and have sex. Yes, they get killed one by one by a maniac. And you know what? It's just magic!

Having just got the "Loony Tunes Golden Collection"(which i HIGHLY recommend, by the way), I'm going to try to comment on most if not all of the cartoons individually. As such the starting statement might seem redundant for those whom read multiple reviews of them, for this i apologize.Rabbit Seasoning is the middle short in a trilogy of like-minded shorts (the other two being "Rabbit Fire" and "Duck! Rabbit, Duck). Bags and Daffy argue about who Elmer Fudd should short. It makes me laugh EVERY SINGLE TIME!!!

comeundone , I love you ! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this book. I did not enjoy it at all. In the beginning I kept wondering what the author wanted to achieve with this novel. But in the end I came to the conclusion that she just wrote her story. It's not an interesting story at all. She should just have written in her diary, that would have given her the same satisfaction. I really liked the first chapter of her diary, that is how the book should have been written.

This is definitely an excellent show . I do n't have cable , so I started renting them , because I wanted to own them. This is not a show you can miss. Forgot to add that when I rent a DVD, I do it from the Redbox at Walmart. But if I had to buy these, I would definitely buy the DVD, because you can watch and rewatch it. Great DVDs. I love this DVD. It keeps me glued to it. I can't wait to get home from work to watch it. It is a wonderful show.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer (exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle) being driven by a man hoping to sell him a story for an upcoming play. However, there is a bad storm and their car becomes stuck in the mud and so they are forced to look for some place to spend the night. Fortunately, there's a mansion nearby though it seems pretty odd that the people inside know the writer and he says he didn't realize this was the home of a man he knew (and despised).

"The Cell" is a rather difficult film to classify. If you read the plot outline, "a psychotherapist journeys inside a comatose serial killer in the hopes of saving his latest victim", you might think it's a thriller with a touch of science fiction. But that doesn't really do this movie justice. There is a fantasy aspect within the sub-conscious minds that is stunning, with lavish visuals and incredible mind-tripping scenarios. There is drama as the aforementioned psychotherapist (played by Lopez prior to her becoming a solely romantic comedy component) makes contact with the child within and witnesses his terrifying upbringing.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script, good camera work and transitions, good directing to handle some twists in the plot, good editing to keep the flow constant, and good acting. George Sanders is suave and witty. Jonathan Hale simply is Inspector Fernack. Paul Guilfoyle plays a mobster who goes straight (and drinks milk) because he cannot take the pressure. He will return in a later entry in the series. Story begins on an ocean liner headed to the U.S. where the Saint meets but cannot connect with Wendie Barrie.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance, women-on-the-verge psychodrama, work place sexual harassment, adultery, and fashion. It's all there. Typical characters found in corporate America. Joan Crawford is the usual long time employee bitch executive who feels the need to be such because she's with the big boys. Hope Lange is the entry level ambitious employee whose determined to get to the top by using her mind and not her body. Their personal lives is the subplot. Wardrobe for the film is great but someone forgot to tell Stephen Boyd's hairstylist that "a little dab will do ya!"

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter's voice, there is that old familiar feeling of 70's blues. What an overwhelmingly beautiful and mature voice she had. Cynthia Gibb cast in the title role does a good job, however, I thought Karen Allen would have been a better choice. This is a tearjerker movie that does a fine job of presenting the professional careers of Karen and Richard but also the personal struggles that Karen dealt with and her disease. The recording sessions in Herp Albert's studio are very nicely done.

This is the best movie I have ever seen. It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. And a deep friendship that not even war can destroy.The most splendid casting I have ever seen. Patrick Swayze and James Read were top grade in this movie.If you see part 1 you will want to see it all. Some of my friends watched part of the movie at my home then went out and bought the movie.I am a civil war buff but this movie got my grandchildren interested in history. Any movie that can get children to learn history is great.

"Two Hands" is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life, surreal life, comedy, tragedy and love the Australians have developed on their own.Heath Ledger is basically a good if naive guy. Wanting to get on he falls in with a local "Big" Man Pando (Bryan Brown). But at the very moment he sets a first toe on the dark path to crime he meets Alex (Rose Byrne). Here is the cause of the error to change his life in ways unexpected.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short . Every element of the piece assists in eliciting the right feelings and emotions . I really like it and will be listening again soon. The reader is superb. Well done both of you for a fine collaboration. This story was great, I loved it! Thank you. It was very sweet. Well that was nice, simple and lovely. I like it. Thanks for stopping by and leaving your comment. I'll have to check it out. It sounds interesting. Thanks for visiting me and leaving your comment.

George Cuckor , known as a director of women , could n't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful leads in this production that opened on the Royal stage on Saturday. Helen Haye as the widow and Mary Ellis as the secretary are perfect, and their playing makes the first act full of delight. Their acting in the dialogue of Act II, in which the play takes a downward curve, is even better than in the first act. It is so natural and so true. They are a credit to themselves. Ellis is a little girl, but she is a woman.

i love this show ! it is amazing ... i can never miss an episode even if i 've already seen it ...i hope the second season will be just as good ...
Posted by: leo1982 | May 14, 2008 at 02:46 PM
I just love the show - I am so excited it has been renewed! I have never been so enthralled by the stories as I have been with the ones told here! I just hope they continue the stories from season one as the show has just started to take shape with all the great characters and their stories.

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made ..... Realistic . Movies were not candy coated in those day . It was more like the world we live in. I was born in 55. And the culture of America was different then. This movie represents a slice of American life I remember. A slice I do not remember with a positive light . But still a part of who I am today. I would not change the way of life we had then for anything in the world now. My life was different because of it .....

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult . To say that is even more of a reason to love it is just a fact. This film is so different and unique compared to almost any other animated film that it really deserves a place on this site in my opinion. For some, it may be a bit too weird or creepy, but personally, I really loved how different it was from a typical Disney movie. I would definitely recommend it to anyone with children, or for adults that just want something a bit different from a Disney animation.

My taste in films continues to astound me and probably infuriate readers of my reviews but to each their own I say. I'm not sure why, but sometimes the best films are not the best reviewed, which is the case here. I've probably watched this film three times over the last 5 years and each time I find myself entranced by it. I feel like this is a classic film I want to take every opportunity I can to watch it. The story is a simple one. A girl moves to Hollywood from a small town to pursue her dreams of making it big.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe . Notice how some of the Roman sets look very familiar. They were all re-used again in the 1960s for some Hercules movies and a couple of Spartacus movies! An epic story of Rome as told in three episodes. 1) The Gates of Hell. 2) The Sword and the Cross
3) The Sign of the Gladiator
Ancient Rome is at the crossroads of its history. An army of fierce Germanic warriors led by the treacherous Attila the Hun are invading Italy.

I saw the Messiah:- The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes I have seen, ever. It was one of those programmes that you think that oh, no, I cannot watch the rest of this but you feel compelled to watch it just to see who done it. Jamie Draven was an absolutely amazing actor in it, to be able to switch between two totally, totally different characters one of which is the evil, nasty person that did it and the other person who is Jez Clifton, the cop.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really don't approve of pornography all that much. pornography has a useful purpose in society(can't say i can always think of one)but it probably does.personal viewpoints set aside, i really thought this film was pretty funny. i didn't buy this movie because it was pornography, i bought it because i am one of those 'Alice' obsessives who will watch anything about 'Alice in Wonderland'. i own just about every version there is on DVD so it was an obvious choice to complete my DVD collection with this.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time. We loved it so much. It was the only show about Black middle class families on t.v. at the time. Please release this on DVD. I know many...many people who still talk about the show. If it its released i am certain that many black youth will find this enlightening as well as interesting. The show addressed many topics from racism, intra-race discrimination, teen pregnancy, sibling rivalry, single parenting, peer-pressure and much more.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80 's on network T.V . I think I was like 9. My mom was watching this movie. I never really got it, but I wanted to. So, one day, she bought the dvd. I watched it for the first time with my sister this past week and we just loved it. I got so into it that I ended up watching it all the next day. Yes. It is that good. It's a great film. I love it. It makes you feel so many different emotions throughout it.

I must say it was a let down . Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the character . The story is simple yet great and you will enjoy it as a whole . What I felt was there was something missing in the whole film . It felt like it was trying to be too much of many things yet failing to be one. It could have been a better film if the story line could have been different. Overall it was nice to see a film with a great actress and an amazing direction.

Onstage John Osborne's adaptation of "Picture of Dorian Gray" is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde's talents as both novelist and playwright.On screen with some editing it becomes a bit sloppy due to the cutting of 3 crucial scenes from the play (one being an important scene between Basil and Henry showing that time has passed. )The acting however is brilliant. Sir john Gielgud return's to his Wilde roots as lord Henry,and although about a decade too old for the role,he totally becomes the enigmatic,life loving cad and cynic that Wilde brought to life so meticulously in his novella.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons , Elmer Fudd is out hunting , and Daffy tries to talk him out of shooting . " Don't worry , Daffy , my gun doesn't shoot that fast." Daffy asks, " How fast does it shoot?" "Well , I don't know exactly , but I can show you." And so he does , he cocks the rifle , pulls the trigger ....
....and Daffy disappears. The lesson here being that the gun did not fire , it had only been pretending to shoot , just like Obama and Hillary Clinton .

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight , he lives in this burned down old hotel , where eight teenagers go there to get some money and get drunk and have sex. Kane finds out that the teenagers are all horny , and has sex with each one. They find Kane and he tries to kill them but fails and kills himself instead. The teenagers survive but get infected with a virus that kills everyone that gets infected , the teenagers must find the cure , and kill Kane before everyone dies . Kane is an okay movie , it has some good kills but doesn't have much blood in it .

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80 's inbred/backwood slash-fest. There are no such qualities present in the film. In this film, two brothers, one of whom has been in a psych ward for 8 years following a brutal killing spree that almost wiped out their family, escapes and returns home to find out just who the killer actually was. Along the way, his brother and some of his old friends join him and they set out, in an effort to stop the brother and stop his killing spree.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld,after ELR and after Friends. Those three sitcoms were the star shows of their time.KOQs came at the end of this special time in TV. But don't let that dissuade you.King of Queens is as good if not better than two of the three mentioned.Seinfeld started it all and was and is a timeless classic.
