I never laughed so hard than I did at Seinfeld. But KOQs comes real close.When it comes to laughing, I have to rate KOQs second only to Seinfeld.

Robin Hood : Men in Tights ( 1993 ) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks . He has been making these films for almost forty years and they have not been all that memorable. I guess I just got so fed up with his antics by this time. There are some funny moments in Men in Tights but it does have a very long set up. I think Brooks was trying to create a modern version of his old silent films by making the film black and white with no music and using the same old actors. I guess that was the point.

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great movie, it is a little long but the acting from the three girls is fantastic , their chemistry is charming. I love this film , it's funny and smart. A film that is worth watching over and over again. I love this movie. The film has a good plot , some really great drama. This is one of my favorites. If you are looking for a good movie to rent this is a great one. We can't say enough about this video.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is. This is the true story of one woman and one man and their quest for happiness amid the dull, rote life of a housewife and "man of the house". It could be any couple, any family, in any town... but that's what makes the story so moving. It touches each of us in some way and reminds us of someone we know and love, or of ourselves. I laughed, I cried, I couldn't stop thinking about it... and what more could you ask for from a film, really?

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made, they lack the depth, and just not worth our time.The trailer of "Nasaan ka man" caught my attention, my daughter in law's and daughter's so we took time out to watch it this afternoon. The movie exceeded our expectations. The cinematography was very good, the story beautiful and the acting awesome. Jericho Rosales was really very good, so's Claudine Barretto. The fact that I despised Diether Ocampo proves he was effective at his role.

*spoiler* *spoilers* *spoilers* I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it,I laughed a lot so the bottom line is that I recommend the film.However I have problems with what LaBute wanted to say.The plot is very simple.Betty(Renee Zellweger), a hard life house wife watch her husband being murdered and while having forgotten everything she had seen,she follow her "true love" for a soap series character,Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear). Simple enough but not enough to hold a 95 minutes film.

North and South is a miniseries from the "golden age" of television miniseries in the 1980s, which was a time for long, sweeping epics with high production values and lots of star cameos. It is, for the most part, excellent for what it is, although I personally prefer the less soap-opera like elements of the story and the overall sense of history.James Read and Patrick Swayze deliver excellent performances--especially Read, whose George Hazard serves as kind of an emotional anchor in the midst of the often melodramatic story.

Gosh, I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again 20 years later you gain a different view -- primarily because in 20 years you learn more. For example, I had no idea who George Cukor was - how great of a director he was and how much of that made this film fly. All I can say is..I really liked this film for it touched on an area that paralleled my life: lifelong friendship between two women. Can that EVER exist?

It 's interesting to watch how late 1950 's society is depicted in this film . Men are lecherous , women are obsessed by fashion and beauty and in the background the threat of communism ( the red scare ). It has been described as the first of the great anti-war films and there are some interesting moments of irony and satire in the story , as in the scene where two soldiers , one black and one white are sharing the same foxhole in the movie . Glenn Close makes her film debut in this movie in the role of a young girl suffering from amnesia in a small town in the mid 1950 's .

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say `` french culture '' . This movie has really touched me . It's not only a movie, it's a life, it's emotions. This movie talks about three brothers who lost there mother in an accident . The older brother is the only one to care about the other two brothers . At the beginning, the little one ( who's name is Raphael ) is crying , so his older brother Raphael does what he can do in order to make his older brother stop crying.

This movie just might make you cooooo . The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town . Betty and Barney Hill's story has to be on the top ten true stories about Ufos that ever took place in the USA . There are a lot of reasons why I love the story . And not the least of which it's a TRUE STORY . Yes there are other Ufo and alien visitations stories that are well worth a read . Yet this one has a lot of interesting aspects . First of which is the fact that they actually got away from their captors and drove home in New Hampshire .

It has been recorded that John Ford made the "big, blockbuster" movies so that he could afford to make the "small" movies that he loved so well. Wagon Master, with a young Ben Johnson, is clearly one of his best, if not the best of his small movies. The location shooting, the wagons, the intricate work with horses, and the inclusion of the plains Indian are all trade marks of Ford. As in many of his other films, Eisenstein, the great Russian director's influence is seen in this film.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a good future for this society. I want to say that we all should join hand in this great effort and bring a great change to our society. Wishing a great success ahead. Such a wonderful initiative, it’s the need of hour. This looks like such a great project and I wish you all success with it! Thank you for the encouraging words Shalini. This is an ongoing initiative and we are still in our nascent stage. Thank you once again for your support.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks . Marjorie Main ( Ma ) steals the show as the bubbly loving farmer's wife. Pa was played by Percy Kilbride. It was a great family series from the early fifties. "Ma" Kettle had 9 children and Pa 5 sons with 4 different women. Ma would try and control them all. At the end of the movie they would end up being evicted from the farm because of the taxes. They would wind up in a small town with a few problems there too. This movie is great.

I just started watching The Show around July . I found it by mistake , I was channel surfing during a thunderstorm . The Show was showing on a local channel 23 and I just stopped and sat down to watch it. I was a little skeptical at first, thinking maybe it's another one of those paranormal series like Ghost Hunters. But it was really cool and I got caught up and I had to watch the whole first season and now I am watching Season Two and it's even more interesting. Thanks! Glad to have you along on this wild ride.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I’ve been wanting to watch it again for a while. I just picked up a used DVD copy on ebay. I just started watching it. It’s one of those movies that I’m glad I have seen but probably would have enjoyed a lot more when I was a kid. Last night, my wife and I started watching the remake. So far I’m not a big fan of the movie. It seems a bit slow and uninteresting.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released. The controversy that surrounded the original release (teen nudity, physical intimacy and unwed pregnancy) were subjects that never touched our view of the film. We were close to the same age as Paul and Michelle and were experiencing many of the same intense and confusing emotions. We were too young to get caught up in the simplistic (at times) acting and the corny (at times) emotional twists. This movie spoke to us in a way that an adult love story never could have.

In Mississippi, the former blues man Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) is in crisis, missing his wife that has just left him. He finds the town slut and nymphomaniac Rae (Chritina Ricci) dumped on the road nearby his little farm, drugged, beaten and almost dead. Lazarus brings her home, giving medicine and nursing and nourishing her like a father, keeping her chained to control her heat. When her boyfriend Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) is discharged from the army due to his anxiety issue, he misunderstands the relationship of Lazarus and Rae, and tries to kill him.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed . Very funny and the production quality is outstanding . It is very interesting to watch and enjoyable. It is a fun watch. I would watch this again and definitely recommend it to my friends. I hope they have more to come. 22 of 22 people found this review helpful. Was this review helpful to you? 20 of 22 people found this review helpful. Was this review helpful to you? 30 of 40 people found this review helpful. Was this review helpful to you? 23 of 23 people found this review helpful.

The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series on TV ever , and that includes Planet Earth . Planet Earth will be shown on this channel soon . Yes , I'm looking forward to the return of this series ! The only thing missing is David Attenborough and the music of Hans Zimmer ! I have all of these on DVD already, but I think they will look even better on HD . Though I have to say that The Blue Planet is my favorite series .

Hmm , is it right to compare Tiffani Thiessen and Mark-Paul Gosselaar 's post Saved By The Bell acting ? I mean both are so cute , funny and hot ... But I don't know which one is better ? I know that they're both married now. But what was the relationship between them like during the years of Saved by the Bell? Who would make a better mom? I'm thinking she's a great one already but she would make a good one. Was Mark Paul Gosselaar and Tiffani Thiessen Dating? Why did Mark-Paul Gosselaar (Zack Morris) never get together with Kelly?

This is a really great film ! It gets you thinking about your parents . How we all have fragile relationships with them when we are young adults . And then as we become parents it becomes a cycle . In this film we see how one son has a hard time accepting his mothers new husband . He has just left his long term boyfriend , who is the father of the sons baby . This son is trying to find himself , and not sure where he belongs . He is not happy in his life , but is not ready to accept the help of a therapist or a friend .

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration (and music). I'll do each one separately:Nicolas Roeg (dir)--Giuseppe Verdi (music). A story about an assassination attempt in 1931 Vienna. Theresa Russell (Roegs wife) plays a man! Not bad--very beautiful and exotic. Russell is great.Charles Sturridge--Verdi. No story but there is some haunting black and white imagery that fits perfectly with the music.Jean-Luc Godard--Jean Baptiste Lully. Horrendous. Pointless, boring, no plot, no nothing.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger, and I really remember liking it. However, I didn't have great taste back then (not to say that I do now) so I can't vouch for my nine-year-old self too well. The movie was probably a 7/10 but it had some good music so I gave it an extra point. Yeah, worth watching. I know that some fans of this movie are wondering what a certain song is - the one that appears when she is in the car crash.

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood years of this series, its coming to DVD was a blessing for all time. North and South truly is a series about friendship,love,honor... you name your own list of feelings you get from watching this series. I can still remember the first time I caught a glimpse of this series on TV when I was about 8 years old. I though wow this looks exciting. To bad I never had the chance to see book one and two on TV in the Netherlands.

This one started excellently. The photography and audio are the best I've experienced in years (okay, months). Especially the use of 'warm' and 'cold' colours in single sequences is astonishing. Also, making Jennifer Lopez whisper most of her lines is an idea in itself, but I'm not sure what Singh wants to accomplish with that.Now for the minuses. The screenplay was awful. Lopez's part turned out to be irrelevant or totally worthless to the plot. She seemed to star the movie only to sell herself and the pic. The three beds seemed just too obvious.

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old . I knew nothing about the story line except that this was the first movie in which Audrey Hepburn had appeared. I had forgotten the fact that it was a remake of the 1938 classic, which was made on the same set as the 1953 version, with the same screenplay but with different actors. The only actor in common was Cathleen Nesbitt as Mrs. Wilkins. Anyway, it is a delightful movie, a wonderful romp through Paris and a bit of history too.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking . I 'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and see a new way of life
I really liked this film, although I admit I didn't expect much. However, I was really pleasantly surprised at how deep it went, and I think it's a very good starting point for further education and reflection about the world we're living in today. It was very enlightening to see that there is more to life than consumerism, materialism, and being the first person in line.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world as secretaries. This follows the same idea as THREE COINS IN A FOUNTAIN a few years before. This takes place in New York while COINS takes place in Rome, Italy. Our three beauties are Hope Lange, in her first starring role, Suzy Parker and Diane Baker. Lange does well and holds her own opposite some strong veterans in the business, namely Joan Crawford. Suzy plays an obsessive woman who has a hard time losing her beau.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old,(having an existing interest in Egyptology). I know that there are subtle mistakes to the art direction and costuming, but over all this is the best film, to date with the look of the 18th dynasty.The film only approximates Mika Walteri's "The Egyptian", in plot. A good portion of the text never made it to film, as we have to consider the running length.The music score by B. Hermann and Alfred Newman is beautiful!!! Performances as follows.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game. When he meets and falls for an attractive local girl she helps him realize he has a shot at a 'full ride' scholarship if he plays well.All too often, these dramas fall into formulaic traps and tell the same old story of a troubled and confused teen. FULL RIDE's Matt Sabo certainly fits this profile, but below the surface is a much more unique individual than we usually see in this genre.

The philosophical, meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind. I'd give it 10 stars for that alone. That being said, though, what hit me with particular force was what I take, possibly incorrectly, to be its Art Direction. Many of the interior shots feature a rich concoction of color blends seemingly based on very understated Munsell Color Model progressions and complementary juxtapositions. This makes the movie probably unrealistic to contemporary eyes, but, to me, very beautiful as an aesthetic work in itself.

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old. I loved it then and still do. The ensemble cast is great - in those days the actors acted "naturally" and you "felt" for them in the respective roles. A "glossy" film of the period -the relationships therein still relevant to today's world but now the sexes are on the same level, women would not or should not allow the type of treatment displayed in the past. The soundtrack music is wonderful and it is a delight that Film Score Monthly released the CD in January, 2005.

See No Evil With Kane. The Movie Has a great storyline But it just wasn't a Hide my eye's, Scream Out Loud Horror Flick I thought it was going to be from watching the WWE Superstars on Monday Night Raw When The Movie First Came To Theaters. I Did ENJOY The Movie Though I Loved The Story It Played Out.GREAT MOVIE EXCELLENT WOULD LIKE TO SEE A PART 2 It Doesn't Matter If Kane Gets Killed At The EndOr Not They Have Killed Off Other Horror Stars In Every Movie They Have Out And They Still Comeback For More So a part 2 wouldBe Very Interesting.

I wanted to watch this, to get a inside look at the show. It told the story more of Robin Williams, then Mork & Mindy. Still, thought it was great. We got to see, Robin always being 'on', no matter what. The performance of Diamontopolous was awesome.The introductions of the main players, seem so real to me. Roebuck as Garry Marshall was wonderful. He was so charming in this, which helped me get through all the Williams energy. The little behind the scenes pieces of his other shows (Happy Days, and Laverne & Shirley), was enlightening.

A classic late 50's film. The superannuated headliners (Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan) are not at their best, but the direction, cinematography, and acting of the younger cast are compelling. In a 50's sense (which I love).The look and feel of the artsy (over-artsy?) contemporary film "Far from heaven" reflects exactly this sort of film (and I suspect this film may be one of the models). A silly plot, of course (hey, it's 1959! ), but as a film-- glorious!

After getting hooked on the mini series , `` North & South , '' I could hardly wait for the mini series to come to an end. It took so long that I've forgotten a lot of what was in it, but now I get to find out and see if my memories are true or false. I really think I will enjoy seeing this series unfold again, it was very well done the first time round and this time, I think it will be even better. It's a very good story, well acted and well written.

Sure, it has its pretentious moments, it plays like art-house, live-action Fantasia, but it also has moments of deep beauty and humor. Omnibus films are always a problem, but I have always had a keen interest in them. I will now rate the segments individually.Nicolas Roeg - "Un ballo in maschera" - This segment may very well spoil the film for some people, because it is absolutely the worst of the whole bunch. It is difficult to follow, mostly because it tries to adhere to a clear plot (a hackneyed one, at that).

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year. It was a truly moving experience. I had heard of the Truth and Reconcilliation process, but as others have written, did not know much about the details of the process. This film demonstrated the process and the growth that can occur when people are able to face up to their pasts, understand the events from the points of view of others involved, and grieve together. Archbishop Tutu and the others involved in developing the T & R process deserve recognition for their understanding of human emotions.

It's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it's an enjoyable little film with a great sense of humour; but on the other, it just lacks a certain something that ensures the film never reaches above it's boundary that keeps it trapped within the merely 'interesting' territory. That being said, Two Hands is a well plotted film that excellently juggles several stories at the same time, which allows several small climaxes throughout the movie, and that in turn helps to stop the film becoming boring.

I haven't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater, and I have been searching for it since. At the time I was 12 and the story excited me; and NOW, the ending eludes me. It was young love that engrossed me the most, not to mention John's vocals and Taupin's lyrics. The story (at the time) hit home to my psyche. I am a lover of sentimental movies and this still hangs in my head after 35 years- it is that good. Place yourself at adolescent age and let your fantasies run.

I was expecting this movie to suck, but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film. Most of the death scenes are adequately brutal. The teens are decent, with Penny McNamee definitely the best of the bunch. Rachael Taylor looks like a young Christie Brinkley, but doesn't bring much to the movie other than that. Kane was good as the killer, and is totally believable as a fearsome juggernaut. I saw the "twist" coming from miles away, but I still enjoyed the movie.But what really stood out to me was the direction.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award. And I have to say, it was well deserved because Boy Next Door is a very funny short film! The script is well written and keeps things escalating. It also has a great current of suspense coursing through it. You don't know what's going to happen next as the main character tries to deal with the realization that his new neighbor might not be the most ideal person to be living across from him. The jokes are quick and unexpected.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much . This is one of the best adaptations in recent years and it was so well done that I often feel that it was better than the book. The only thing I would change is the scene at the end , it should not have been so abrupt and more time should have been given for the story to develop . Other than that it is superb. The actors all did a fantastic job especially the actor playing Draco. It is a tragic love story and well worth a watch and I am sure that you will enjoy it too.

This was on odd film . I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. I really liked how this movie has a very similar premise to the movie Up! In that, the lead character is an average guy (not an extraordinary one), and the only thing that makes the main character unique and special is that the only friend he has is his dog. I loved the movie, it was so funny, it was a very light-hearted and happy movie, it was a feel good movie that I would definitely watch again.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western , given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social history into it. We’re in the days of lynch mobs and the Ku Klux Klan in Texas in 1935 when a black cowboy, Waco Kid (played by the legendary Jim Carrey) rides into town on his trusty steed “Bullet”, having escaped a lynch mob. When he finds out that his wife and child were abused to death by the KKK in retaliation for the murder of a Klan member, he sets out for revenge.

"Side Show" is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures. Very gory in some places, but not as shocking as the Trailer makes it out to be (The Trailer for this movies shows all the gory parts). Also, the acting and visual effects are well done. I would recommend this movie to horror fans everywhere.8 out of 10Fans of Horror Movies like this should Check out Puppet Master, Skinned Alive, Slumber Party Massacre, Sleep Away Camp, and other Full Moon Pictures flicks.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew , a narrative depth superior to most novels , wonderful music , an exciting storyline and brilliant special effects . The film also boasts one of the most memorable and enduring movie soundtracks . It is, simply, the best movie ever made . This was a big hit at my house! We all enjoyed it. I liked this movie a lot. We're gonna wait a while before reading the next one though. Some of the stuff was a little bit scary for me. You should see this movie. You will love it!

Believe it or not, the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once, and was missing for nearly two years. In 1911, Leonardo da Vinci's 'La Gioconda' (better known as the Mona Lisa) was taken from the Louvre by a petty thief (and former Louvre employee) who allegedly sought to return the world's most famous piece of art to its native Italy. His actions after the theft make it seem more likely that he intended to sell the painting for his personal profit. (Of course, he had no hope of finding a buyer.)

I don't usually like to see movies while they're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I saw a poster for Some Things That Stay and I thought, "that young actress looks intelligent and mysterious, not like the usual blonde teenybopper BS". So I decided to take the plunge and see this movie on it's opening night. I must tell you, I was happily surprised. I went to this film with no expectations. I didn't really know what it would be about, but the raw emotion and honest teenage experiences expressed by Katie Boland left me feeling rather satisfied with my decision.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert, and its influence on them is obvious: in the dialogue, locations, photography, direction and political philosophy. The photography is notably confident. The direction is stylish and for the most part well done. If you liked the early Australian films by Bruce Beresford, Peter Weir and George Miller then you'll love "Oz". The direction also reminds this reviewer of Edgar Wright's contemporary work. That similarity suggests that "Oz" was far ahead of its time.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration ( and music ) . I’ve just watched them all and thought they’re amazing. I’ve not watched them all, but so far there are a couple of masterpieces and most are excellent. Here’s the short trailer to whet your appetite. I’ll be posting about each one here in turn as I watch them, and there are also links in the comments below where I’ve found reviews, interviews, and some clips in case you can’t wait to watch them.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature does n't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with plenty of exciting adventure sequences. In the beginning, the Ranger is in New Orleans on the trail of the Butcher boys, a trio of outlaws who killed an innocent man. The Ranger catches up with the Butchers as they are trying to sell a shipment of dynamite, and a fight ensues. The Ranger is badly wounded and is cared for by a kindly black doctor. During his recuperation, he is visited by his old friend Captain Reid, who brings him up to date on recent happenings.

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest, most clever, sharp-witted, sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I've ever watched, (second only to my most favorite television show of all time, F*R*I*E*N*D*S). The quick pace and many pop-culture references can leave some viewers confused, but once you catch on to the ways of the Gilmores, you'll be hooked for life. Just some random comments, I recently (finally) began watching Season 6 and wow! It's one of my favorite seasons so far.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school basketball game by his senior year's coach, the school's new vice-principal, the high school basketball commissioner, and his principal, all of whom have a personal stake in ensuring he makes the team. It is not long into the film when it becomes apparent, that he'll only make it on the team, when he proves himself to them, that his life outside of basketball is just as important as his time playing basketball.

Usually, Alan Alda plays characters that are too "soft" and overly verbal -- it's probably how he really lives. This time, he fits the character. Though he overacts when the verdict is being delivered.The 1971 Attica Prison Riot and the State of New York's response is remembered by many of us as a terrifying event. Only a few journalists have told the true story. This film provides a quick look at the horrors and excesses associated with the Attica riot/revolt. Attica had a major impact on this country.

The "Hunting Trilogy" of Rabbit Fire (1951), Rabbit Seasoning (1952), and Duck! Rabbit! Duck! (1953) should be considered the comedic high water mark of the Chuck Jones-Michael Maltese collaboration. While they are seldom mentioned in lists of the "greatest" or "most important" cartoons in the history of animation, they are certainly THE FUNNIEST cartoons I've ever seen. Michael Maltese never got the credit that directors like Jones, Freleng or Avery got, but it's his dialogue and situations that make Warner Bros. cartoons, and these three in particular, some of the FUNNIEST ever made.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary , it is obviously a labor of love and it is obvious that it was made for the sake of those who need to see the story. I also want to thank you, the readers of my review, for not being a bunch of morons (like the commenters at Youtube), and to give this review a fair chance. This is one of those times where you have to go into a movie knowing nothing about it, and this is especially important when it concerns something as controversial as this.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way ! ! When I first tuned in to America 's Next Top Model it was purely for the drama. But after a few shows I became addicted to the fashion and the amazing contestants. It has some of the most beautiful, unique and creative models in the world ! ! I wish there was a male version of this show. All of these men are perfect in every way and I'm pretty sure they would be just as good in front of the camera as they were on it. So who's your favorite?!

Being an avid Carpenter Fan, I really loved this film (although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired!) and agree with many of the comments, that certain areas of her life were absent or not touched on. Whatever - it leaves your curiosity well and truly unsatisfied, so off I went to discover more. I must recommend a book by Ray Coleman - Carpenters - The Untold Story. The book is an intelligent read and unlike the film, is 'real' and down to earth. I hope you enjoy it. I remember Cynthia Gibb from her days in Fame and Gypsy.

There are many film now on DVD, but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers. The Egyptian, along with El Cid and other favorites of the era of the wide screen, big budget epics had merit. Many people from my generation learn a lot about history of Egypt, medieval Spain and even the Incas, (The first time I heard from them was a very cheap adventure movie with Charlton Heston called The Treasure of the Incas), same happened to me with Egypt, or Rome seen many "bad" epics of the era.

This movie has a lot to recommend it. The paintings, the music, and David Hewlett's naked butt are all gorgeous! The plot, a story of redemption, forgiveness, and courage in the face of adversity is also very interesting and touching -- and it's not predictable, which is saying quite a lot about a movie in this day and age. But, the acting is mediocre, the direction is confusing, and the script is just odd. It often felt like it was trying to be a parody, but I never figured out what it was trying to be parody *of*.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16 . Now the daughter is married and has three children. The mom has three children and she is married to her high school crush. This show has all the twists and turns anyone could want . If you love a good laugh you should watch this show. This show is so cute and very funny! It is a good family series to watch together as a family or to just watch by yourself!! I love the Gilmore girls! It was such an amazing TV series and it was a big part of my life.

Fantastic documentary. A movie within a movie. I'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother's death. Makes one wonder about the time and money spent in therapy. What might have happened if she didn't have that outlet? Did the therapist help her or just foster a dependency that kept his bank account flush? The audience needs to understand that divorce was less of an option in those days. She was a housewife - went to therapy instead of going to college or job training. She seemed to feel trapped by the situation.

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and making a movie that gets funnier each time you watch it.The first time I saw this, I cried from laughing so hard. Everything about it is funny.While "Robin Hood: Men In Tights" is not my favorite comedy (that spot is taken by "Real Genius"), it ranks way up there in my book. So go see it! If you don't spend the whole time laughing, then at least you'll spend the whole time drooling over Cary Elwes.

If you want to see a movie with nudity , sex , drugs , alcohol , brutal beating of a human , then this one's the one to see . If you are easily offended by any of these, please do not watch this . I think that the best part of this movie is the way the killer gets away from the police after he has killed 5 people and his own brother . I recommend this movie . Labels: movie, movies, review, reviews, The Butterfly Effect
I really don't like horror movies, the more I watch the more I can't sleep at night.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie. They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to shine. In particular, the way Candice pronounces the words "Puerto Rican" is very funny, as she is being kind as she can be but condescending at the same time. I had seen the original of this movie, called "Old Acquaintance", starring Bette Davis and Miriam Hopkins. They allegedly did not get along, so because the movie is about female friendship, that might have been a problem. Here, the actresses clearly admire and respect each other.

There's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster, Sergeant Rutledge, and The Sun Shines Bright. It was these three films with no box office names in them that Ford didn't have to tailor the film around the persona of a star being it John Wayne, Henry Fonda, or any of the others he worked with. Not surprising that Ford considered all these as favorites of one kind or another. Ben Johnson and Harry Carey, Jr. a couple of likable cowpokes sign on to guide a Mormon wagon train to a valley in Arizona territory.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much. The theme was well handled by the Director with great performances from Shabana Azmi, Konkana Sen and well supported by good performances from the other cast. The climax was built well but for the ending which was a far from being called "Good". We are still trying to understand what was the Director trying to convey? Were they short of ideas or was the ending beyond the understanding of common movie lovers? A better ending would have created a lasting impression on the audience and increased the viewer-ship.

Based on Mika Waltari 's Book , This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color , beautiful landscapes and fine acting especially by Lana Turner. In this film Lana played the title character who is a strong willed maiden but also a snake charmer who has the power to turn a man's head at the very sight of her. She is betrothed to a king, played by Charles Coburn and he is very jealous about his fiancee's relationship to the snake charmer, played by Edmund Purdom, so he forbids the marriage of the two.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom , which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of the young generation. I was very young at the time, and it was my first job, which I thought was quite cool. It was a series about a couple of young lads trying to get on with things in life. We filmed for about 8 months. It was quite long in its run, which I thought was a brilliant move, as it gave the audience the chance to get to know the lads.

It 's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it 's either 1 or 5 so I went out to buy it anyways and it was actually a good movie. It was full of action and I think it should be more 4 or 4.5 stars for me. The movie is good but the actors are a little too young. I think they could of found more mature actors for the role and I don 't think that the actors fit in the movie like they were supposed to be.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest . In many ways it is like a cross between a comedy and a drama , with a little bit of romance thrown in too . I thought the performances were excellent , with all three main characters giving outstanding performances , with a special mention for the lovely Jessica Brown Findlay . There was also some really nice cinematography , with some great shots of the city of Paris . I loved this film , and even though the title might make it sound like a bit of an odd one , it was really entertaining and very sweet .

I love this film (dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish, and entirely irrelevant name! ), I spent 8 months in Barcelona, not as an Erasmus student but living with other foreigners, so it felt just the same. It brings back so many great memories of the fun I had with all the friends I made from different countries, and of the city itself. I really want to see the followup 'Les Poupees Russes ' (the Russian Dolls), I'm guessing it wont be released here?

I like movies that show real people "Americans" and tell truth. The movie is simple and that seems to be the great thing about it. It played here in Norway fine (Amazon says above that it's USA/Canda but the box states "All Regions". I have to say it is not for the American viewers. It played in here in World Raw Views, a theater. I saw it and later I ordered it. The cut was different and much better. See it and you will like it or maybe hate it.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie. My teen-agers enjoyed it over the holidays. Is it 100% accurate and is it a little sappy in places? Yes..but it took my kids away from the computer and play station to spend four nights watching it all.The battle scenes were impressive and we met plenty of historical characters throughout. Lloyd Bridges as Jefferson Davis and Hal Holbrook as Abraham Lincoln stand out. We all thought Phillip Casnoff as Bent was evilly and charmingly brilliant. We all thought Charles stole the show from Orry and George.We will enjoy the movie again!

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film's main achievements. When you hear a vague outline of the story  Erasmus students of mixed nationalities sharing a flat in Barcelona  you predict a collection of Euro-stereotypes in a farcical tangle. Pas du tout! In fact, it's a finely judged comedy about a young Frenchman, Xavier, trying to make sense of human relationships. There are some excellently observed minor roles (the arrogant French neurologist, the insufferably irrepressible brother of the English girl, Xavier's forlorn mother) and some fine visual humour, especially in the opening scenes mocking the bureacratic complexity of the application procedure.

George Cuckor, known as a director of women, couldn't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women for his last film. Itself a remake of Bette Davis' campy "Old Acquaintance" written by John Van Druten, this film is definitely dated, but still delightful.Bergen and Bisset sparkle as best friends who compete at everything, but manage to remain friends. Liz Hamilton (Bisset) is a "serious" writer, intellectual, and elegant. She meets her lifelong best friend Merry Noel at an exclusive girls school and they begin a lifetime of not always friendly competition.

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney , Australia , following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old Scott to get money to pay off his drug debts. His only options are his father , a man with no scruples and a violent temper , who has just returned after a ten year prison sentence ; Scott's mother , who abandoned the family years ago and who has just had a child by a man she met after Scott's father left ; and a local king pin of the drug world , who has already threatened to kill Scott to protect his interests.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound affect on me then. I saw in again about a year ago (I am now 29) and it still moved me in similar ways. This is a great movie that personifies the struggle of "principle vs. pragmistism". Voight's character is the idealist teacher that won't give in to any psuedo-racist leanings of the Superintendent, Mr. Skeffington. That story also personifies the struggle of how older people often resist change, and more specifically, cultural change.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years . I rate it one of the funniest shows on tv. If you don’t know about the show here is a little overview of the show:
After 23 years of marriage, Doug Hefler’s wife Carrie is convinced that he is having an affair. With Carrie constantly accusing him, Doug is at the end of his rope. The only thing keeping Doug alive is his dream of winning the lottery and buying a house away from Queens.

I'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of Black Snake Moan. It's not about black/white relationships or old/young relationships, though I think director Craig Brewer deliberately threw in both elements to tweak imagined taboos. It's not about sexual abuse or sex addiction, though Christina Ricci's character, Rae, typifies those. It's not about folk religion in the black community, though religion plays a large role. It's not a love story, though there are not one, but two happy couples at the end.

i love this movie . is it on air anymore ? what can i do to get it on air ? this is one movie i watched many times and i enjoy watching it again. it's just a beautiful movie. a must watch! can i buy or download a copy ? where can i buy the original copy of the DVD ? this is a must watch movie and i enjoy watching it again and again. a really wonderful and beautiful movie. I love this movie, i watched it about 5 times, it's a must watch!

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter's complex life. Though it fails in giving accurate facts, and details.Cynthia Gibb (portrays Karen) was not a fine election. She is a good actress , but plays a very naive and sort of dumb Karen Carpenter. I think that the role needed a stronger character. Someone with a stronger personality.Louise Fletcher role as Agnes Carpenter is terrific, she does a great job as Karen's mother.It has great songs, which could have been included in a soundtrack album.

`` The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends , '' says Marion Fairlie , who with her husband is making a new life in New Jersey for her three-year old daughter and two-year old son after a divorce . `` And I'm afraid I can't get over it . '' It is a sentiment that is heard often among divorced parents , even two or three years after they have parted . For many , it is the fear of being abandoned that they are trying to get over . Often , the divorce was sudden or unexpected and there was little chance to prepare psychologically for what they had to face .

Yes , this is one of the better done television movies and I would n't expect less from Joe Sargent who is a master craftsman. This movie is the first one of 2 made in the early 90 's, the second one was in 1992, but with a different storyline. The second one was the last one. This 2 hour movie is based on a real case in the 1980's. The case is called the "Fatal Visit" and the movie is the telling of that story. It is told in an interview format. It is a very good job.

Whoever cast this movie was a genius , every character in it is perfect for their part , and they all fit their characters amazing. The main character is played by a guy from the TV series 30 rock, he is a great actor , and the storyline is pretty good , but at some points I got a little bit confused, probably because i am not the best reader . But i would still recommend it , and i'm looking forward to seeing the movie. This guy was sooooo funny, it is such a good show. Its a very interesting show.

I was drawn to "Friends" by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Elton John whom I had see in a club in nearby Houston. I had no idea of the emotions and impact the movie would make. Recently I was brought back to the movie by a song that Heart did called "Seasons", then I found the Elton John song "Friends" thinking it was the same song...it's been 35 years of so. Anyway, the flood of the emotions of "Friends" came back like seeing an old photograph of your first real love.

-it has Carla Gugino * yay * and a crappy ending * boo * - '' Jaded '' is a film about a man whose life is slowly disintegrating, and a woman that enters his life at the exact moment it is falling apart. With this woman, he can once again find the joy in life. However, the moment he meets a woman that he is attracted to and falls for, she falls for his best friend, and he is left to figure out how he will move on. The film is based on a true story.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday (4 February, 2006)and came away with a better understanding of what schizophrenia patients and their loved ones go through.Ms Aparna Sen must be congratulated for not only taking on a difficult subject, but also treating the mentally challenged with a deep understanding of their predicament that is necessary to help them cope with the trauma of disorientation, hallucinations and the storm of turmoil raging in their minds.We have had Hollywood movies on this subject such as "One flew over the cuckoo's nest" where Jack Nicholson carried away the honours.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments , Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air . The film is a smartly written and beautifully executed comedy/drama that keeps you entertained and laughing while making you think about life and how we all deal with the challenges of it. The story starts out when Betty (RenÃ©e Zellweger) learns the man she was going to marry is really a mobster. Betty is so upset by this that she runs away from the city to Montana. While driving through the night, she is taken by a truck driver (Chris Rock) when he passes her car.

there's only so much that i can take of Filipino films, especially nowadays where the trend is sex, action and slapstick comedy(which i hate). the fact that Nasaan Ka Man made me think and made me gape during the movie was a big plus. It's got good cinematic scenes and editing was great, especially the cinematography. i think that Claudine deserves the best actress here rather than getting one in the movie Milan. the fact that there's only so few Filipino movies that i really like. i think Cholo Laurel did such a great job in this movie.

Robert Altman , Nicolas Roeg , John-Luc Goddard -- you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy, were you? Well, you're just gonna have to take a chance that it's going to be there somewhere. When a movie's plot is simple enough to fit on the back of a cereal box it might not be a bad idea if the filmmakers put that information on a separate sheet and mailed it to you in the mail, just as a service. Some films are so full of themselves they make the audience feel ashamed for enjoying the spectacle.

wow ! i just have to say this show is super cool ! i fell in love with the show and the cast! i've been watching episodes of it since i've moved to my new town and i just want to know when its going to start again !!! This is soooooooo coool! I just can't stand it, I always want to watch another episode but then I have to go to class and I don't have time to finish it. You really should put more of these up on your site. It's the coolest tv show ever.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time . I believe that if you just watch this show once you will never be able to forget this show . This sitcom should be shown on every channel in Britain and in every country in the world because this is one of those classic comedy shows that will always make you laugh when you watch it . I would give it ten out of ten . So watch this classic comedy on youtube if you have not already . You will be very very pleased that you did .

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford's work. Mainly because it's the only one that is based on a story written by John Ford himself, the story that was elaborated by Frank Nugent and director's son  Patrick Ford and turned into a screenplay, and because of director's personal opinion regarding it, Wagon Master is the film John Ford called the one which `came closest to being what I had wanted to achieve', to say so is not to say a little, but as Ford confessed once to Lindsay Anderson, his favourite was nonetheless My Darling Clementine and not any other.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross, Sydney. The plot focuses on the plight of a young would-be crim who's life is in danger after botching a job for his future boss. Very well acted by Heath Ledger and Bryan Brown. The plot is fairly believable with some very humorous moments in one scene which revolves around a bank heist. The setting-up of various themes central to the story is quite well done. Eg. When one crim is searching for bullets for his gun.

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theaters.I came across it while switching TV channels and was immediately engrossed in this story of an aging rodeo bum whose recklessness and lack of responsibility hurt everyone around him. I've often wanted to see the movie again but couldn't even remember its name, and have never seen it in the rental stores.James Coburn and Slim Pickens were excellent in their roles, and the rodeo footage was first rate. While being an action movie and having a western setting and theme it could be enjoyed by anyone regardless of their taste in films.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films, In The Company of Men & Your Friends and Neighbors, with this funny and original thriller/comedy/road movie. When Betty (Renee Zellwegger) witnesses the brutal murder of her no-good husband (Aaron Eckhart), she develops a bizarre sort of amnesia, and flees in his car, not knowing that there is large stash of drugs in the trunk. Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock are the hit men who follow her.What Betty is chasing, besides a new beginning (although she can't remember the old life) is her beloved, Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear).

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of `` slasher '' movies in the early 1980 's , the inevitable sequel would arrive sooner or later. And, it has. With the release of a sequel to the highly-acclaimed 1981 psychological thriller of the same name, `` Friday the 13th '' Part 2 was released on March 9th, 1982. It follows Jason Voorhees' 13 year journey to murder teenage girls on the last day of their summer camp. And, of course, he doesn't fail. In the second installment, camp counselors are hired to replace the previous group who were slaughtered by Jason.

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture, 'Wagon Master' made after two big Indian-cavalry epics... It is a lovely poetic movie, full of romanticized reincarnation of the pioneer spirit... It didn't have to top the big ones that had preceded it...Photographically, it is extremely simple... The camera moves only once or twice in the entire film, and never when a director would have made it move to underline a shot... Ford even resists the temptation to track his camera in the breathtaking twilight shots of the women wearily marching along in the dust behind their wagons...

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they click with each other. Matt is pretty unlikeable: aloof, braggart, seemingly lazy, and a misogynist. He's been hurt badly by his dysfunctional mom and this makes him a little easier to take. I guess I liked the details of his dysfunction--he was believable. He overcompensates by bragging that he'l nail Amy. He acts so cool around Amy that he strikes out twice. When they do talk he can't show her who he really is.

15 Park Avenue , well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in England. The opening credits start with the following:
Narrator: (voice-over) The British have a word for this. They call it "taking the mickey." It means taking advantage of the stupid or helpless in a jokey or nasty way. The Irish have another term for it, "screwing your friend." If you've been "taken" by the British, you'll have to get your own back in some way. It's a tradition.

This movie was awesome , if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. The story is about 4 guys that are trying to stop a crazy guy from killing people at a mall. I loved the story line but it wasn’t the greatest story ever told. The cast was really good. They had just the right amount of humor to make the movie very good and very fun to watch. I think that the people in the theater enjoyed it as much as I did, they were laughing out loud everywhere.

I saw the movie in 1972 , and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went away from it in a state of "discomfort" because it left me asking a lot of "why?" and "how come?" questions that I did not have the answer to. As a consequence, I found myself thinking about it a lot and I guess the movie has stuck with me over the years. The first thing that always comes back to me about this movie are the opening sequences. They are quite disturbing.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80's on network T.V. I think I was like 9. (Picture seeing a violent horror flick nowadays on regular television). Anyway, I've seen it again years later and it's like I remembered,it's really good,scary flick. I think the reason why it might of gone unnoticed is cause it wasn't followed by a ****load of sequels i.e. Friday the 13th. But it's one of those movies that takes the original idea and does it better.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways . It is a non stop plethora of emotion and action, and is so hard to put down once you have started. I think it would be really hard for a non fan to understand all the nuances. The characters are so very real and the situations that they find themselves in are typical of what a normal day would be like for so many people. But, this is no normal day or normal people. This is the beginning of a great new journey for our dearest friends, the Winchesters and their friends and foes.

I just watched this movie on it's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia. I liked (not loved) "Mork & Mindy" as a kid, mostly for Robin William's zany energetic performance. This movie made me remember why. Was the original show great? Not really, but Robin certainly was. Which brings me to this movie.I was pleasantly surprised, expecting nothing more than a paint by numbers chronological retelling of the show (which in a way it was). But, of course, the real focus was on Robin.

A remarkable film, bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much, much younger. I loved it, and the Elton John music. I remember seeing in in the movies when I was a kid, and for some reason (limited release?) I've never known anyone else who saw this film when it was released.The dreams it inspired in me from decades ago have never left me, and seeing the film again recently brought it all rushing back, I confess, however, that my kids (in their 20's) have not experienced a similar emotional rush.

Well, I'm a few days late but what the hell....! Anyways, the word that best describes my reaction to "See No Evil" was....SURPRISE. The film is actually pretty good. There is definitely an ample amount of blood, gore & action in the film with a modest amount of suspense. It hearkens back to the good ole' slasher days of the late 70's & early 80s. Think "Madman" meets Leatherface with a dash of Norman Bates and you'll get a good feel for this flick.

My wife and I saw this when we were 17. The only good thing my father ever did (get us in). This is "our movie" and the music is "our songs". Michelle's song is "our" song. Yeah, nowadays, it's a crime to show naked children on the screen, but we were screwing at 16, why not these kids? The movie is- rich boy impregnates poor girl, then rich dad steals him away from her at the end, after she gives birth under impoverished conditions. She is left alone with child.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight ( Midnight Cowboy , Coming Home ) ever appeared in, but it's one of my favorite movies ever made. I love the film for so many things: the fantastic cinematography, the acting, and the beautiful storytelling. I have a weakness for movies like this that look to the past for their inspiration and have a sense of style that goes beyond just a period setting. For those reasons, this is a movie I watch every year at least once.

This movie is VERY LONG, but totally worth splitting up over several nights. It has an all-star cast, and if you are a Patrick Swayze fan, this will get your heart to throbbing! :-) My mother is a Civil War buff, and a history teacher, and every summer we would watch this movie (we had recorded it off TV), over several, several nights until we got through the whole thing. We had every line in the movie memorized, lol. Pop some popcorn, sit back, and enjoy the action and romance.

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen(mostly in English). In the earlier film she treated a contemporary political environment and its effect on individuals. In this film it is the impact of mentally disabled member of the family and its impact on the family. As a parallel sub theme she treats a philosophical concept on "reality". It is a film which leads to thinking after seeing the film.Mithee the younger sister (Konkana Sen Sharma, the daughter of Aparna Sen) is suffering from Schizophrenia being taken care of by the dominant elder sister Anjali (Shabana Azmi) .

Fantastic documentary . A movie within a movie . I 'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother 's accident . She would have been so pleased . One thing to note is that the director's mother was very upset with him for filming in the hospital and she never spoke to him again . They had a good relationship before he made the film and she was really supportive of it . A very nice documentary about a very nice man. This is about the life of an independent filmmaker who does it with such love and passion that you have to cheer on the guy and appreciate his work.

I viewed The Reader at Sugar, which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything, and the movie was by far the highlight of the evening. The technical elements were well meshed and it was obvious that Duncan Rogers had chosen his designers and crew well. But it was the story and it's delivery that truly made this short shine. Duncan Rogers' tight script was just what this evening of "shorts" needed. It neither meandered, as several offerings did, or preached to us. The Reader was simple story telling in it's best form, well cast by Rogers and beautifully acted.

This is what porn used to be , this is a true classic . I mean , it is an adult magazine but it has a quality that is missing nowadays, the photographs are of a higher quality and they are shot in a professional setting. This magazine is definitely a piece of history. I like the fact that they use a mix of both amateur women and well known pornstars, and it makes it very easy to relate to the women. They use the same models a couple times, so it is nice to see women you recognize and can get to know.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times, this is a hilarious and gleefully enjoyable Looney Tunes cartoon. The animation is wonderful, the backgrounds so detailed and a lot of audacious colouring too. The writing is razor sharp, and the sight gags especially Daffy constantly getting his head blown off are brilliantly timed. I really did love the arguments between Daffy and Bugs, and that Bugs wins every time. I also love it that Daffy is really greedy and nasty while being uproariously funny. I do prefer him when he's manic but he is great fun here too.

I'll be brief: I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that just draws me in and won't let me go. Granted, there are some major flaws in it (some of the acting is below par at best and the dialogue is sometimes so poor it's funny) but there are enough redeeming features to make it watchable to the end.But what are they? Well, it's got a cool little plot - by no means is it original, but it is better presented than other films of its kind.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent, unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters. In the same way I loathed Fargo on first viewing, then realized I was still thinking about it days later and enjoying it somehow, I liked Nurse Betty a lot more the day after I saw it. Hard to understand, harder to explain. As others have said, it's quite forced in many ways, but that seems to be part of what makes it so striking.Fair job by Greg Kinnear, great work from Morgan Freeman (although I worry that he's being stereotyped as the principled villain).

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their `` Erasmus year '' in Europe. Follows the life of an international university student from the Philippines as he spends his "Erasmus Year" in Europe. International students tell their stories about Europe and the Erasmus period of their lives in the Erasmus Film Project. An International Student's Erasmus Journey is a story about life in Europe and Erasmus as told by international students. The story starts with a Filipino student and his family before his departure, and it shows how Erasmus helps international students develop a deeper understanding of Europe and its people.

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it's rabbit season. But, you guessed it - it's really duck season. Elmer Fudd appears: he's the only hunter dumb enough to fall for the gag.He's even dumber than that. When Bugs Bunny strides up to him and asks how the rabbit hunting is going, Elmer admits that he hasn't seen a rabbit yet. This is more than Daffy can stand. He emerges from his hiding place and immediately points to a rabbit: Bugs Bunny. "Shoot him now!"

15 Park Avenue, well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Kolkata. However as the story unfolds, one realize the thin line that director tries to walk between Relationships, Social Cause and of course the world of Schizophrenia. I would say Aparna Sen is one director who has so much more to say and has so less time at disposal. Well no doubt she has managed to make a good movie. In a way she makes us realize that probably each one of us is looking for our own '15 Park Avenue'.

On watching this film , I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. I found it difficult to see the person that the media had portrayed. It’s interesting how celebrities can be portrayed differently to how they may actually be. There are celebrities out there that are portrayed negatively by the media which may be the complete opposite of them in real life. In the video we saw a few celebrities that had a good reputation but after seeing them on this video I can see where they get their reputation.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission , I can only look at this as a very good thing. And I'm also thinking that I had better get a better knowledge of that subject. It will only help me as I get older. I've always felt the same way when I read or hear about how the British took the children from the Aboriginal people . I think that's so sad. I'm so glad we are finally seeing some justice done. Thank you so much Jan.

Just watched Conrack for the first time. Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, it is a very touching and heartwarming study of a man's evolution to overcome his youth and upbringing in a prejudiced south and a teacher's creativity in connecting with students despite different backgrounds and difficult circumstances. As an educator, seeing a teacher adapt to his students and prepare them for all of the challenges life has to offer, not just the lessons found in textbooks, is a valuable concept of which we all need to be reminded.

There are many film now on DVD , but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers . The following is a list of some forgotten tittles that must be brought back to the big screen in DVD format. Some movies I would like to see released on DVD are:
“Holiday Affair” (1949)- This is my favorite holiday movie. It’s about a man who falls in love with a married woman. It’s set in NYC and is filmed in the winter time. I have seen this movie several times and always find it so touching and emotional.

I 've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since Amazon Prime is showing it this weekend! It's hard to believe now but this film was originally made in 1979 and was banned for many years. It was released in the US in 1982 with about 200 seconds cut from it. It was re-released again in 2002 but this time with the original version. The reason why the film was banned in the UK in the first place was because it was too explicit and it was the first horror film with an unsimulated sex scene.

Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome ! Very relaxing sound . Elton was ahead of his own time when this album was released. It is a great collection of songs about life ! I love the words on the lp sleeve, very clever . I've always liked the album cover . I would love to hear more from this artist . I hope he comes out with more albums in the near future . A must own album . I highly recommend purchasing this classic . You may like this album , you may not like it but either way , I think that you should give it a listen .

It 's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand it's just about as good as it can get in a low-budget genre piece - but on the other there's some real flaws and issues that could have made it a lot better. There's really not a lot of plot here, it's basically just one scene repeated with different characters and situations. A group of friends go away on a remote camping trip, get lost, then find a mysterious old house. They then start to find out about the house, and the people who built it.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage. I saw "capturing the friedmans" a short while ago and have to admit I thought this was better.The story is not an incredibly shocking one, but it is a great examination of trapped personalities and relational cold war. Block deftly guides the viewer through diaries, family footage and after-the-fact interviews; his interview style is sensitive and probing, and his insights are clear and measured.51 Birch Street is a great examination of personalities and relationships over 40-50 years of social change, the social fallout, and potential for redemption.

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland , and it was definitely a step up from my last exposure to the film in high school. I remember being disappointed then, and feeling vaguely offended, which is not something a movie should do at all. There's a whole bunch of stuff going on here that's worth discussing:
First and foremost, if you've never seen The Third Man, do so immediately. It is far, far better than its reputation, and has a lot of interesting themes that you can discuss at your leisure.

i love this show! it is amazing...i can never miss an episode even if i've already seen it. the actors are perfect for the parts......i love Gilmore girls! i've gotten all my friends to watch it. even their parents watch it now. i watch it daily and i usually watch it more than once a day. i wish my mom was like Lorelei. my friends say that i talk and act like Lorelei. Lorelei and Rory have a wonderful mother-daughter relationship. it is a great teen show because they actually kind of learn from watching it.

Unfortunately , I 've never seen the full version of this movie . I did see the 87-minute version twice and the 2007 remake once . 1980's - I had heard rumours about it being cut , but hadn't seen any of it so I thought it wasn't that big a deal . Then one day it turned up on British TV - in the 87-minute version. I recorded it but never got round to seeing it. A couple of months later the remake was out and I was curious about the differences , so I ended up watching the remake as well as the 87-minute version - which I had on tape.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to deal with one another's peculiarities! Maria is in her early 30's, married to an older businessman and lives in a flat with her young son. She's got a close relation to her father's side of the family and loves spending time in her childhood house. Maria's parents are always there to help whenever she needs them. The family has always been rather close and it has helped her through some rather rough times in her life.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through. It has a great ensemble of characters, an origional plot, and an ending I shoulda seen coming but didn't and pulls at your heart strings.If theres any one thing about this movie that got me the most it was Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock's interaction. These two are great and it warms my heart to see Rock isn't going to do crappy Big Hollywood fare like Lethal Weapon 4 for the rest of his life. Freeman is as always the man, really there shouldnt be any need to critique his work anymore.

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC , or any big city of mid-century, very well. Here’s the review from The New Yorker. A new documentary, ‘A Great Day in Harlem’, recalls the making of one of the great American photographic portraits
“Harlem 1958: Fifty Famous Photographers—Including the Master, Art Kane—Came to 125th Street to Take a Portrait of Jazz’s Fabulous ‘Brown Bomber’” (the cover story of the August 31, 1998, issue) is the most memorable issue of The New Yorker in my memory.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the last 5 years, and I decided to read more about what was going on about this film, what it is about and what is the true story. In fact I read a few articles on the web about this case, and when I saw it, I had to go and watch it, because I was interested in everything that happened , the case and the movie, so I decided to watch it to compare it with the real case.

Surprising, witty, funny and totally engaging, the film grabs a little-known reality: that of the student that goes studying in an Erasmus program. The beginning is great, as the story kicks off, of course it has a few lulls on the midsection, and the story drifts sometimes away from the main character, but the viewer won't bother - the movie is young, fresh, and light-hearted, even though I don't agree with the notion that when you do Erasmus and you come back you no longer make part of that universe. But that's just me.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right. And when it goes wrong... I'd say that a full 3/4s of the film is great. I can even isolate the bad bit. It's everything that has to do with the romance. Everything that you need to know about it is said in the first five minutes but it drags on for about 30. I'd recommend skipping that section if you can. It does nothing except explain his exile. It should have been a minor plot point quickly thrust aside.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class . The musicianship of this band is just amazing and it's very refreshing to hear how well the band plays together. All the instrumentalists in the band have their own style and they come together and form one cohesive sound. The band is just amazing and the best new band that I've seen since 30 Seconds To Mars. The band's sound has elements of U2, Muse, NIN, Linkin Park and more but it is so fresh and new that it's not just an imitation.

This was a pretty good episode. Though no "Trapped in the Closet" or "Cartoon Wars," it had a lot of things going for it. The character of Al Gore and that bizarre-as-hell "super cereal" thing was pretty darn funny. But, the scene that made me adore this episode was one I'm sure everyone will agree was one of the greatest Cartman/Kyle moments ever. When Cartman is superstitious of Kyle that he'll be stealing his gold(which of course is fake! ), and he comes within inches of his face.

Do n't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you ? I wish that the Walt Disney Studio could have the same sort of magic as they did when Walt was alive but I know that I would never see that kind of quality movies from them ever again. It seems that they just want to make more money and that's all. It's so bad that there were so many great Disney Animated Features from 1995-2002 that it seems that nowadays the new ones just seem to be a let down compared to that greatness.

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good:The camera work was absolutely phenomenal. Every shot is done beautifully.It was interesting seeing all the different animals that I could have never even imagined.David Attenborough has the perfect narrator's voice. No one could have done any better.The Bad:There were one or two different times where there was a reference to the Earth being 1 million years old ( I hold a different belief). Overall a TV series anyone can enjoy. I highly recommend buying it. 10/10 stars.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos 's role as Williams for that entire show , was Emmy worthy! He made the show! What a fun show! The last 2 episodes of season 2 were my favorites and I really hope they do another season soon, it is very well written and the performances by the actors are stellar! I agree. His performance was wonderful. The show is fantastic. I just hope it comes back soon! It was good enough to have a third season? I guess we will never know but if so, we will see it sometime in 2019.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment. This movie does an excellent job of revealing the complexity of the task and the incredible challenges facing South Africa. I believe every one should see this movie as I think few people outside of South Africa understand its past and what is being attempted in the Truth and Reconciliation process. Almost every country has some part of its own history which is still a source of continuing hatred and bitterness. We all need to understand ways of dealing with the past. What's happening in South Africa should guide us all.

... I saw this movie when it first came out in France , in my hometown , 54 years ago , and it made such an impact that it still stays with me. I never saw any movie like that then , and never saw anything like it after... I never thought I could watch it again without being disappointed.... But last week , while on holiday in Florida , my sister in law found the DVD in a shop in Clearwater , bought it , and sent it as a surprise to me. I was amazed that this old movie was still available !

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am . My brother and I were channel surfing, and it was in the movie section so we stopped and watched the trailer. My brother said "I have been looking for this for years" and went back to his own show. I couldn't believe it, the trailer looked so good that I decided to go to bed and watch the movie after I had slept for a few hours. I woke up and watched the movie. It was so good I watched the trailer over again.

I too saw this movie when it first came out . I was a teenager at the time , and i thought it was wonderful . I still think it was a very nice movie . The only thing I had a little problem with was the age difference between the actors . This movie is one of those movies that you could watch anytime for any reason . I’ve watched it only once when it first came out. I’ve not been a fan of romantic movies, but this one has been different. I love this movie!

Unfortunately, I've never seen the full version of this movie. I did see the 87-minute version twice, back in the 1950s. Even more floridly directed than is the norm with Julien Duvivier, this is a wonderfully out-of-the-ordinary piece, replete with sweeping tracking shots through, over and into Andrejew's magnificently atmospheric sets. Beautifully lit too by photographer André Thomas, Black Jack is nothing if not a connoisseur's delight. Reinforcing this imaginative visual style, is a script that allows a roster of our favorite actors, including Agnes Moorehead and Marcel Dalio, some brilliantly bizarre, full-blooded characterizations.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time week after week. The dialogs, or monologues rather, as everybody just rants on endlessly about nothing, are just becoming so tedious. For example, the episode I watched yesterday began with a seemingly unending rambling about how a particular dish (I forgot what it was, pasta with meatballs perhaps) always manages to turn the Gilmore family dinner into all-out war. And these were just the few seconds or so.So it seems every time, lots of lines, with absolutely zero content.

After I 've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. It is a very funny movie. I think it is a perfect movie for me.
