I love it and will watch it again and again! In this movie are very special effects and I'm not only talking about the huge and funny animals that are part of this movie. The actors are good too and make a great performance. I don't think you will regret about seeing this movie. What a waste of time! A waste of time.

This was an excellent show . It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (one of the singers) telling a story about growing up in Gary, Indiana and living in a rough neighborhood. I think the title of this show was “Making the Band”. I have since moved from Chicago and I do not have access to PBS and I was wondering if someone could please send me a copy of the show. Thanks for your help. The title is “Making the Band” and it is the first episode of the second season.

Personally , I regard `` The Egyptian '' in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known author , who has himself been to Egypt many times and knows the Egyptians extremely well. As I had never seen a picture of a `Egyptian' it struck me that it might not be very flattering to Egypt. However it was a pleasant surprise to discover that this is the best likeness of an Egyptian that has ever been seen - at least in my opinion. It's a shame that some people regard it as a cartoon , for it is in fact extremely accurate.

My favorite film this year . Great characters and plot , and the direction and editing was smooth , visually pleasing. And the music was awesome! I'm glad it got a limited release because this is one of the films I'm glad I saw. The movie is so beautiful! It's such an interesting story and I enjoyed it so much. I definitely recommend you to watch this movie! I really like this movie so much, I could watch it every day! The acting is amazing, the plot is amazing and the director is amazing.

Recently I saw this movie again (after 25 years). In the original there is a scene in the bathroom of an airplane during the landing between Jacqueline Bisset's character and Michael Brandon's character. The rented version did not have this scene in it. Did I imagine this?Or, is this part of the "clean up" of movies where some are altered to exclude portions some people think are not "appropriate"?I love this movie -- it is exactly like the friendship between a friend and I and we've been friends for 25 years and saw it together.

Forget about Donnie Darko. I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I have read on The Box amount to the simple but weak argument that it doesn't hold a candle to Darko. It isn't that I disagree with that necessarily, I just feel that this movie is a different animal altogether and deserves its own analysis. There are points of comparison to be sure, but they are peripheral concerns when you consider that the key to the heart of each movie is different. In Darko, the driving force of the narrative is existential.

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story, where both Carpenters are in a recording studio, and Richard makes an impromptu decision to have Karen sing for the owner of the studio.Richard picks the wrong key for Karen to sing in, so Karen is singing above her natural range. You can see a look of bemusement on the owner's face; he figures she really can't sing. Richard quickly realizes his mistake and tries again in a different key. The next thing you hear is Karen's amazing, beautiful voice, and the owner does a priceless double take.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film's lead actor Fabian Stratas' deliberate mispronunciation of Falkland, a reference to the film's setting and a rather less than subtle allusion to the secret agenda of its protagonist.Fabian is an Argentine national, an amateur magician passing himself off as a tourist visiting the Falklands soon after it is reopened to its people. His master plan is to win the ultimate struggle by seducing and impregnating the local females, commencing with the delicious Camilla,thus siring an entire generation of half Argentinians.

The Killing Yard is a great film , although uneven at times . Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort in the lead role of a young man who, after a life of crime , returns to the streets of Atlanta to help the police catch a killer . I'd love to know how many of the actors, who are from the same area that the story takes place in, got to see this film when it screened locally. I believe that if more films were made about black people by black people it would help bring about more positive changes in the perception of black culture by the outside world.

This show is really great. It's smart.It's funny.It's great acting and writing. This show is really the fastest show I've ever seen. The Dialogues are really funny and well acted. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel have a great chemistry.You really do believe they are mother and daughter. This show really showed that mother daughter relationships really don't have to be just mother and daughter, they can be best friends but on the same time it shows that it's really hard sometimes being more than just mother and daughter especially with Lorelai and Emily.

I 'm certain that people from USA do n't know anything about the rest of the world , but I do know that it is not possible to live and work in the States and have the same level of salaries in your country . The cost of living in the USA is really high ! There are some people who really have money to live very well , but the majority of people have no money . A friend of mine from Argentina (where he has a lot of money ) is working in the USA for a low salary and for the only reason that he likes the job .

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn`t get to see the original teleplay untill a few days ago and this is far superior to the sequel . Okay it`s not a million miles away from the plot of SEVEN but it`s still compelling . Much of my praise has to do with Ken Stott`s performance as DCI Red Metcalfe a policeman who seems to have led a very unlucky life and someone who has a terrible secret . It`d be easy for Stott to go over the top but he plays the role in a fairly subtle way .

This small John Ford western with no 'stars' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It has a documentary-like feel to it as it traces the journey West of a party of Mormons and it may be the most authentic looking of all Ford's films, (it's on par with "The Sun Shines Bright" which he made a couple of years later).There is a plot of sorts, (a group of bank robbers join the wagon train at one point), but the film's dramatic highlights are almost incidental.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways. It is a non stop plethora of emotion and taboo subjects. Sex and love. Women's emotional abuse of men, Men's physical abuse of women, Sexual child abuse, Fresh approach to religion in real life, and all tied together with very raw and powerful blues music.I promise you that if you sit through the first 20 minutes you will find the tie in and bettering of all the characters. And the ending will be more pleasant than you can expect.

I saw "The Reader" at a film festival in Manhattan this week. It touched my heart in a way that few short films have done. In ten or so minutes, it tells a poignant two-character story that resonated deeply with me. Duncan Rogers has done a superb job capturing very real, tender moments on film. What I really admire about this film is that the director has chosen a story appropriate to the short format. These are genuinely interesting characters, and their story is told in the perfect length of time. This is no small feat.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites . The unsung hero of his generation . Nobody could do it better. My favorite film of all times the one that changed my life forever when I first saw in my life was The Philadelphia Story . That and A Star is Born made me realize that there is more to life and what a life it could be . George made me see that people were not what they seemed . The man was a god . I love every one of his films from 1939 until the end . He was the best .

This film, released in 1951, has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50's; the cavalry needing to protect the territory from a murderous band of Indians, an officer determined to see that task through, and the men with him with various character flaws that he has to merge together into a cohesive unit. This small band must hold on to a fort located close to the Indian village until reinforcements arrive. The Indians know, all to well, that the small band is undermanned, and could be wiped out before the help comes.

`` The Cell '' is a rather difficult film to classify . If you read the plot outline , `` The Cell '' sounds like a standard action picture . But once you actually watch the film , you realize you're watching something else entirely . The plot outline for `` The Cell '' is as follows:
Carol ( J. Lo ) is a therapist working with violent criminals . She is in the process of trying to break a particularly violent inmate named Carl . While trying to break Carl , Carol undergoes an experiment in which her mind is placed in a kind of computer-generated coma .

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox's reluctance to release a full screen restored version in DVD. Yes, the history may be a bit inaccurate and it is certainly not as powerful as the book, BUT it was the 2nd film by Fox made in Real Cinemascope and the production values alone merit a restoration and distribution. I saw this film in second grade and it triggered my lifelong interest in all things Egyptian, culminating in my visiting Egypt 4 years ago! Amazing the power of film on a child's imagination, eh?

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin 's short 'Chess Fever ' , a mad tale about a man who has to be saved from the clutches of 'chess madness'. The film is in the public domain, and has been released in various versions. This one is based on a 16 mm print of the film. Aleksandr Faynzilovich Kokorekin is a man who has never learned to play chess. One day a man gives him some books on the game, and his interest soon turns to obsession, as he begins to lose his job and his marriage.

One of the many backwoods horror's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. Yes it has a cheesy plot but I was pleasantly surprised at this film, because I thought it was really good and really entertaining, although the killer could have been made a bit more scarier he just looked like a fat slob.First of all, we have the local sheriff or whatever the hell he is, who warns them not to go to those mountains as they are very dangerous. But when the teens arrive, it doesn't seem very dangerous at all, well according to me anyway.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it. What a movie. I am in my 40s now and have 2 teenage kids and I would like them to see this movie. I would recommend it to anyone who loves a romance movie or older Elton John music.I have searched most of the stores that sell both new and old movies but have not come across any.I bought some old movies like " Melody" in Hong Kong, who had quite a collection of old movie, but they did not have this.

I did n't personally know Karen Carpenter , nor , Richard for that matter , so I must go by what people said about them , and , I can tell by just looking at the photos of them , they were really, really, really , beautifully , beautiful people , and , it is such a loss , and such a waste , and I can not help but think , it must've been all the stress , and strain , and pressure they were living under . I'm glad you enjoyed my article.

This movie is VERY LONG , but totally worth splitting up over several nights . It has an all-star cast and great special effects . The story is about a secret military group that is tasked with protecting earth from aliens . This is the first time they have to deal with a situation that the government doesn't believe the threat is real . This movie is really exciting and I don't want to give away too much , but it involves a time loop and a lot of running for your life . It is really funny too . This is such a fun movie .

This if the first movie I've given a 10 to in years. If there was ever a movie that needed word-of-mouth to promote, this is it. A $4 Mil box is a disgrace. People don't know what it's about. If you have any appreciation for the Blues, or just a good use of excellent music, that alone is reason to go see it. How many people knew Jackson could sing, and damn fine too. You hear books and movies taunting that they're about salvation. After seeing this, you'll never be able to forgive such trivial use of the word.

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50's, along with my other favourite, Land of the Pharaohs". The sets and colours are just wonderful and everything seems so "neat" in the production quality. I thought Victor Mature was well cast and Peter Ustinov a real gem! The whole look of the movie (along with others made in this era) has an appeal that you just don't get with modern movies with all their digitized effects (I have yet to see the 1999 movie "The Mummy but am sure I will love it!

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film . The backwoods slasher pretty much started with Tobe Hooper’s Eaten Alive in 1977 , and was at its most popular between 1978 and 1982. The golden age of horror is the best to come out of America’s cinematic industry , but there are so many fantastic movies that were made during those 5 years . There are the usual slasher staples like Friday the 13th and Nightmare on Elm Street , as well as a variety of cult films like The Hills Have Eyes , Halloween III , Maniac , and My Bloody Valentine .

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome ; more bloodshed and very graphic details ( a bit too much for my taste, but hey..I'm a wimp...), this is nevertheless an original book, quite a good read, if you don't mind the graphic-ness of it all. The basic plot is simple enough, and I think it could have worked quite well without adding so many details...but I guess it makes the book longer and more entertaining that way, so no real complaints :).

I saw the Messiah : - The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes I've ever seen on film. Incredible stuff. So you think you can dance: I saw the audition in Liverpool and was so amazed to see the range of dance styles being shown that I ended up going to every single audition that I could until I saw them at the O2 in London. I have never seen so many talented dancers and I have never been so moved watching dance before. King Kong: The Special Edition DVD is the best DVD I've seen and the best movie I've seen.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story, Like someone you might have known. Just trying to make it, my big shot is right around the corner. Then Life's little temptations creep in, the spoiler, stumbled again. How much, can your love take, and give, to the guy who's really not so bad, after all, just Human. I liked it, I was also a paid extra in the movie. Played the drums in the bar shots, with the band, did several walking shots, my green 66' corvette was in the motel party shots.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents , the filmmaker 's mother dies , but he continues making the documentary and interviewing his father about his childhood , which was spent in Nazi Germany , as Hitler 's youth grew up during the rise of the Third Reich . Cast: Bruno Ganz, Evelyn Hamann, Senta Berger, Thomas Loibl
You can watch 'My Father and the Man in Black' on Amazon Prime Video as part of a subscription. It's an ad-free channel with a huge library of binge-worthy movies and TV shows.

I can't comment on the accuracy of this production, historical or literary, but I can say that I enjoyed it. If there is a God, the sound track will be released, Ilona Sekacz' work is truly enduring. Twenty years on I am still moved by the haunting themes of this production and return to it frequently.The story surrounds the entry into society of Catherine Moreland. Somewhat awkward and possessed of an unhealthy interest in Gothic stories (early pulp fiction? ), Catherine descends on Bath in the company of Mrs Allen where she meets Henry Tilney.

An extremely down-to-earth , well made and acted `` Rodeo '' Western . No gussied up stars needed here as the cast is all good . The action is well staged . The ending is a little bit of a letdown but there's a lot here to like . A lot of action , a lot of character development and a good cast . Worth checking out if you like the genre . I watched this last night and was a little uncomfortable with the ending, but the rest of the movie was great, as I think most westerns usually are.

Forget about the plot of this movie . Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Chris Pratt. You should be more concerned with the fact that you are sitting in a theatre full of people that you are now connected to because of the simple fact that you are all sitting together enjoying the same flick. You will laugh and cry and share in a collective catharsis that will change your entire outlook on the world. I will tell you right now, you will cry. I am not sure what the world has become but I am sure glad that I am old.

comeundone, I love you! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie and it's ending. My family has not seen this movie yet, but I know them too well; they will hate it. But this time, I watched it alone and I found that it affected me greatly. Although the movie is long in length, I was tied to the story and amazed by the ending. I initially thought it was weird as to how she just vanished, but on some level, it makes perfect sense.But like comeundone said, this movie does not make sense of reality.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . I've really only seen 2 westerns with Clint Eastwood and they were both really good , so when I saw that Clint was in this movie I was all for checking it out. The movie is about John Reid (Josh Brolin) who travels to Mexico with his brother , to see his dead father's land . After they arrive John meets up with a gun fighter by the name of Cole , played by Dennis Quaid , and a Mexican girl , Josey played by Emily Browning .

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Artificial Magic versus Real Magic, a play about a shipwrecked group of men on a storm-lashed island ruled by a mysterious exiled wizard and his evil magical creatures. Or it can be interpreted in a very different light, wherein the play is about a group of people from the modern world transported to an island ruled by a witch who has the power of an evil spirit that she uses to gain control of the other characters in her world.

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn ` t get to see the original teleplay untill a couple of weeks ago. I`m glad I did for I was quite surprised to see how much the two works are identical. The reason for my surprise was because I remembered that there were many changes made during the shoot and in particular that the final scenes were very different. Apart from the obvious difference in casts I was interested in what other scenes had been altered, and after watching them back to back I found there were two key ones which had been changed: 1.

After "Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman" with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as dangerous as men, there was obviously an open market for other movies to pick up and carry the torch and what more a lovely actress than Dorothy Provine from "It's A Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World" to play the role. The downsize is that cute and blonde Provine may just be too sweet and innocent looking to step into Allison Hayes' size 50 shoes. This role really needed someone with an amount of smoldering sex appeal; Provine is more the girl next door type.

"Please, don't kill me! I'm just an actor!" "Can you play dead?" It's difficult to describe this show. It's like a crime dramedy. Where the bad cop is an ass. Literally. What's great about the show is some of Assy's perfectly awful one-liners. Cracking out such gems as "Adios, Blimp," Assy Mcgee provides some great laughs at points. Sadly at other times, the show seems to drag along at a slow pace, making it almost hard to watch.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight (Midnight Cowboy, Coming Home) has ever done, but a real tribute to teachers.Despite incredible odds, Pat Conroy (Voight) managed to reach a group of students and bring them from nowhere to a basic literacy and awareness of the world. His methods made be criticized by bureaucratic dinosaurs like Mr. Skeffington (Hume Cronyn), but teachers like Conroy will always be winners.Voight really showed that he had a love for teaching and that it was a natural high for him.

This movie was so cool! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends. While the first credits were rolling, we saw that Lionsgate Films had made this movie. They are the ones that made that stupid movie Wolf Creek, which was totally gay! When we saw this, we groaned. We thought it was going to be like Wolf Creek, but we were so wrong! The movie was not only better than Wolf Creek (which really isn't that hard) it is one of the best horror movies I have seen in a long time!

First of all , ignore the comment about how South Park should make fun of Republicans . Everyone is doing it , its not funny . Now on to South Park episode #1021 – Make love , Not war. I’m glad that the boys didn’t talk about this episode for a couple of days as I expected them to . In fact I was really surprised that this was the week’s topic when I saw the trailer . I really thought it was going to be more of what happened to the boys this week . What I got was a very funny episode.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago. I've seen it 4 more times since. I had never heard of it before and I consider myself knowledgeable of classic cinema. A true, polished, diamond in the rough.This gem of a movie revolves around Jon Voight (lead character "Conrack") as a young schoolteacher assigned to Yamacraw Island to teach the islands' children, all in one school. At first, the students reveal they know very little of the world beyond their island home.

There 's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster , Sergeant Rutledge , and The Searchers -- films where John Wayne took on more difficult roles than he normally did in westerns, films that, in a way, made him look vulnerable. Yet, for all his efforts, he never really achieved an iconic role, as much as he did in some of his other westerns, as a gunfighter. The Man who shot Liberty Valance has some similarities with those films, but it stands apart from the others in a number of significant ways.

During the War for Southern Independence , GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against the U. S. Army invaders. A 1995 remake of the classic W. C. Fields film from 1941. This film is based on a novel, 'Never Say Never Again'. The original was released as 'Thin Man'. (1988)
An American reporter and her photographer boyfriend become involved with a British spy trying to escape the Germans. An anthology film of 18 interconnected stories, with a running time of 90 minutes. They all relate in some way to the theme of love.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I 've ever seen ! I was not a fan of his work at all, until I saw this movie, and I have seen every movie of his that I can get my hands on... I have tried to track down this movie for several years with no success. It was made by the same people who made "Stroker Ace" with Burt Reynolds. If anyone out there can find me a copy I would be extremely greatful, but if anyone out there has ever heard of where I can get this I would really love to hear it !

People need to give this show a chance . The people who write bad reviews ( there are very few who actually do ) are not watching the show as it should be watched . First you need to watch one episode in a row , not jumping between seasons . Second you need to watch at least season 2 in a row so you can get attached to the characters . The main character has changed over seasons and you will understand why . Third you need to watch the whole season in a row so you have a feeling about the plot .

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one . I really ca n't come up with a single one . You're right about one thing. This film IS different from what you'd expect. However I've watched this film 3 times already, and I like it each time. Yes, there's no mystery of who the culprit is, so if you're expecting a 'whodunit' film, forget about it. But I think the main reason you have to like this film, is because it is so different in so many other ways.

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area , and it was quite clear that most of the audiences present were expecting something like the first Iron Man. I knew that this movie was a prelude to that, but I still found that there were some things that were different, that didn't work, and that were unnecessary. The first thing that was noticeable was that this movie was much darker in colour scheme than Iron Man. The second, which I found interesting was the amount of CGI that was used in this film.

I guess my husband and I are a little slow . We do n't usually warm up to a series of movies or books until we have watched it or read it . We have finally warmed up to The Twilight Series. We read them and watched the first movie . We now watch the second one on Netflix and can't wait for the 3rd . The first movie has a special meaning to us , it was on the big screen the night our kids had their prom. Now we have a new tradition of watching a movie together while we cuddle with the grandbaby.

( My Synopsis ) Rae ( Christina Ricci ) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie ( Jesse Eisenberg ), a shy bookworm in her class who has never had sex. Together, they explore and experiment their sexual desires and try to get rid of their inhibitions. ( My Reaction )
This movie was so wrong! I thought it was really funny and I was laughing out loud. But when the story line came along, it was weird. You can understand why some people would find it inappropriate, even I did. I'm not sure if it's for me.

My kids loved this movie. we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie. we watched it as a family and everyone of us enjoyed it. it was a movie you could watch without any uncomfortable spots that you would have to explain to the younger ones. my boys loved this movie and they would love to be able to see it again. even after all these years they remember it. that Amy Jo Johnson was a very cute girl. all my boys had crushes on her. they loved her as the pink power ranger which is why we watched this movie to begin with.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by, no matter how bad it may look. His debut, Hustle and Flow, was one of my favorites from that year, with its emotionally charged storyline and realistic, fallible characters. I wasn't quite sure what I would end up thinking after seeing this sophomore effort. The cast seemed great, the trailer used music effectively, however, it seemed like there was a good chance it would cross into absurdity, and fast. Fortunately, Black Snake Moan hits all its marks dead-on.

Graphics is far from the best part of the game. This is the number one best TH game in the series. Next to Underground. It deserves strong love. It is an insane game. There are massive levels, massive unlockable characters... it's just a massive game. Waste your money on this game. This is the kind of money that is wasted properly. And even though graphics suck, thats doesn't make a game good. Actually, the graphics were good at the time. Today the graphics are crap. WHO CARES?

After searching for 6 months, I finally found this DVD. All I can say is it was damn well worth the wait! "Rush in Rio" may very well be the greatest rock DVD in existence. I'm not joking. It's incredible! All the fuss about the sound being crappy is true, however it doesn't make the concert unwatchable. I find it makes you feel like you're actually in Rio watching the concert from the audience. That's one of the reasons I love this DVD. It makes you feel like you're actually there.

Wow! An amazing, lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one. This film warrants viewing simply to see what can be done with next to no budget but a lot of enthusiasm. As a retelling of the Oz story, the film borders on becoming too obvious but it is saved by it's eccentricities. The chance for a glimpse at how glam rock manifested in Australia will delight fans of the genre. This film used to be double featured with the Rocky Horror Picture Show, an indicator of the type of film that Oz is.

The most enjoyable pet movie since Scooby Doo and Garfield. The story revolves around a 23 year old inventor named Brian Foster whose systems at his boss's company seems to keep failing, Brian is also dating the boss's daughter named Casey. But Brian secretly invented a robotic dog named CHOMPS, modeled after his own dog Rascal. But CHOMPS is no ordinarily dog, he is as fast as a cheetah, he has x-ray vision, can leap about 6 feet, and has a strength of 20 men. The new invention impresses his boss, and makes his business a success.

Well , okay , maybe not perfect , but it was pretty close . This movie jumped from crime drama to action adventure to romantic romp and had a ton of great action sequences . I've got to say though I've seen better action films and if you're a fan of the genre it's probably worth a viewing but if you're looking for something to really thrill your senses I'd suggest a better movie . There were a lot of things that could have been better in the movie , and the script really needed some work but not terrible for what it is , it is what it is .

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story , where both Carpenters are in a recording studio, singing a beautiful duet. We hear them in unison, and when Karen starts to sing a lower harmony, the film fades away, and the next scene shows her on a tour bus, with a microphone, rehearsing. We are not shown Richard singing a high harmony, only that he isn’t there when his wife sings it. The rest of the world knew that the Carpenters were a duet, but Richard Carpenter has always said that, in reality, his wife was the principal singer.

This comment discusses "North and South Book I" dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is mostly identified by people with the Civil War (1861-1865). This is a reasonable opinion because that was Civil War which put the Union under the severe test; that was the Civil War which made Americans realize how precious it is to live in peace; finally, that was this period which at last brought the end to the shameful system of slavery. From the birth of motion pictures, there were people who adapted that time onto screen.

I have n't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way like this one. I saw it about two weeks ago and I could not get it out of my mind for days! The cinematography was stunning and I could not believe the beauty of this place and the life that is led there. If I'm honest I'm still reeling from the film. It was like watching a documentary with an edge of horror. It made me so conscious of where my food comes from. I have always been an animal rights campaigner, vegan for 4 years.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed. Very funny and the production quality is outstanding. It is easy to see why this short film has been accepted into so many festivals and won awards.Everyone can identify with Calvin having a bad day, bad week, bad life. Travis Davis plays the role superbly! Richard Moll as Tim brings darkness and foreboding that gives this film just the right twistedness. The old man adds to the humor of the story. And who wouldn't love the suicidal goldfish!This short will bring lots of laughs.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store. It has become one of the movies in my collection that i will watch every now and then. I don't really understand all of the hate against it , I think people can watch movies and just not like them for whatever reasons
I never said that people could not dislike this movie, I am just confused as to why people would. I understand how some people can't get into it, but I can not see why people would dislike it.

I LOVE this movie . and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore . I think they should replay it every other day until it’s off the air forever . It is my favorite Disney movie ever !!! And I think the song is amazing and I want it to be my life song . Awww, I love that movie too!!! That was one of my favorite Disney movies as a child! I miss it! I was 13 when that came out, and it was my favorite movie of that year! I loved everything about it, even the music.

Don't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit, crisp dialog or clever social commentary. This time around, the premise of Northanger Abbey has been updated in a very sensual way! In this version,Catherine's erotic daydreams are not just silly fantasies, but a connection to the world of adult sexuality she is just peeking into with her daylight adventures. By day she is very prim and demure, and her swain Henry treats her with the utmost courtesy. But as her own sexual nature awakens, her daydreams shift every so subtly from mild to steamy to lurid!

When I saw the preview for this movie, I figured to myself, "here's another dumb TV movie that's written with the thought and complexity of a soap opera," but when I saw it I was surprised. Tiffany-Amber Thiessen stars (and proves that she can indeed act if given the chance) as a woman who falls in love with and marries a man (Now and Again's Eric Close) but begins to lose trust in him when a series of rapes begin to take place in her community.

Personally, I regard "The Egyptian" in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known Australian movie commenter & critic named Bill who was renowned for his insight & broad vision of people & places & particularly of films. This movie fitted the Bill perfectly & I came to appreciate his commentary & enthusiasm for this movie that emerged all the more as I watched it, as I was literally drawn into it, minute by minute, beyond his introductory comments, on my initial viewing many years ago.To me, it was propelled, layer upon layer, within half an hour, into an intriguing & fascinating production!

An extremely down-to-earth, well made and acted "Rodeo" Western. No gussied up stars needed here as all cast members were regular people telling a real life story about a rodeo hustler and his entourage in the 60's and 70's West. But hats off particularly to Slim Pickens for giving what I think was his signature performance, especially given the fact that he had been a rodeo clown in real life. His role went far beyond the mere clown role as he deeply dealt with all the "ups and downs" of the hard-nosed rodeo life and the psychological devastation that so frequently surrounds such a life style.

Guess a few upscale film directors were sitting around sipping their absinthe , grappa , aramangac or jungle juice some time ago, and said, "you know, we need a really good movie set in the jungle with lots of natives, tough-but-handsome white explorers, and big-titted white damsels. It must also have a love triangle, wherein the two most attractive women have a sexual fling with one white male, who is in turn pursued by the other woman. We'll make the explorer a British officer. And the love triangle is between an American woman, a British soldier, and a French explorer."

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC, or any big city of mid-century America. The colors, thecars, the clothes and the coming of the Womens Movement. It reflects thecomf-cozy attitudes of relationships between men and women in thecorporate world. In some ways, things gave changed and in others, theyhaven't changed at all. Women still want what men have today, but theynow have all sorts of laws and equality mandates to get it for them. Inmy opinion, beautiful women will still THROW themselves at men inpursuit of thier goals!

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies , along with Spaceballs ( although I will openly admit , I love both Spaceballs and the Naked Gun Series ) . This movie is just a fun, and at times ridiculously funny film , and that's what I look for in the movies I watch. It's great to see so many classic comedy actors in this flick, as well as Gene Wilder. The story doesn't matter, the acting is great, and the laughs are even better. If you want a movie that will make you laugh and smile, check out The Producers now !!!

In Mississippi , the former blues man Lazarus ( Samuel L. Jackson ) is in crisis , missing his wife and children , and his last record was a flop. He tries to find work as a bluesman and finds a job as a janitor at a recording studio. The record company president ( Branford Marsalis ) asks him to make a record in order to rekindle sales, and his wife Martha ( Sharon Leal ) offers him a job at the record label . In the meantime, he finds out that his son is suffering from the same disease that his wife had.

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we 're in a bigger hole than ever . That 's because we went to war for the wrong reason. "I don't have the answer," said former Gov. Tommy Thompson, one of five presidential candidates speaking Saturday to about 1,000 people at a town hall-style forum in a high school in Wausau, Wisconsin. "I would go and sit down with these leaders in Iraq and make a deal with them to create a democracy." I agree with Gov. Thompson that we can't just walk away.

Forget about the plot of this movie. Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Vincend D'Onofrio. Forget about the fact that it is one of the few movies starring Jennifer Lopez that I can stomach. Although the story made be impossible to believe and much of the dialogue seems contrived, the one and only important thing to remember when contemplating watching this movie is that it contains some of the most amazing and disturbing imagery ever put on film. It is as if Salvador Dali decided to make a crime drama.

It happens often , while growing up , a Hollywood movie impresses a youth . It not only lasts a lifetime but also influences him/her in someway . I happened to be in such a situation in the year 2000 , when the first X Men movie with Hugh Jackman hit theaters . I was already a huge X-Men fan , having read all the comic books , watched 2 series on Cartoon Network , and played every single X Men game on my PS1/PS2/PSP . So, you can imagine that the X Men fever was at its highest when the movie hit the silver screen.

I haven't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way; that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. I was busting for the loo; and I didn't even want to pause it because I was drawn right in. Emotive; powerful; very moving; horrific and heart-breaking. It gives you an amazing insight to South Africa; their struggles and their lives. The acting by the leads were mind-blowing and the script was incredible. Despite the terrible events that unfold in this film and how horrific the story is; I was captivated.

This game is very good for the n64. You can skate as Tony Hawk, Bob Burnquist, Steve Caballero, Kareem Campell, Eric Koston, Bucky Lasek, Rune Glifberg, Andrew Reynolds, Elissa Steamer, Jamie Thomas, Rodney Mullen, Chad Muska, and maybe some more skaters. The game doesn't have Mike V or Bam Margera. Dang! Well anyway, the gameplay is awesome. The level School II is a great level with so much to skate. In Career mode, you collect SKATE, get money, get high scores and other various things in 2 minutes.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I was so happy to see this one and I love her in this role. I can`t wait for more films to come. I am a big FAN . I hope that more will be in the future. Sadly I only have the VHS version but I do hope a DVD release will follow. It`s a must have! I`ve only seen this on VHS so far. But I`ve heard that it is available on DVD.

I got this movie with my BBC "Jane Austen Collection" (5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations) and didn't like it at first. It's completely different from the others and it lacks, or so I thought, one of the qualities that I enjoy in all other Austen movies: cheerful common sense. The nightmare scene in which Mrs. Richards apparently sews her fingers together was especially upsetting.I still don't like to watch the finger-sewing scene but I do love hearing Mrs. R. saying, dreamily, while she sews, "My only acquaintance...tore my gown."

Having just watched this with my mother ( Who got it for Christmas ) i was thrilled to find something new on the forum! Hope you and yours have a good day. Just wanted to say i have just seen the film and thought it was great, I hope you get to make a sequel and that you get a chance to show it at the Oscars. I would love to meet you guys when i come to London! Wishing you the very best for 2008 and look forward to seeing more great stuff! Thank you for making a terrific movie.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me, I don't remember it being this scary when it was originally made, but I don't know how old I would of been when I watched it for the first time or what my frame of mind would of been like so I can't tell you why it would of been scarier now than back in 83 when it was made, but it is a scary movie for sure and one of the scarier ones.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film 's lead character, J.T., who works as an escort in Melbourne, Australia. The film is a black comedy and also a drama, exploring the intersections of art, sex work and money. It's an insightful look into the real life experiences of men and women engaged in sexual service. J.T's world is populated by a range of interesting characters, many of whom are clients, who all help J.T. understand the realities of the world of sexual escorts and the impact of his actions on his family.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film . To have it all make sense when the movie is over and that it has made sense all the time. That you have not been pulled out of the film to be in your living room and you have not noticed that the clock has read 8:40 when you got up from your chair. That is what happened to me last night. I sat and watched the 2009 French-Canadian film Incendies. I was completely engrossed and I felt I was in that world. The film was so real and so visually gorgeous.

This film had me spellbound this evening. Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted. John Voight, this cast of little known black actresses and most of all, the children, made this a worthy way to spend a Sunday evening. How wonderful to see the early work of this seasoned actor, as well as Paul Winfield's excellent portrayal of Mad Billy. I can't see why anyone would say that Hume Cronyn is miscast in the role as superintendent. Who would they have chosen? The shrill character actor, Charles Lane?

This was an excellent show. It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (From EnVogue) played the teen aged daughter. The show dealt with subjects such as sex, peer pressure and puberty. IT was about a middle class black family who had a teen aged daughter and son who moved to a middle class neighborhood from Oakland or somewhere (I can't remember). I remember several episodes but the one I remember most was when their cousin got her period for the first time. I was probably 7-8 when I first watched it and I was able to keep up with the program.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for "Once Upon A Time in the West" but couldn't persuade Clint Eastwood to appear in. Three tough-looking gunfighters ride into a town. One is dressed like the Man with No Name in a poncho. Another is dressed like Colonel Mortimer from "For A Few Dollars More," and the third is garbed like Django, except he rides a horse instead of pulls a coffin behind him with a machine gun in it. Our hero meets them in Main Street behind a wagon loaded with three coffins.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002 , `` l'auberge espagnole '' was also very well greeted in other countries. The film earned more than 10 million euros and 8.6 million admissions. The film is based on the comics by Joann Sfar and Frederic Berin. It is the first feature-length production of director Gilles Bourdos after a career as director for advertising and a documentary. After his first film with Romain Duris was a hit in the French cinema, Romain Duris has become a popular actor. He has recently appeared in The Beat That My Heart Skipped.

I can't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten. To be honest, I saw the preview for this movie, and the premise looked intrigued me. Yes, I rented it after reading others' comments. They are correct in that some of the acting leaves a lot to be desired. They are also correct that one of the best performances of this movie was that of Dr. Graves.Also interesting is Scott Clark, who plays Grant, the kid in the wheelchair. I identify with the character he played, perhaps because I am in a wheelchair.This movie is certainly worth your looking at.

Although dated, this film is definitely worth a watch. I saw it about eight times as a teenager when it opened and it changed my life...I just HAD to live in New York. It has great opening shots of the Manhattan skyline with Johnny Mathis crooning "Romance is still...the best of everything..." that rival those of West Side Story. There is a rather stilted performance by the world's REAL first Supermodel, Suzy Parker (sorry about that, Janice D.), but it's great eye-candy!

I'm seen this documentary in its feature-form, in a movie theatre. And... wouah! The pictures are astonishing, one really wonder how by Jove did they manage to film those waves, those animals, those... is that a plant ? a predator ? a creature from the movie Abbyss ? Anyway, it's remarkable. Sure we've seen a lot of such documentary on TV, with weird animals and so on, but none with such a beauty, a precision, a deep emotion. The only downside is the commentary.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat, but as the film progresses, the two boys have fewer scenes together. This slows the pace considerably. Billie "Buckwheat" Thomas gives a very strong performance in his early scenes. When he is left behind on the riverboat, his fear and abandonment are palpable and his tears are truly heartbreaking. When he goes from man to man asking for help and is repeatedly rejected the viewer really begins to wonder if this is a comedy or not. Watching a children's birthday party through a picket fence is another moving moment.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances. I just read a user comment concerning the performance of the actress who plays a conniving courtesan who fleeces Sinuoeh, the lead character. I remember a mini-biography of this actress following the movie the last time I saw it. Apparently, she was a Holocaust refugee, discovered by a French husband and wife in the movie industry who were taken with her extraordinary beauty. She died very young and under tragic circumstances. Gene Tierney is also outstanding in this film.

I'm absolutely disgusted this movie isn't being sold. All who love this movie should email Disney and increase the demand for it. They'd eventually have to sell it then. I'd buy copies for everybody I know. Everything and everybody in this movie did a good job, and I haven't figured out why Disney hasn't put this movie on DVD or on VHS in rental stores. At least I haven't seen any copies. This is a wicked good movie and should be seen by all. The kids in the new generation don't get to see it and I think they should.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / didn't understand this wonderful film. What a sad life he must lead!This movie has more to say about life and relationships than most I've ever seen, yet it's not dark or preachy like the "ordinary people" type of film. It is mostly humorous, though not technically a comedy.The whole thing feels a little like a fantasy, perhaps Shakespear's "Midsummer Nights' Dream." Beautiful, intelligent women abound, with wonderful cinematography and a non-insulting screenplay that doesn't miss a beat.I look forward to seeing it every time this film is re-run on cable.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as "the murder mystery", as the addition of sound to films helped to make a more faithful translation to film of what the audiences experienced in the original plays. And since horror films were very popular in those years, by enhancing the horror elements of the plots the murder mystery films experienced a popularity almost equal to what it enjoyed in the previous decade (in which the first movies of the genre were produced).

In Crystal City , a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis ( Ben Johnson ) and Sandy ( Harry Carey Jr. ). After Sandy is injured in a fight, the Mormons let Travis stay at their farm while Sandy recuperates. Travis learns that the ranch is located near the Mexican border, where a gang of horse rustlers have been killing and robbing Mormons. Travis enlists his old friend Pecos ( Rodolfo Acosta ) for help to stop the thieves, and together they head into Mexico, determined to bring the rustlers to justice.

In Crystal City, a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis (Ben Johnson) and Sandy (Harry Carey Jr.) as wagon masters to lead their caravan to San Juan River. Along the journey, they meet first the broken wagon without water of the quack Dr. A. Locksley Hall (Alan Mowbray) and the prostitutes Denver (Joanne Dru) and Fleuretty Phyffe (Ruth Clifford). Then the sadistic outlaws Clegg boys decide to join the Mormon caravan to disguise the patrol leaded by the Sheriff of Crystal City that is chasing them.

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film . I had just seen the MOOG doc by the same director , and I liked it so I decided to watch this one as well. But it was really really good. Sadly, I just found out Bruce died in 2009, 35 years after the end of his career, and 10 years after this movie was made. It's so interesting to see how he grew up with the instruments and how they influenced the music that was played in those times (and still does).

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain (of course, because it's so sensational) that it missed most of the movie, which is about a developing, although rather simply drawn, relationship between Lazarus and Rae as they attempt to recover from their past pains with each other.Of course, with the premise of a nymphomaniac in chains, it's no surprise that there's plenty of implied sex involved. However, at it's core, Black Snake Moan is a basic tale of redemption and the healing power of helping another person along.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made , and the producers don’t take much care about quality. I was therefore taken aback and pleasantly surprised when we watched “Pamana” last night, a movie produced here in Cebu, which is a heartwarming film about an estranged father-daughter relationship. This is a family drama film about a man trying to get the blessing of his daughter to finally see his grandchild. The daughter is the one who gave him all the pain in his life and the grandchild is the child of the man’s grandchild.

...I saw this movie when it first came out in France, in my hometown, 54 years ago, I was nine, and today I still remember each black and white frame, especially the black ones, because it was so tense, scary, those sneaking attacks through that dark pass in the mountain, the two soldiers, prisoners forced to fight each other by their captors, the last battle with the uncovering of the wagon with the Gatling in it firing away, the last fight between Peck and the chief, and the Happy End which let me take back my breath.

'The Cell ' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally . The serial killer of this film is a maniac, a psychopath who kills on the streets at night. There is no motivation for the crimes committed by the killer. The victims are just ordinary people walking around the streets at night and no one really knows them. The police have been baffled by this maniac's actions. At the same time a psychopath is locked up in one of the cells in a psychiatric unit.

Just see it! It's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time. See it more than once. Everything that is seen or heard on the screen is intentionally crafted to evoke a feeling, sensation or tone. The clarity of certain visuals and the crispness of certain sounds are deliberately contrasted with blurred images or pops, crackles, hisses and barely audible sounds. The structure is non-linear and cyclical. Motifs recur as time runs both clockwise and counterclockwise. Expectations regarding "plot" and character" are broken signaling a non-traditional use of film to tell a story that is both contemporary and as old as humanity.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release. It is a delightfully cute and funny movie in the spirit of 'Benji' though much improved and focused more on the actors than the dogs. The simple portrayal of life difficulties in a humorous way, followed by the bullies and villains getting their just deserts, is both sympathetic and heartwarming. It is also thought provoking. With deft subtleness this movie affects ones awareness of cruelty, personal behavior, and bullying. Movies have different genera's and different purposes.

`` Two Hands '' is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life story and fiction, where a real life person is playing a dramaticised version of that persons life. If you can overlook the flaws of `` Two Hands '' then you will enjoy the ride. The cast is a delight to watch and there is a strong Australian flavour that is obvious to the viewer.It is a great ride that is well worth a trip. It is well acted but the script is weak in places. It is a story that will be remembered, even if the cast is overshadowed.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film. It will take you back to the old days of science fiction when it was a bit cheesey and a little bit gory. There is nothing special about the film that will really stick to your mind after seeing it. It is a fun film to watch while you have nothing better to do. The main characters of this film are pretty simple. A guy and girl who have been together a while but don’t really know anything about each other other then their name.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the year. When I saw it I saw why. It has a very dark tone and it has some really graphic scenes that could make you turn away. It is really messed up in a good way. I am going to warn you, this review contains some spoilers so read ahead if you would like to know some more about the film. Todd Haynes directed this movie. The first thing I have to say about this film is that it has beautiful shots.

Fata Morgana, the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog, filmed over several years in the late 1960s, is one of those rare DVDs that should be listened to with the commentary turned on. It is a visual feast of North African (mostly Saharan) imagery that is timeless. You simply could not tell that it was made over thirty-five years ago. The soundtrack to the film, including German classical music (Mozart and Handel), and rock music by Blind Faith and Leonard Cohen, also lends its timeless quality.

* * SPOILERS AHEAD * * It is really unfortunate that a movie so well produced turns out to besuch a disappointment. When I watched the trailer, it seemed to look likea good movie, and I was looking forward to it so much. I was notdisappointed. The scenography, the acting is all excellent. However, Iwanted to be blown off my seat and I was simply not. The storyline is avery interesting one and well-developed in parts. However, I did not feelthrilled while watching. It seemed like a long wait for nothing in theend.

"The Honkers" is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time. When we were shooting, everyone connected with the production figured that Slim was Academy Award material. Unfortunately, United Artists had a James Bond picture in release at the same time and did not devote much attention to "The Honkers". I personally feel this film was under-rated by most critics. Sam Peckinpaw's "Junior Bonner" was out at the same time and seemed to impress the critics more than our film. Also, Cliff Robertson had a rodeo film out a few months before our release and that might have hurt us, too.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks ( Jamie Bartlett ) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo ( Chiwetel Ejiofor ) .A member of the South African Police ( SAP ) is trying to convince Mpondo to turn against his friends in the Pan African Congress ( P A C ). Mpondo is a freedom fighter working for a better life for the people. The Pan Africanists are a political movement fighting for equal rights for the African people in a country run by the racist South African Police. This is the reality of the period of the 1950s, during the apartheid period.

I'm not the type of person to watch T.V. shows because the acting normally sucks or it's unrealistic or TOO dramatic! But this show is perfect. Everyone can act, and you can relate to the characters and their situations. Everyone has their own personality and Lorelai Gilmore is the best for her sarcastic comments that can make any bad situation seem a little funny. Rory Gilmore is a good role model for all girls. She takes pride in wanting to attend Harvard and boys/boyfriends always come second in her book. She's a loyal friend and always the peace maker.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be a musical. Woody Allen is one of my all-time favourite screenwriters. His films have been an inspiration to my own work, particularly in the sense that he has always done things his own way. His work is never predictable, and never easy. Allen has a unique way of writing for the cinema screen. When you sit down to watch one of his films, he wants you to be thinking about the movie long after you've switched it off.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door, I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling. On the one hand, I'm happy. I'm watching something that has been well thought out, seamlessly executed and just daring enough to be interesting. On the other hand I find myself lamenting the level of comedy generally produced. TV and films are so consistently packed with easy, condescending crap that we find ourselves judging excellence within a scale of mediocrity. Then you see someone like Davis, who, without the "benefit" of studio notes or substantial budget; can create a really cool little comic gem.

Unlike some of the former commentators , I was ( and am ) an avid fan of the Carpenters . I am 19, and have only been listening for 3 or 4 years. I got into it from my mother and father , who have been fans of Richard and Karen's music for as long as I have been alive. However, it's only been recently that I have become totally obsessed with the pair. There is nothing that I would not listen to from them, they truly are amazing vocalists and the music is so catchy.

I don't think I have ever seen a better movie parody. Mel Brooks is insane. EVERY time I watch it I find something new and it makes it even more funny than the time before. Cary Elwes is perfect for the role of Robin Hood. It has a great and unexpected ending that leaves you cracking up. Every character is great from Little John and Will to Maid Marian and Broomhilde. I laughed the whole way through and will never get tired of it. Watch it! !If you liked Cary Elwes in this Movie, you must definitely see The Princess Bride.

Maybe it 's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel , or a fondness for its theme , or an appreciation for the music that underscores it , but I have to say that The Egyptian has become the most watched movie on my DVD collection over the years. While the movie follows the life of the famous Egyptian Queen Cleopatra from her childhood through her reign and eventual suicide it is the music score that really brings the film alive. It is full of lush, ethereal tones and melodies that give the story the mystic quality it demands.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by , no matter how bad it’s supposed to be. The guy really knows his shit. And I’m not just talking about music. That’s a given. Brewer knows a hell of a lot about a lot of things. That’s a fact. Brewer’s latest film, Footloose, opens this Friday in theatres everywhere, and if the early buzz from some of my colleagues in the biz is any indication, it will be one of the biggest hits of the fall.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites. The unsung hero of his generation. Nobody mentions Cukor in the same breath as John Ford, Howard Hawks, William Wyler or Billy Wilder and yet, look at his filmography. From sparkling comedies "The Philadelphia Story" "Adam's Rib" "Holiday" Psycho melodramas "Gaslight" "A Double Life" a great semi western "Heller in Pink Tights" not to mention "My Fair Lady" or "Travels with my Aunt" He was at the service of his actors, he never put himself in front of the camera.

Renee Zellweger is Betty, a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse, who is infatuated with a soap opera actor (Greg Kinnear), and who is married to Del, a cheating, stupid male chauvinist who's trying to sell some stolen drugs. Unfortunately for him, he gets brutally, bloodily murdered instead, while Betty secretly watches. It leaves her unhinged, believing that Kinnear is really the character he plays, Dr. David Ravell, and that she is his RN ex-fiancée. She heads for LA to find her lost love, not knowing the stolen drugs are in her trunk.

If you want to see a movie with nudity, sex, drugs, alcohol, brutal beating of a woman and child rape, this movie will satisfy you. If you want to see a man creatively exact revenge on the treasure of a wife who left him, this movie has it. You've already heard the wonderful music that keeps the raw emotion going. The surprise is that in a story of violence, action and music a climax can come in a moment of silence, without a pedantic speech, which transforms the movie.

It came before "the ten commandments" "land of the Pharaohs" "Ben Hur" and it's overlooked today.How unfair!Based on Mika Waltari's mammoth novel ,it doesn't cheapen it!Waltari's novel was so huge only a miniseries could have done it justice (I hope it will be done some day).Waltari,whose message is essentially Christian remains intact(another of his books "the secret of the kingdom" (first part) takes place after Christ's death in the Holy Land).

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there . Alright , more than a little ... but its fun . I really enjoyed this movie and recommend watching it with a friends. One thing you need to do is look up a few things because the movie is kinda nonsensical .... but that's why you watch it right ... you watch it and then look it up . The story of a man who gets the opportunity to see his life from the outside , and to be honest this is probably the best way to describe the movie .

This film blew me away . I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot . After watching it I felt like I was in a time machine . This really is a must see film. This is a true story of the prisoners who revolted in Attica, a New York state prison, on September 9, 1971, and the aftermath. I was a young teenager then and I have no memory of hearing about it, but apparently the national press coverage was extensive. The film does a super job of portraying both the conditions of the prison and the rebellion.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including ` the young & the old, the good & the bad and everyone else that is! This is a very powerful and thought provoking film that has the power and the depth to change ones life. I have found my spiritual awakening after seeing this film and will follow it for the rest of my life. The message is loud and clear for those of you who have not heard it before! I hope this film gets the recognition that it deserves. A film not to be missed.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies, and this is actually the second time in my life I watch a Swedish movie on cinema! Therefor, I believe it's one of the best Swedish movies ever! The combination of thrill and humour is OUTSTANDING, and sometimes you don't even know if you should be terrified or just laugh! The plot is about this man, a writer who wants to go to Germany after World War II and help the Germans to start over. On the way to Germany, he is trying to help his friends on the train, which is however a bad idea.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War . My aunt actually played in this movie as one of the children. I think she might have been a slave. I never had a chance to watch it with her. I loved watching this movie when it came out. The special effects were excellent and I think it did a good job of keeping the viewer interested. This movie was filmed in 3-D, but I don't know if I could sit through it in 3-D. But it is worth seeing on DVD. It was a fun story, and a great look back at history.

` Skenbart ' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Netherlands itself. It is a dark comedy about a guy that tries to start his life over only to run into his old friend that he tries to run away from and has a new girlfriend. The story is great and funny. It has a dark sense of humor but it also has great acting. It also has a great soundtrack with some awesome songs. This is one of those movies that you're going to laugh and cry at the same time while you're watching it.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make inappropriate comments and lewd jokes I was always on guard, so to speak, when dealing with the opposite sex. When I first began to blog, it was not my intention to get involved with blogging relationships, but I soon discovered that in order to get the word out about my writing, I would be forced to engage with readers and fellow writers. To say the least, I’ve met some lovely women who have helped me to gain exposure and have shared my journey with me.

On their way to a country house to hear a new play being read a theatrical producer, his secretary, and the playwright end up stuck in the mud. They make their way to a nearby house, only to end up at the home of the playwright's fiance. If you can't guess that murder and mayhem are about to take place then you haven't been paying attention.This is a a good entry in the old dark house genre. Not only does it have a good mystery, you also have some very funny one liners wandering through it.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be a horror movie. The true story of a guy who's infatuated with pictures and got scared when he identified himself unexpectedly with one of them. The unbelievable story of A GUY who got scarier when the female-hero was deluding herself as well as the male-villain. Gosh, is this what life made us be? People deluding themselves about the perfect face imagining how that face should be perfect inside? "Toto, I think we're not in Kansas anymore".

Being an avid Carpenter Fan , I really loved this film ( although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired). This movie gives us insight into how the legendary musician really thinks and it's a lot darker than we might have imagined! This is not a typical bio-pic, It's about the journey of a complicated and brilliant man who lived a difficult life that was filled with many tragic losses. Randy Quaid gives a really fantastic performance as the legendary Country-western singer/songwriter. The rest of the cast is fantastic, too!

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002, "l'auberge espagnole" was also very well greeted abroad which is quite extraordinary for a French film. It is not difficult to define the reasons of this success. This movie made by one of the most interesting French film-makers of these last years, Cédric Klapisch, presents students coming from all over Europe and gathered all together under the same roof in Barcelona. These students are described like the ones you imagine or you see in everyday life: either untidy, either serious or with a sense of humor.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer ( exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle ) being woken in the middle of the night by his secretary. He wants to know if there's anything important in the newspaper. The only item the secretary is able to find is a short item announcing the marriage of a woman with whom the producer was involved a couple of decades earlier. The woman was a burlesque dancer ( Betty Furness ), the producer was a millionaire Broadway producer with a reputation for being a bit of a womanizer.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies , and this is actually the second time in my life I have watched one. (The other one was called "Körkarlen" by the way...). But that's not to say that I have nothing to say about "As It Is in Heaven"...
For a start - I love the Swedish way of writing movies... They are not afraid to leave the audience hanging, with a little mystery, some questions left unsolved - and I love it!

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival . I went in with the assumption that this would be the typical film you might expect from the Farrelly Brothers, and boy was I wrong. This movie was so out there that I don't think I laughed as hard at any other movie the whole time I was at the festival. Shannon Elizabeth, who I will always associate with "American Pie", does a great job of playing the girl who is a "gold digger" and the one you would not expect to do this.

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly wanted to wanted to see again. When I saw Raquel Welch's name in the opening credits, I decided to watch it. It was actually mildly entertaining, and took me back "in the wayback machine" to the farcical movies that Hollywood churned out during the sixties, much in the same genre as the current Austin Powers stuff. Oh the acting was not superb, nor was the plot, but it was worth watching.

In "Black Snake Moan," writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me felt like dismissing the entire film as pretentious--a sweltering Southern parable with some oh-so-risky subject matter. The movie also contains a heavy spiritual subtext where religion is being hauled into the picture--again, this is integrated without subtlety. After the darker opening scenes, the film increasingly blunts its edge until the entire production comes off with the artificial quality of a stage play (and I'll admit, the last 15 minutes go way too far into "Happy Ending" territory for my liking).

I lack cable-vision and no longer have "DirecTV". So being a rural resident I have to wait for DVD releases. Being a lover of blondes but not blonds, I of course not only have "Barb Wire", but I have "Stripperella: The Complete First Season". I've not yet found "VIP" or a second season for Stripperella. I have the "Baywatch Hawaiian Wedding" DVD. I have the issues of "Playboy" that Pamela Denise Anderson posed in. I could go on. I love Pamela!

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time. There is nothing remotely new about this show. It's essentially a rip-off of a few other anime and a few movies. Let's start with the fact that the characters are practically copies of Naruto, Shinn Asuka, Sasuke Uchiha, Rin from FMA, and a host of others. The setting is so cliche' that you've seen it all before. The plot is about a group of heroes going to another world where they have to fight monsters and other villains.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings. In Europe for example we've had years of war and though one nation could never eradicate the other, the old enemies always ended living next to each other or WITH each other at the end of the conflict. In the US, the immigrants white population exterminated the aboriginal population to near extinction. the US citizen never had to live with its enemy. This explains in my view the often simplistic nature of Hollywood movie when they try and explain a foreign country's strife.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford 's best in my opinion . No major stars , no huge budgets ,just an all american story told in a simple way . This film is a great film to show your kids and it is definitely a great film for families to see . The performances are all excellent especially the three lead actors . The scenery ,music and action is wonderful . I would rate this one of the top films of the year . A great western . 10/10 Excellent and one of the great westerns
I love westerns, and I have watched this film many times over the decades.

Our America is multi-cultural , with so many sub-cultures . This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time. In the 60’s when race was an important issue, when it was still a taboo to live your life in an open way. I think what this movie captures is the struggle to be who you are, the internal conflict. The fact that a black man, in this day and age, was able to tell a story about race in America that resonated so deeply was a very important step for us as a country.

As Betty Sizemore (Renee Zellweger) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del (Aaron Eckhart) being murdered by the vengeful hitmen Charlie and Wesley (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), her bruised sense of reality becomes totally immersed in the fantasy world of her favorite soap opera. In a state of complete denial and delusion, Betty escapes both physically and mentally from her unsatisfied, small town life to search for "Dr. David Ravell" (Greg Kinnear), the handsome and loving hero of "A Reason to Love", a soap opera set in a hospital and produced in Los Angeles.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have `` DirecTV '' . So being a rural resident I have to wait for things to go up on-line ( I have dish ) or the good will of people like you who have it or want it . Thanks for taking your time to provide me with the download . My daughter is very much interested in it . Thanks again and have a great weekend . This is not the complete series. There is an extra episode called "My Favorite Martian vs. the World". It was a pilot for a short lived spinoff series.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time. I believe that if you just watch one episode of the show you cannot judge in completely on that one episode, (this include the movie) You must at least watch a series of this show, get inside the characters, become familiar with there surroundings and the situations which they are in. When you become familiar with the show then it will start appealing to you. Now the movie has a few changes to the series which is slightly disappointing, but it still works.

Pat Conroy 's autobiographical book `` The Water Is Wide '' proves to be something of a Southern `` Up the Down Staircase,'' telling of the tribulations of young black teachers in a one-room schoolhouse on the sea islands of the Carolinas. The story of his experiences at Beaufort High in the early 1960s has become a bestseller, thanks in part to a star-making appearance on Johnny Carson's talk show and the fact that it was released just as the school year was starting. Mr. Conroy arrived in the Beaufort schools in the summer of 1964 to replace an 84-year-old principal.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their "Erasmus year" in Barcelona which by the way is one of the most beautiful towns in Europe and is an ideal location. The idea itself with all the different languages is great and gives the film an original atmosphere. There are some clichés about the countries but most of them are true! The characters could not better represent their different countries.Having experienced "Erasmus" on myself during my exchang semester in Italy I can say that is movie is incredibly authentic.

`` Jaded '' takes on the complex question of abuse : the perpetrators and the victims . In lesser hands, the issue could be trite and sensationalized . Not here . In fact, we get a subtle, yet intense, examination of what abuse does to the abuser , the victim, and the survivor . As a whole, it's as much about relationships as it is about surviving abuse . In other words, `` Jaded '' is as much a study of a family on the edge as it is an examination of the emotions behind the issue of abuse and recovery .

This is the best movie I have ever seen . It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate . If you have a heart you will enjoy it. It is long but you wont get bored you have to watch to the very end you will be glad you did . My mother bought the movie to me when I was 18. It's been 30 years since I have watched this movie and I still remember it like yesterday. It is one of the best love stories ever! I cried so much when I watched it and still does now, it is such a wonderful movie.

Although dated , this film is definitely worth a watch . I saw it about eight times as a teenager . it was the first film to be given an ‘A’ certificate and was directed by Ken Hughes , who later gave us the 1969 version of The Italian Job . The film was based on the novel, The Dock Brief, by Cy Endfield, who also wrote the screenplay and co-directed.
