The film tells the story of an aging criminal barrister named Frank Farr (Richard Attenborough) , a widower whose life revolves around the legal system.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person's past? this film was very disturbing to watch in the sense that it was a true story and to think that humanity is still so cruel after all these years makes me ashamed everyone is human and everyone has the right to live their life in peace and harmony live and let liveif anyone knows the quote please let me know Thank youthis film should be shown a lot more publicly as true events as horrific as these shown in the film should be known to all in the hope that things will change sooner rather than later.

I 'll be brief : I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this film that made me enjoy it ... so much so , I'm now considering buying the blu ray version ... which is an absolute rarity for me as i normally loathe such films. The movie is a light romance / comedy ... and yes , it has the same feel as Pretty Woman ... which is why it's a good choice for this genre as it sets the right tone ... but it has enough differences to be its own film .

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! It is a film that families can enjoy and serious movie lovers. The locations in Ontario evoked such a sense of nostalgia for the era. With so much garbage and superficial hype selling these days it is great to see that someone could back an independent flick. For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew, a narrative depth superior to most novels, wonderful music, philosophy and a connection to LIFE that I find difficult to explain. To immerse oneself in Die Zweite Heimat is for me akin to a spiritual experience, similar to the awe one gets when looking at the stars in a clear night sky. The language, and use of both colour and monochrome segments adds to the dramatic impact. The film inspired me to go to Munich and visit some of the locations, including the Edgar Reitz office.

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood teacher’s voice, the subject matter of WWI is difficult to comprehend in all of its depth and breadth. There is just too much information and it takes a lot of work for a high school student to uncover the complexities of such an important time in history. In addition, it is challenging to develop a personal connection to the topic. We are lucky if we can identify a grandparent who lived during WWII, but rarely have a grandparent who lived through WWI.

My kids loved this movie . we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie . we loved it
It is a good family film. I love this movie. It's about a family that lives in a big home and the oldest boy, Michael, doesn't get along with his parents and his younger brother. They have a lot of problems with him and he does some things wrong, but when he was a kid, he was a genius. He is so smart that he can speak different languages, and his brother, Anthony, is just the opposite.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. I've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it's proper rebirth on DVD. Of course it didn't have the same impact on me as it would have if I had seen in it the 80s, but director Lieberman (his film "Squirm" is excellent) makes good use of the lovely Oregon location and takes the time to develop the characters, not just to have them dispatched in creative ways. A high note, Brad Fiedel's whistling music is really creepy and adds to the desolate proceedings making this great fun for genre fans.

Ok, maybe Posse can't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies. But that's because it didn't have the FUNDING those movies had. Obviously, whenever you want to produce a story such as this one, focusing on African American historical involvement (and NO, servants and 'mammies' are not historical involvement), Hollywood isn't going to be too supportive. And believe me they weren't. The producers and actors sacrificed a lot of 'out of pocket' expenses to make "Posse", just so that the story could be told. I think that alone is commendable.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door , I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling . On the one hand, there's the satisfaction in seeing a short with a different approach than what's normally seen. The visuals are fresh and imaginative. Then there's the sadness of knowing that there aren't more like this . The story of Boy-Next-Door feels like the work of a mature filmmaker who has a unique vision and can bring it to the screen, but doesn't have the financial backing to produce a full feature.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about . Or , maybe it isn't so simple, after all, to try to explain the meaning and significance behind a film like Fata Morgana. The film itself is a visual experience. I will try to give an idea, though it will be difficult and I'm sure I'll fail miserably, but what the hey . . . Basically the film is about a man named Peter who is on holiday with his wife and children in southern France, at a beach, near the Pyrenees mountain range.

I 'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film . If you have ever worked in an office full of middle managers you'll have experienced much of the humour in this movie. If you have worked with people with Aspergers Syndrome then you'll know that they can be highly functional and very creative. In this case it is the highly functional but creative employee who is on the way out and the office full of mediocre managers who stay! It is actually quite a funny film especially if you are able to identify yourself in the characters and situations.

The most enjoyable pet movie since Scooby Doo and Garfield . The story revolves around a 23 year old inventor who invents a remote control machine that lets him control any animal on earth. The problem is, the machine can be used by other bad guys to create havoc around the globe. Of course, the bad guys get the remote control machine. Now the hero must go around the world trying to retrieve the remote control machine. This film has some great special effects, but also a good story line and acting. The hero of this film is very believable.

it 's the best movie i have ever seen ! ! ! ! ! ! i just love them ! ! ! ! ! i hope i will see them on tour soon ! ! ! ! i liked it sooooo much ! it was the best movie ever! I just watched the new movie and really enjoyed it but I must admit that I can not understand what the guys are saying when they are speaking French. Is it possible to get the dialogue with English subtitles to play on my computer? I am a big fan, and the movie was amazing!

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore. I'm sure it pisses a few liberals off. The thing is South Park makes fun of everybody, much like the Simpsons did. If you get offended that a politician you like is made fun of then maybe you need a better sense of humor and are taking the show too seriously. With that being said this episode is hilarious and one of the best. Al Gores portrayal is hilarious, Cartman's scheme goes terribly wrong and the results will have you rolling on the floor laughing.

My wife and I saw this when we were 17 . The only good thing my father ever did (besides having us ) was buy tickets to see this film . We are 50 years old now so we have seen our share of films but this was the very best. I went to a midnight showing last weekend in a packed house. I had never read the book before, but I loved the film. It was a bit slow in the beginning. I'm not sure how much people were getting into the film by the time the little girl appeared, but we were definitely into it by then.

I'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things. However, SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work. The story, acting, filming, psychological themes, erotic quality and spiritual understanding are all really quite complex and compelling. Rose plays the complexities and shifts of a psychologically disturbed woman really quite accurately. My partner was particularly impressed with the sophisticated way the power exchange issues were handled. It was so intense for us to watch that we found ourselves leaving it three quarters through to "get tea" and I felt compelled to have a shower.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it or not. The first part of the film was interesting to me mainly because I’m a big fan of the concept of a parallel universe. But after about 35 minutes I started to become impatient waiting for some kind of plot to unfold. I kept expecting things to happen, but I was wrong. The entire movie was nothing more than just an elaborate setup for a really big payoff at the end of the film.

During the War for Southern Independence, GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against a Yankee invasion.In 1936, Hal Roach decided it was time for his popular OUR GANG kids to branch out into occasional feature-length films. With the big success of Shirley Temple in two Civil War period movies in 1935 (THE LITTLE COLONEL, THE LITTLEST REBEL), it was only natural that Roach would look in that same direction for his GANG. Although given a rather lavish production and distributed by MGM, GENERAL SPANKY was not a critical or box-office success.

` 5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters , sheep farmers, cowboys or some outback kangaroo wrestling. If you were lucky they would have an Aboriginal as an extra, and you would see lots of sheep or kangaroos. In fact there weren’t many films made at the time. The early silent films of the 1910s and 20s, the ‘Talkies’ of the 1930s, and the few post WWII films of the 50s. As well as Australian films, there was the odd American film that would be re-made in Australia.

One of the many backwoods horror 's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the best. Blood Cult is a tale of a small town in the 1930s that has been haunted by the vengeful spirit of a Native American. The movie starts with an Indian burial ceremony that goes a little wrong and starts a curse that is passed down though generations. Now in the eighties the town has a cult who are practicing black magic and ritual killings. And it's up to the police to stop it.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld, and it's hard to look back at a show that followed Seinfeld and compare it. As for the episode in question: I'm a guy, but I've read the review and it sounds like a great episode. It's so refreshing to hear a female character being the lead in an episode that doesn't have her pining for a man, or obsessed with her physical appearance. As for a female lead in a show that I'm actually watching: The Office has Pam!

`` Side Show '' is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures . Very gory and with a lot of twisted ideas that will keep you thinking . I liked it very much and I have watched it more than three times already . The two twin sisters who are very different from each other , one is pretty and one is kind of ugly so they are rejected by the circus and they end up working for it . But things get really bad for both of them and they start fighting for their lives against the evil circus director .

Brian ( Wesley Eure ) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton ( Conrad Bain ) . The firm is trying to keep a large company safe. Brian is trying to impress his boss. Brian is also working under cover to protect the boss’s daughter, Lisa. Lisa is having a hard time because her father believes that she is going to bring the wrong type of guy into his home. The plot of this movie revolves around a very rich man trying to find his long lost wife. His wife left him, and he has not spoken to her since.

I could n't believe the eye candy from start to finish . Being a fan of movies directed by music video directors like Spike Jonze, I felt like I was watching a movie in 3D. In fact I've never seen so much vivid detail in a movie. To begin, the cast is outstanding. The actors are very charismatic and it seemed as if every scene was staged for the purpose of being a movie frame. I know it's a little strange to think like that. I guess I'll be a little more specific.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release . It is a delightfully cute short (about 10 minutes) about a group of dogs that work in a factory. Every night at the same time (a la Rocky Horror), a gang of wolves come and attack them and take out one at a time. The only thing they can't do is bite the wolves back, so they devise clever ways to do so. I liked this short for its creativity and simplicity. The next two I watched during the festival were about dogs, and I'm getting tired of dogs.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction . This is what today 's documentaries are all about . It is an excellent movie , even better than the book , which is also wonderful . I loved both book and film. It's the best documentary made. It shows the true human side of these two women and their courageous stories. The film gives hope to many people going through similar situations as the two women. I saw this movie in a film class, it is very moving. This is an excellent film. This is an excellent portrayal of the lives of two women.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s, its shocking how not a lot of people know about it.this movie is definitely worth a look. it has all the things you need for a horror movie. especially the good old chills.i remember watching this movie for the first time about 15 years ago, but i couldn't remember the name of it, so i came to IMDb a few years ago to ask for help on finding the title. i eventually got the name of the title, and bought the movie.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. My interest has recently been rekindled by visiting Hilton Head - the next island over from "Yamacraw" (Daufuskie actually), and reading Pat Conroy's excellent "The Water is Wide". With the benefit of knowledge I have reappraised Conrack and consider it a masterpiece. Jon Voight captures the spirit of Conroy and the atmosphere of the film brings the book to life with some accuracy - a Hollywood rarity. Three things still strike me about this tale: 1.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film . It is an excellent entry point for African American history and a movie that should be in every Black home. It also is a movie that is so important to African American filmmakers because this film opened the door to many African American films to follow. It is a shame that there are so few films dealing with racism today. This is a film that needs a remake! The movie revolves around a group of friends who happen to live in a very prejudice neighborhood in 1973.

This is a really great film! It gets you thinking about your parents. How we all have fragile relationships we all have with them, unless we really make an effort to know who they are as people. And just as important, we should remember to open up and show them our real selves, not just who we think they want us to be. Definitely see this documentary! IMDb is making me write more text before they will post my comment, how odd. Usually online comments need to be short short, and here I am being asked to write more!

Okay I marked this spoiler so don't be upset when I wrap this up. Now I went into the movie expecting to see a very predictable movie. And I was right, as almost every horror flick I have ever seen it was predictable but not as bad as most. What helped was the story, I did not expect there to be a "WHY" to Kane's madness. But there was and while somewhat foggy you still got the idea and understand the madness. Now of course if you like something that will scare you for nights to come this is not the movie your looking for.

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist , I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out. Sometimes I will watch a trailer that I think will be a horrible movie and will not even watch the movie once it hits the big screens. This is how it happened with the first Hunger Games film. It wasn’t even on my radar until the day it hit the screens. The same thing happened to The Avengers ( I never planned on going to see it) and The Dark Knight.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim ( Richard Barthelmess ) who has one bad flight in the rain, then another on a dark night with a broken airplane and finally a flight in fog. The first flight ended in a crash. On the second he was able to get the plane up and then had to go down to a field to land. On the third flight the plane crashes into some hills. In the fog, Jim takes his passengers to a small town to land the plane. The people think it is a monster, especially when Jim flies the airplane around the city.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny ( and fun ) puns . The first shot we see in this sequence is Dilbert , who is shown here in his normal work clothes . He’s at home, and he wants to make himself a snack , but he doesn’t want to be disturbed by the noise that goes on in the office . So he gets his snack, sits in his living room and puts on his headphones , to drown out the sounds coming in from the office . But we know that he’s not really listening to anything in his headphones .

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot more concepts till now which has to be expressed and the film is a great media to do that. Well all great actors together hence nothing to say about acting or directing but the film gave us a great message through out. It has nicely predicted the conditioning of human minds with that of the patient. We all believe that what we believe is true with our own point of view and we want to solve all the problem accordingly.Hence from the professor to the maid servant all tried their own ways.

Ignore the bad reviews on here, this film is awesome! "Just Before Dawn" is a great example of what can be done in a film with a minimal budget if you have a dedicated crew, decent script, and a cool idea for a film. It's a hell of a lot of fun.I enjoyed it a lot more than most other 80's slashers because the killer is so unique. "Wrong Turn" ripped this movie off something fierce! There's plenty of blood and scares. My girlfriend was freaked out and she watches almost everything with me and doesn't flinch.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with "Valley of the Kings." These movies helped inspire a lifelong interest in Egyptology. (In 1975 I visited Egypt!) Seen today, "The Egyptian" suffers from flat dialog and a few gauche touches, but it's a glorious movie to look at -- the sort of thing Hollywood, alas, just doesn't do anymore -- and it has a great story... not just the usual boy-meets-girl or vengeance-is-mine affair. Too bad 20th won't re-issue restored prints of this to be seen on the Big Screen.

I loved this movie ! OH MY GOSH ! This movie rocked so hard ! I found it amongst some movies on Netflix and decided to give it a chance. It's one of those movies that I never heard about but I really liked it. If you don't care for gore, this movie isn't really for you. Lots of bloody action, gory kills. I love this kind of movie. The characters are superb. The story was really engaging. If you haven't watched it yet you should definitely give this movie a chance ! I would watch it again !

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary, it is obviously a labor of love and I think they did a pretty good job of putting together an enjoyable documentary about a person who has had so such little info available about him. It definitely has a fan worship feel about it, which is a good thing.I had heard of Bruce Haack but didn't know much about him, and I found the start of this documentary frustrating because I could hear other musicians talk about him, but Bruce Haack himself was kept way too far off in the distance.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms, I thought I would get them all done now. Dads Army, is my all time favourite sitcom, It ain't half hot Mum is also a classic as is You Rang M'Lord. I don't regard Hi De Hi as a classic, but it is still funny.It's about a holiday camp, similar to Butlins, but instead of red coats, it's yellow coats. It is ran by Jeffery Fairbrother, a well meaning man, but has the personality of a sock.

This movie has a lot to recommend it . The paintings , the music , and David Hewlett 's naked ass. It's worth watching this movie to see all that. Apart from that , this movie's basically a bunch of paintings set to music. Some paintings were more moving than others , and the ones that were more moving usually had the music that matched. I found it very touching to hear The Cure's Disintegration played in the background, for instance, and the painting that accompanied it looked like a dream. The paintings are all done by the great artist Timothy Hutchins.

This show is really great . It 's smart.It 's funny.It 's great acting and writing . This show is not afraid to show us a new story and new characters, but it 's really good. I have to say that I have a great time when I 'm watching this show but I have to say one thing that sometimes in the last episodes is really sad.And that 's all I 'm going to say ,because I 'm afraid that if I say something more ,I could spoiler something for you . And I don't want that .So watch this show and see it yourself .

When I was engaged , my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores . He would look for his specialty of the moment; I for mine. We would spend a good deal of time going from one to the next looking at all that the others had in stock. We also would talk about themes that we had discussed before and would share our ideas. We would always compare prices, but more often we would share our favorites. After we married we would go together to the more "advanced" bookstores as we could afford them.

One of the best! As being a fan of the civil war, I was very pleased with the first installment of the North and South trilogy. Patrick Swayze gives and extraordinary performance, as well as James Reed and Leslie Ann Down. In watching this fabulous story unfold into a time never forgotten, the subjects of love, passion, grief, shame, harmony, and cruelty come to life. I was first introduced to this series when I was in the eighth grade. Being a young boy, you would think that I wouldn't have been interested in this civil war soap.

Nurse Betty was definitely one of the most creative movies that's been released lately. It was funny, but it also had many touching moments. Zellwegger, Freeman, Rock, Kinnear, & the rest of the cast made their incredibly weird characters seem real. The story took such twist & turns that made it incredibly enjoyable to watch. If you're sick of the recent formula movies, see Nurse Betty for something completely different. Go see this movie in the theater or at least rent it when it comes out!

I'm not the biggest fan of westerns. My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven, and Tombstone. This movie though, I loved! It was great! The plot was well done, and it was a fun movie. Everybody who had a part in this movie did excellent! I even think it beat out both movies in someway. Well, not really Unforgiven because that was a superb movie that these two can't compare with in the long run. I do think it beat out Tombstone though. Both had its strong points.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright , Wagon Master was one of Ford 's favorite and best-known Westerns. This film was made in 1952 and starred Ford , Ward Bond , Linda Darnell and Ben Johnson. The story follows a wagon train heading towards the California gold rush in 1845. They are headed by an elderly Mormon patriarch (Johnson), with a new recruit, Bill (Ford) a bounty hunter who joined the party to bring back the last of his outlaw brothers in order to collect the reward.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox 's reluctance to release a DVD of this movie. It was soooo ahead of its time, and so much fun to watch. It is a movie that can be enjoyed by all age groups and for me it was just a wonderful experience. I still watch it on VHS but I wish so much it was available for purchase, as I'm sure there are many people who would buy the DVD version. I'd love to see it on DVD so much. Please release this soon!!

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare , but Fata Morgana is a good case . You can chalk up this film to the director’s desire to work outside the mainstream, as well as his desire to create a surreal world in the form of a film. The film is an interpretation of a book called The Necronomicon, a work attributed to H P Lovecraft, a prominent American fantasy writer of the 1920s. The film, as well as the book, explores themes of science, metaphysics and the supernatural. The title means ‘Foreboding Apparition’, and this is certainly an apt description.

I played Sam ( the porter , Lou 's sidekick ) in the Film `` Dead Rail '' Which later became a Video game on XBOX live. I also played in the cult TV show `Screwballs ' , and have had an acting career spanning 34 years and still going strong. Dead Rail the Movie
The film Dead Rail is an action thriller which is set in Scotland in 1947 , starring David Warner and David Soul. The film is available on DVD . I was cast as the role of Sam in this movie and went on to play many roles after that in many other films, TV shows and commercials.

I liked this a lot . The camera angles are cool , it 's not all jumpy like a Blair witch film. I like the use of flashlight . It 's a lot better than the typical found footage flick and it has some good scare scenes . This is the kind of film I would watch at a sleepover with a bunch of friends when you were 13. It 's not overly complicated and it 's not scary. It 's fun and entertaining, just not scary enough . I think this is one of those films that you can't judge unless you sit through it in one sitting .

It's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it's either a love it or hate it reaction. You'll probably either love it or hate it too. I think the best films are the ones that divide people because obviously they have some kind of impact. I'm in the five star camp because this film did a real number on me and made me want to go back and find out more about Afghanistan and Iraq. I have to admit that I was pretty tuned out when all that was taking place.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it . What a movie . I am now 45 years of age and have only seen it once , so when I saw it was on a DVD , I decided I had better buy it as I may not see it again for a long time , so I ordered one from Australia . A great movie with a wonderful cast and wonderful music . Very funny too. I would definately buy it on DVD. This movie is great. I got to see it in the theatres and I have watched it on video about 3 times already.

For my money, probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford ever made. The dialog is swift, clipped, to the point.l The story starts at the very beginning and only ends with the final credits. Ford uses a relatively small cast, but directs them and photographs them with a verve and a sweep of epic proportions. Grimly realistic, warmly amusing, brilliantly acted (hard to believe Johnsonj couldn't become a leading man after this), with the best photography and editing in any American black-and-white film.

I really like this show . It has drama , romance , and comedy all rolled into one . I've seen this show from when it came out so I have to say it hasn't changed. I love the story lines, all the actors have done a great job, they all seem really close as a cast. They also seem like they get along really great off screen too. The only thing I have to comment on is the way the story lines have gone over the last couple seasons . I really like how the show has a lot of funny episodes , but some are very serious.

This movie is Wonderful ! I can watch it again and again . Robin hood is Perfectly cast , and Taron egerton should have an Oscar nomination . If you haven't seen this already, it is a good movie and the actors are great in it. I'd recommend it for all the family, but I'd watch it first before you let your kids watch it. Great movie! One of the best I’ve seen! Wonderful movie!! The cast is amazing! The actors do such an incredible job! Robin Hood has been my favorite folk hero for a long time.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $300,000 of gold, along with a banker Clayton, who's there to see it reaches its destination, but it's suddenly robbed by the bandit Monetero. However Bahunda nicks off with the gold and hides it, but when Monetero tries to get it out of him, he's killed by soldiers. The only clue is that of a medallion, but Monetero is captured and soon would be executed. A stranger dressed up as a priest comes by (who after the bounty of Monetero) and offers to save his life for half of the gold.

it's the best movie i have ever seen!!!!!! i just love them!! i watch it every day! i have the episodes from the internet! here in Romania is being broadcast the 6 season! i'm happy that i have seen the show from the beginning and i'm glad that through the internet i can see the 7 season. until now, season 5 is my favorite one :D i love it because Logan appears and the scene where they jump is my favorite. i have liked Dean too, but Logan is best.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings . In Europe we know how important this kind of movies are. I think every country should have a Oscar movie like this! I’m so happy that they won an Oscar! It’s great that they can show how it is to live with disabilities and show the diversity of people! And the acting of the three leads is really impressive, I can’t take my eyes off the screen when they are acting. Such a great storyline. The three leads are phenomenal.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie. But at the earnest request of my friend who is an ardent fan of Aparna Sen, I decided to turn up for the movie. Going at this cheap theater really bothered me, cos I had seen King Kong for 50 bucks at one of the best theatres in town. Anywasy the movie starts of and surprisingly I wasn't complaining. A great story and some really wonderful wonderful acting on Shabana Azmi and Konkona Sen Sharma's part. Shabana Azmi a divorcée who has dedicated her life to the well being of her mother and step sister.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes. I saw it listed on the schedule at the Stanford Theatre in Palo Alto, and I vowed I would make the 40 minute drive. The Stanford is an old fashioned movie house that starts each movie with the curtains still shut Yes, they have curtains. They opened as the Fox logo fanfare began to play. When "The Best of Everything" appeared in huge pink letters spread against the New York City skyline, I knew I was right for waiting.I lapped this movie up.

On watching this film, I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. Karen Carpenter was a carefree, but very unconfident young lady, whose wonderful voice helped her and her brother Richard to soar the charts with wonderful songs. As with all celebrities of today, they were often criticised about their music as well as their looks, styles, etc. THis had a huge effect on Karen who raged a battle against her eating and drastically lost weight, which eventually caused her death. This heart felt film was not initially something which I would have thought of watching.

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film 's main achievements . When you hear a vague outline of the story  which, as you know, is about a teenage girl who is murdered, and who comes back from the dead as a revenant or zombie to exact revenge on her killer and his accomplices  you automatically imagine that the film will fall into one or another of the usual traps that have long been associated with this subject-matter: namely, it will either be exploitative and cheap  like The Burning, which also starred Jason Patrick Lewis  or else self-important and heavy-handed like The Crow, with its pseudo-literary pretensions.

Absolutely, I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting,fascinating and certainly beautiful film. It's not necessary to see all the episodes,since the first ones are the best,while the last ones are a-bit tiresome,but for any person who likes German's and their good-natured ways,all episodes are worth seeing.In typical german fashion, values are constantly questioned,even it's murderous Nazi past is confronted in the last episodes, the rich dialogues are particularly interesting. These episodes are recommended for anyone who is about to live or travel in Germany,preferably in original language!

`` The Cell '' is an exotic masterpiece , a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a genius but to a world we could all live in. I have to give this book a four star rating only because there were parts where I lost focus or got confused, not because it lacked creativity and intellect. I'll have to read it again to gain a fuller understanding of what is going on in this book. But it's a very entertaining story that leaves the mind dazed and full of thought.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s , its shocking how not a soul knows of it
I have seen the movie in the late 80's and liked it but it is difficult to find a copy anywhere. I just found this site by accident while searching for a copy of the movie. Teddy Bear January 16, 2013 at 6:44 PM
I recently found a video copy on Ebay, but it has been pulled. If anyone wants to buy a VHS tape I have one that I could sell for the original cover price, which is $40.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years , Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of the film medium with an unsurpassed body of work that includes documentaries, narrative features, and hybrid films such as the epic " Fitzcarraldo" and " Rescue Dawn" , Herzog's newest film is no different. In his quest to make a film of uncompromising quality and intensity, Herzog has once again brought together a cast of world class actors in the hope of making a modern day film noir that is as intense and memorable as the great films of old.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . There is just something about the whole idea of the "old wild west" that fascinates me . I've always loved to read about the way the west looked . I 've read some western fiction and non fiction and I just can't put them down . I think I 've only seen a few western movies . I can't say I really enjoyed any , but I do want to see some more . I think the ones I've seen that I enjoyed the most are Tombstone , and Dances With Wolves .

The best of everything . Just what is the best of everything ? It is different for everyone but for me the best of everything is a book by Louis Auchincloss. It has 61 short stories. I love the fact that the stories are based on true events that really did happen. You never know who the character will be and what they will get themselves into. In the beginning, you may not like one of the people in it but then the next day you will come back to it and think about who that person is. I love it.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . So, we're being more Blue? I just think that's silly. Being Blue isn't a lifestyle choice. Blue isn't the answer to the question. Blue doesn't make any sense. And I'm a big Blue person. I get it! But it's just a silly idea. And it's not like I'm a red person now, so it's not like I just turned into a completely different personality.

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good : The camera work was absolutely phenomenal . The photography was excellent with some amazing sequences of the different species in the ocean.The Bad : This was a documentary, so it is not going to appeal to everyone in the same way a narrative film will . I also felt like the story could have been more focused and developed instead of just giving us information in a scattered way .I also thought the movie was a bit long in some parts with the information it gave us on the different species of sea creatures .

I finally received my DVD today, viewed it and I'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical version of the film. As you may have read in previous reviews of "Rich and Famous" that the edited for TV version of the film that somehow made it onto VHS sometime in the late 90's but, now WB has corrected the error and released it on DVD complete with the airplane restroom scene, Matt Lattanzi's bare butt, and the scene in the Hotel room where Liz (Jacqueline Bisset) calls Merry (Candice Bergen) a C**t!

Recently I saw this movie again ( after 25 years ) . In the original there is a scene in which the hero and his friends are at the local bar and the local drunkard says: ” I was the 23rd man that you shot at in the war, I am the 10th you have killed this time ” …. In the second movie there is an addition to this scene: ” I am the second you have killed in this war”. It seems that the movie maker thought that it is not enough to make it clear that the guy has had some previous experience in war.

then you will be a big fan of this movie . Its almost the same basic concept , a nice chick turns into an evil seductive bitchy demon . It has almost the same plot as Hell Girl but it has a slightly different way of getting it all started . Basically a demon is trying to collect souls but a young witch gets in his way . After that we get an interesting twist but I will let you see the movie and find out for yourselves . One thing I will say though is that it's much better then I originally thought it was going to be .

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film. To have it totally wash over you, so that you absorb it as it is, and thus, experience it to the fullest. Every time I see it, 'The Egyptian' is such a film. Over the years it is a picture critics have loved to hate. Many have thrown darts at its vulnerabilities. But perhaps it is because of the very tone the film brings with it rather than its most obvious characteristics. It is at once forbidding, remote, possibly dangerous; beware of what lies within!

The show is GREAT. No words to describe it. Wonderful music. Incredible dance. The editors couldn't spoil it, not because they were not *that*bad*, but because the show is really *that*good*.The editors are compulsive cutters, you can't see a scene without a cut for more than 15 secs. It's OK to show various angles, but those guys were working with multiple cameras for the first time in their lives, and they will remind you of how many cameras they have every five seconds on average...

I love this film ( dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish , meaningless and misleading title that is! ) I never saw it in cinemas but have seen it on Tv many times , and bought the VHS many times too! I know I was a kid but i loved it, the story was so moving and I always wanted my family to have a big get together like this one too! I know that is not realistic, but it was always a dream! There is not a scene that is not beautiful, well acted, funny, or dramatic.

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** THE CELL / (2000) **** (out of four)"Do you believe there is a part of yourself, deep inside in your mind, with things you don't want other people to see? During a session when I'm inside, I get to see those things." --Catherine DeaneAnd so do we. One of the most visually stimulating films of the year, "The Cell" is a love/hate movie-either you love it or you hate it.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south. The story follows a man named Lazarus whose wife dumps him for his brother and finds Rae abandoned and beaten up on the side of the road. Lazarus finds out that Rae is a sex addict and was abused as a child so he decides to take matters into his own hands by tying up Rae with a chain to cure her of her wickedness. Samuel L Jackson and Christina Ricci have great chemistry together and their performances make you believe that through their struggles and search for redemption that Lazarus and Rae become best friends.

After I've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. I'm not saying it belongs in the top 250 of all times, but in it's genre it is a great movie. I know, not many people find it amusing to see how a legendary story like 'Robin Hood' is turned into a comedy. Many people still seem to believe that some things shouldn't be laughed with ... they are wrong. Mel Brooks has done an excellent job with Robin Hood: Men in Tights.

Okay, where to begin. Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous mime team Shields and Arnez? Bet ya didn't. But they turned it down complaining about robot make-up. Then they faded off into obscurity. Now, this movie has everything. A crazed killer robot who thinks he's dirty Harry. Lots of cool robots. It's funny, it's touching, it's the perfect date movie for people who love sci-fi and romantic comedies. It's the first robot romantic comedy. Now of course very few movies are perfect and there are some character issues.

This show is my absolute favorite. This show is intelligent, entertaining and always full of surprises. Lauren Graham is perfect as Lorelai Gilmore, a single mother who is Rory's best friend. Alexis Bledel shines as the beautiful and intelligent Rory Gilmore and Keiko Agena is one of a kind as Rory's best friend, Lane Kim. I love the witty dialog, it's what makes it unique about the show. Kelly Bishop is wicked great as Emily Gilmore and Edward Herrman is terrific as Richard Gilmore. Scott Patterson is a joy as Luke Danes and the band members are one of a kind to watch.

`` Please , do n't kill me ! I 'm just an actor ! '' `` Can you play dead?'' `` Like who? '' `` A dead person. `` I don 't know, I play lots of different things, can't I? '' `` I mean can you fake it? `` Yes, I can, but I don't know if I have the strength to fake it with you, '' said the girl , and the guy took her hand in his and they went out of the studio .

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie . They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to shine in this drama. I can not understand why so few people have seen this movie, but if you ever get a chance, it is worth your time, especially if you are a fan of these actresses and their careers in general! If you liked this movie you may like the one with Jackie as the same character called “Jackie Brown” and Candice plays a minor role in that one also.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to live together in an apartment in Barcelona, where they are all studying on international fellowships. Central to the story is Xavier ( Romain Duris),who may have lived a rather conventional life with his mother in France, but who quickly becomes a leader in the group, helping them deal with landlords and other problems. He learns about life and love rapidly. Duris has a wholesome appearance and gives a fine performance. The rest of the cast also play well.

Honestly , when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana , I did not have a clue as to how much it would affect me . As the movie began , I was very much entertained by the characters & the story . It was a story that had so many twists & turns . I was captivated by the acting of the cast , I was very impressed by the acting of the entire cast . They really played each role to its fullest & never let you down . The story was so different , yet it was one I could relate to & understand .

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim (Richard Barthelmess) who has one bad flight in over 4000 hours and is forced to give up commercial flying. He meets a beautiful girl named Jill (Sally Eilers) and the two start up an act involving flying and stunts. The two start a relationship, but when Jim is hurt, his brother (Tom Brown) takes over the act for a while and falls for his brother's girlfriend. From there, things get exciting and terribly terribly sad.This film is a pre-code because of several reasons.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall! As an archivist re: the Music Hall..I know what is and what is not associated with the New York venue. The film's Theodore is just the "Music Hall." No Rockettes are in the film. Only wonderful ice skaters plus superb actors and fun. Just thought you would like to know. Truly a wonderful film. You will never guess who the 'murderer' is while watching this film....till the very end. What a superb plot and beautiful ice skating.

Robert Altman, Nicolas Roeg, John-Luc Goddard--you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy? These and other directors were obviously chosen because they have not followed the mainstream, but created it. For those that complain that they did not adhere to the original story of the opera--How often does the music in a film directly relate to what is going on in the film? It is the mood that counts. This is what I believe the directors of these movies were doing: creating a contemporary mood for old operas. For the most part they succeed wonderfully.

I have been a `` huge '' rush fan ever since `` moving pictures '' and this concert is simply the icing on the cake! I am so happy to have been there and to have witnessed the amazement on the faces of all those who came to the show as I did (I was there in the front rows) it was absolutely fantastic! As you can see from the pics, Geddy Lee was wearing a nice shirt on which you could clearly read `` 48 years and 250 million albums later, I finally get it '' I believe Geddy Lee said those words when he saw how much people loved him.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances . I just read a user comment concerning the lack of chemistry between Lily James and Sam Riley which I have to agree on. I can't say I felt a real passionate connection between them at all - they seemed more like a pair of siblings. Lily James played her role very well though - it's just that it wasn't at all what I would call "great acting" or "charismatic acting" which would have helped the movie. In my humble opinion, the chemistry seemed forced and awkward to watch.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

"Boy Next Door" is a hilarious romp through male neurosis. In just over fifteen minutes, the film takes us on a journey that most full-length features can't even match. Great performances, excellent camera work and editing---this short is a classic from start to finish. Kudos to Travis Davis for pulling double duty as both director and star. He's the funniest nebbish since Woody Allen. And what a treat to see Richard Moll back again. If you thought all he could do was play "Bull" the bailiff on "Night Court", think again.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie . But at the earnest request of my daughter I gave in and went along with her. Well it was worth the money spent. This is a well crafted film based on a true event. The protagonist of this story is an 89 year old man .He is suffering from Dementia and cannot recognise his own son who visits him at the nursing home he is staying. He has a memory gap and cannot relate the past or the present. In short he cannot remember his own son.

As Betty Sizemore ( Renee Zellweger ) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del ( Aaron Eckhart ) being murdered by the Mafia in cold blood, she is left with only one option - to assume her husband's identity and return home in an attempt to take down those responsible. But Del's ruthless boss Mr. Fontaine ( Clifton Collins Jr. ) is a step ahead of her and Del's shifty partner Mr. Petosa ( Michael Rispoli ) won't take kindly to an outsider stepping in on their territory. As Del's body count rises and the heat rises, Betty discovers that to survive the lies she must become the lie.

`` Boy Next Door '' is a hilarious romp through male neurosis . In just over fifteen minutes , the movie is the story of three boys who come home to find their girlfriends in bed with each other . After the boys get over a shock , they hatch a plan to teach the girls a lesson . But what begins as a joke quickly becomes something much, much bigger . `` Boy Next Door '' has a very simple idea at the heart of it . That is why the movie is so successful . The movie has no fat , no unnecessary subplots or characters .

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen ( mostly in English ) which I watched today. The movie is based in a small town of West Bengal and tells the story of 11 year old Ashima played by Lalita Behera and the events that happens around her after her mother's death in an ashram and her uncle's sudden appearance to take her back home with him to Mumbai . It is a very different film with a very different treatment of the subject matter. Sen does a fantastic job as a director .

If you are a fan of early Duke movies, this Lone Star oldie is a good one. What more could you ask for than Duke, Yak, and Gabby. Lots of good ridin' and shootin'!!! I found it amazing that Duke's singing voice was Bill Bradbury, who is none other than Bob Steele's twin brother. It has been reported that Bob Steele was a high school classmate and friend of Duke, so twin brother Bill may have been too. Anyway, if you like good, clean, early western movies don't miss this one.

`Skenbart' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Swedish cinema industry itself. It is a movie made in black and white to get something of the atmosphere from the days before Christmas in December 1945, which it does very well. Almost the whole plot takes place on a train, non-stop to Berlin. On the train is a mix of homosexuals, nuns, deported refugees, murderers, alcoholics and the failure literature critic 'Gunnar' played by the, in Sweden, famous actor Gustav Hammarsten.

Cant believe it .... after all these years finally tracked this down .. it was meant to be named 'The Gap' .. as there is a gap in the hills .. Wonderful images, I can see why they're so special. It's hard to imagine them in a gap! I can't believe you found them too!! They are just fabulous!!! How fabulous to find your photographs! Great photos! And what an amazing story! Great story behind the images! Oh wow, so glad they were found. Wow - what a great story and what a find!!

Well , I 'm a few days late but what the hell .... ! Anyways , the word that best describes my 4th of July weekend .... was FUN !!!! My weekend started early on the 4th. My good friend Diane and I went over to her house , and while she was getting some of the food ready I took a little break and went for a little walk around her block. While out there I found a little something I was looking for ... I know what you're thinking . Yep ... there's a dead body in my bushes.

Well.....I wouldn't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I consider important about this BEAUTIFUL film. I saw it for the first time in 1976 (I was 14) and then one more time a year later. That was it. The rest of it was the pink LP of Elton John's soundtrack getting the music and the story deeper and deeper inside my heart. How deep? A week ago my cousin gave me a VHS copy as a present. (No DVD's yet). Boy....was I surprised!!

honestly .. this show warms my heart , i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season is starting i love them all so much and im going to miss them all , i can really relate to the shows and the actors , and its a good show for girls , i love to see all their fashion and outfits , the girls are so cute , i hope that the new season turns out to be good and i really want to see more and more seasons of the show . I love love this show .

After getting hooked on the mini series, "North & South," I could hardly wait for the continuation, "North & South II." Then years later, along came Book III, "HEAVEN & HELL - NORTH & SOUTH - BOOK III." FINALLY, the last installment came for the on-going saga of the Maine and Hazard families. I was so enraptured by this series that I taped each part off of TV and then managed to get family and friends hooked and I watched it AGAIN, each time someone new wanted to see them.

I was expecting this movie to suck , but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film . Most slasher/gore films just aren’t that interesting so this film was a welcome change . There’s plenty of deaths and plenty of blood and guts . The filmmakers knew what they were doing to make this kind of film . Most of the acting is pretty good . I like the film’s gore and I was surprised that most of the kills are pretty original . I really enjoyed the main characters and they are all well acted .

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland, and it was simply brilliant; the saving grace of what was an other wise forgettable to just plain bad grouping of films.A perfect use of deep black and pure white, with excellent, yet simple animation, this is simply a story of a cat chasing the moon. Funny, charming, and touching. A small piece of heaven for cat lovers, romantics, and any one else who appreciates how beautiful simplicity can be. If it's in your town, see it.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper , which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines its many elements. There are two parallel stories, and they both succeed, and while it’s never quite explained why they are connected, it’s easy enough to get into the film because of the strength of both of the two stories and the actors who are portraying. Jason Clarke is Eric, an Australian who is on his last chance in a small town in South Australia, and this is his last job before he’s supposed to get on a boat and move back to Sydney.

Minor spoilers follow, but nothing you won't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a wonderful central performance from Renée Zellweger, Nurse Betty is a dark yet deceptively good-natured comedy.Suffering from an emotional and mental breakdown after witnessing her sleazy husband's murder, already-troubled and desperately unhappy waitress Betty becomes convinced a character on her favourite daytime soap is her long-lost fiancé and sets off from Kansas to Hollywood to find him.Instead of making jokes at the expense of Betty's mental state, writer John C. Richards is very sympathetic, with Zellweger portraying her as a lost innocent, not entirely helpless but tragically vulnerable nonetheless.

I'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5, but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 pages of imbecilic, unjustified 1-star reviews. This is an interesting story, all of the acting is good to very good (even Ms. Diaz, who is totally out of her usual grinning-bimbo role here, yet plays it well.) The sets are perfect and the cinematography is consistently appropriately creepy. It's a fine morality play and there is *no* reason to explain the origin of the god/supernatural being/alien/whatever that's "running the show," so I'm glad the movie doesn't try.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter 's complex life . Though it fails in a lot of areas , one thing it does do is show how hard it was for her to succeed and how hard it was for her to get where she was . She was a talented singer and a beautiful woman but her self image was very negative which made it hard to be a success in the world of entertainment . The movie starts out with Karen Carpenter talking to her husband in the studio in which they record in.

Tex Avery 's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the great creative surges in the history of the medium. When I was a teenager in the early 60s there was not much on television for kids and Avery's cartoons were a staple of Sunday afternoons. MGM was one of the few studios in those days that regularly released a cartoon on Saturday night as well as Sunday afternoon. There was no such thing as a weekend cartoon block on TV in the early sixties so kids of the time could watch the Averys whenever they wanted.

I just started watching The Show around July. I found it by mistake, I was channel surfing during a Vacation. It is a great show, I just wish it wasn't on so late at night. It's on at 12:30 AM. As a working person it makes it hard to watch all the time.I read some comments. I did not agree with the late one about not growing up in the 60's and not believing that this stuff can happen.I grew up in the 60's. I'm Hispanic and I had a "White" boyfriend plus we had black friends in High School.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values , but very surfacey characters and a somewhat predictable plot line. The tunes though, are what makes it worth watching over and over, especially since there are three different styles, from folk to pop to rock, and all of it very catchy and memorable, though some of it, especially the folk style, does get annoying after a while (though I admit it's still catchy even after several listens - which is why I bought the cd).

"Jaded" should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure unlike movies like "Indecent Behavior" or "Friend Of The Family". "Jaded" is not an easy watch as it's story is difficult to conceive and it's not that common in society. From the beginning of the movie, with the first scene, you expect more strong scenes. The raping scene wasn't (in my opinion) a well created scene. I think that the director didn't use proper camera techniques overall in the movie.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece . It 's Werner Herzog 's most unconventional film . It does n't have a single speaking character , even if at the end of the credits it announces the presence of a woman's voice in an interview . The only soundtrack is the voice of the German director who recounts a strange experience he had a few months ago in a remote area of Patagonia , in Argentina , when he was hiking and camping in the area with a local guide . The film is a meditation on reality and how we perceive it .

I played Sam (the porter, Lou's sidekick) in the Film "Dead Rail" Which later aired as "Alien Express." And, I have to say that for my part I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film. As a struggling actor this was a chance for me to work with fantastic people, it gave me great scenes to include on my reel, and it allowed me to work on a dream job for a month and a half (no waiting tables!) Turi(the director) And Steve and Scott (the producers) Were very kind by giving me this opportunity to participate in the production.

I'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film. If you're looking for something different then this movie is a good choice. Definitely not your typical mindless story that seems to be everywhere starring Ben Idiot Affleck or some other Hollywood loser. It's an intellectual film, you actually need to pay attention so some people might be turned off by that. However, if you are looking for something that keeps you on your toes then this is a good choice. Warning to parents - it has some fairly graphic sex scenes so watch it once the kiddies are in bed.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film! I enjoyed it.. its a sci fi film, if you want a thriller watch another channel.. This is what the scifi lovers want. Excellently produced by one of Sci-fi's best producers Scot Vandiver ! OK the special effects weren't excellent, but what a great cast! Some more money could have been used for effects but then again what sci fi has high budgeted effects. Stop complaining and change the channel if you don't like these type of films..

Graphics is far from the best part of the game . This is the number one best TH game in the series . Graphics are beautiful, story is great , game play is unique and challenging . Very fun game with a great story ! It's not the best game on iphone, but its not the worst. I wish they would fix the issues so I can give this a 5 star review. Over all the graphics are good and the story line is interesting, but I'm on level 12 and the game will only give me one hour per day.

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries, I didn't expect much from 'Two Hands'. But how wrong I was. From start to finish, you're kept deeply engrossed in a genre which has been continuously unoriginal for quite a while. Even in terms of mise-en-scene and cinematography, the director excels and creates a film consisting of great imagination. If you're looking for a film which is not only entertaining, but also provocative, compelling, and genuinely extraordinary, then make this the next film you watch.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial . The films that featured their brood paved the way for the TV sitcom's of the mid-1950's, including Father Knows Best, I Love Lucy, and Make Room for Daddy (aka 'The Danny Thomas Show' ) and the films were the most popular series at M-G-M studios when the studio was at it's box office zenith in the 1950's. The films, as well as the characters and cast, were controversial in many ways, and certainly not politically correct.

Sweeping drama with great sets , costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett , Scarlett , Melanie and Ashley. There are 3 shows a day. The only problem is that its very hard to find out whats going to be performed. There is a brochure, and Id advise you to bring it with you if you are planning a visit. You may also visit their website for a full listing. This page contains a single entry by Mark published on August 20, 2006 10:28 AM. Bring Your Children to the Circus and Teach Them How to Prepare for a Hurricane was the previous entry in this blog.

This is a simple episode ad so far after watching all of the Season 11 episodes (with the exception of the Imaginationland trilogy) this is the one that made laugh the most, definitely is my favourite so far of Season 11. So basically Cartman sees at a toy store a kid who has the Tourette's syndrome and a new idea comes to Cartman. You can imagine, now Cartman has Tourette's syndrome and is great since Kyle once he knows about this is like "he's faking". Cartman is certainly on fire, saying whatever he wants to the teachers, to the principal, to anybody.

I wanted to watch this , to get a inside look at the show . It told the story more about the people behind the music and show than anything else. It made me a big fan of The Band Perry. A great documentary on the music and people behind this country music group. I highly recommend it. It also has music videos. It's a documentary about the making of 10 tracks from the album Pioneer. It was very interesting. A fascinating behind the scenes documentary about a country super group of the 80's. Well done and worth the price.

This show is my absolute favorite . This show is intelligent , entertaining and always full of surprises . Lauren always does a great job and this season is no exception . It is so good that you will not be able to turn it off . This show is really good and I would recommend this for any age group. The actors do a great job and they all look very good. You will enjoy the show so much you won’t be able to turn it off. The actors do such a good job you will get so caught up with the story you will forget you are watching a drama.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool . I didn't really think about it much though until it was out on DVD. The movie itself is pretty cool. I have never been to Japan so seeing how the place looks in this movie made it seem like a very interesting place to go. The city was awesome and I really enjoyed that aspect of the movie. The storyline though, was a bit strange. The storyline involves a guy that gets fired from his job at the bank.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning, and have felt it is overlooked at the award shows. This show has the best humor, you can identify with the characters, we talk about it at work a lot, because I work at a company a lot like IPS, (DHL) and we just love the Teamster plugs!! Carrie is my hero, she is the best, she just puts it out there, no matter what the subject is. Arthur well what can you say? He just cracks you up, and really puts a spin on things.

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. The producers did not try to create some happy ending that didn't exist. The lack of a happy ending would create agitation in the audience that, hopefully would spur them on to action. At least that's how it seemed at the time. In today's movie world this movie would probably not be done. There would, definitely, not be this ending, however realistic.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / did n't understand this wonderful film . What a sad life he must lead if he can't enjoy this gem of a movie. It's one of the most enjoyable, clever, and well done movies I've seen in many a year and I will watch it again. It's a shame that there are only 5 reviews of this great movie (as of 12/07/06). I have watched "Hitch" several times and it has always been funny, intelligent and engaging. Will Smith is excellent in this role.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot, while still maintaining an efficient run-time. One of the clearest examples of this is the transition between poverty and wealth for the married medical couple. The audience is instantly transported from a shanty medical office to a luxurious suite at the city's most prestigious inn. This development is critical to understanding the position the doctors have been thrown into. The story suggests from the intro that these two people are generally happy with providing medical practice to those who are less fortunate.

In dramatising Wilde 's novel , John Osborne has condensed events , eliminated a number of characters , and generally re-ordered them . In so doing he has altered the text to a degree. The original story is told in the third person but the film version is in the first person narration of one character in a group , Oscar Wilde . In doing so the writer has created a one-sided impression of events . Oscar Wilde's play The Importance of Being Earnest was written in 1895 . It is set in Victorian England . It is comic but with a serious undertone and is often referred to as a comedy of manners .

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we're in a bigger hole than ever. That's right, so all those flag wavers who were so sure of the right and might of the American way are now chasing their tails, isn't that true? You bet it is. This movie said so from the beginning. It is kind of freaky how much the film,or should I say, filmmaker, knew what was coming. It is almost like going to a fortune teller and hearing what was going to happen in the future.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks. Marjorie Main (Ma) steals the show in anything she does. Funny to see Ida Moore as Emily, the daffy old lady on the train.. god she was ALWAYS old; she was in "Desk Set" and "Alfred Hitchcock Presents". Their new house is also a co-star here -- its the house of the future with some really cool inventions that Pa doesn't care for. LOVE the painting gag. Keep an eye out for TOM... he starred in "Nanny & the Professor".

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant talk of how well it was done. It has all the elements of a good story: some great characters, a great setting, interesting themes, a good amount of action, lots of funny scenes, a nice bit of sadness and of course the good guy who saves the day. But somehow it does not all add up to make a really good movie. It feels like there are two different films mixed up in it.

Surprisingly good made for T.V. Thriller. I wasn't expecting too much from this one but I'm glad to say that this is one of the best of it's kind. It's fast paced and features solid acting and interesting events. The story gets you hooked on since the beginning and with many hits, you can't help but find the movie very interesting.The background story of Thiessen's character is hard but it turns into a nightmare when her husband is something much worse than her childhood friend's step father.The "stranger" concept and his actions are disturbing if you consider that it is a common disease in society.

wow! i just have to say this show is super cool! i fell in love with the show from the beginning! the idea of the show is very original and very soothing! it's also a pleasure to watch the performance the two lovely leading ladies give, Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel! they're simply wonderful! i'm especially a big admirer of Lauren Graham! she's not just a pretty face, she's a "monster" of an actress as well! i'm not saying that Alexis isn't a wonderful actress as well... i just happen to like Lauren better!

I finally received my DVD today , viewed it and I 'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical release with original ending. I'm glad I ordered before they took it down. I really enjoyed this movie and hope to watch the DVD soon with my wife and kids. So I just wanted to thank you for making it available and for your excellent customer service. Hey I just got mine in the mail today as well. I watched it tonight and it was amazing! The ending is as I have been told by other people.

Style over substance . But what a style it is . `` The Cell '' is the internal version of ``The Incredibles '' . The plot is all there . And if you can't follow it , you are probably as dumb as a box of hammers . If you get it , you know you've seen it all before . But that's OK , that's what makes it so good . This movie's style is the story , itself , and I'm sure we can all appreciate just how much work goes into something like that .

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much. This is one of the best period pieces on the Civil War that I have seen that tells a story of friendship divided by the war. The costumes are great, the story lines are great, I love how the story jumps around from character to character to keep you guessing as to what's going to happen next in their lives. There is a great balance of good and evil. Some of the characters that are evil in my opinion are too good not to watch.

Blue Planet... Wow... Where do I begin? The years of hard work paid off in what is, without question, one of the best documentaries ever created.The sights and sounds presented in Blue Planet, like most documentaries with the Attenborough stamp, are rare and haven't even experienced by most people. That alone should be enough reason to buy this series, especially if you're the curious type who 'wants to know'.Blue Planet is not a perfect documentary, however. It does get a bit repetitive after the 3rd episode.

America's next top model is a good show, it helps people with their careers, but lately i have become bored with it.cycle 1: yeah I'm happy Adrienne won, i wanted her to win from the beginning.cycle 2: its too bad, i think Mercedes deserved it.cycle 3: i did not like Eva, but i did not like most of the girls in this cycle.cycle 4: Kahlen should have won. i don't know what they saw in Naima, but i definitely know what they saw in Kahlen.cycle 5: like cycle 3, this was not a great cycle either.

This one started excellently . The photography and audio are the best I 've experienced in years ( okay , I 'll be honest , in 3 years or so!) . There were some excellent camera angles and I could hear every word spoken on screen. However , as soon as the story took over , the camera work took a back seat and in the end the photography was not used well at all. Some of the angles and shots were not used at all . As for the story it was not what I expected after that brilliant opening.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

Don't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you? Growing up with Disney I always found myself being captivated by the characters. Every single one seemed truly talented and knew how to act their way through a movie. I remember Friday nights and running to turn on the TV just to watch their newest movies. Susie Q was one of my all time favorites. I never forgot this movie. Even till this day when one mentions the song "Susie Q" I always remember the movie.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece. It's Werner Herzog's most unconventional film. It doesn't have a plot or story. Instead of a story, we're given a collection of images, words and music that work so wonderfully together. It's not a documentary either. Some of the people in this film are directed and given lines to read. It has some of the most beautiful and haunting images. Herzog shoots real mirages and we see cars and people floating around in the middle of the desert who aren't actually there but hundreds of miles away reflected like in a mirror.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films , In The Company of Men & Your Friends and Neighbors and moves into the realm of thriller with Nurse Betty. It is a witty film that moves at a steady pace. There are many dark moments but the comedy keeps it in good hands. It is a film that could have gone the way of The Truth About Cats & Dogs and gotten very silly but it does not. It is much better because of this. The acting is great. Morgan Freeman and Greg Kinnear stand out as the two evil cops.

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has ! It was funny and it has stayed in my memory banks for so long....I remember my mother and aunts telling it to us....I think they probably got the book from the Library...... If you remember this....well I think it's from the early 1950's......do you know the cartoonist and the title of the cartoon? Sorry it's so small, but it is the only photo I have...... It looks like "The Golden Age" series of books.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos's role as Williams for that entire show, was Emmy worthy. It was uncanny how well he did. And to be as rapid-fire and as random and as creative as Robin Williams really is....WOW. There were scenes where Diamantopoulos had to say probably 20 rapid fire lines and do 15 different characters while delivering those lines, all while sounds as much like ROBIN WILLIAMS doing those characters.....well, that my friends is impressive acting. Its one thing to do a Robin Williams impersonation for a couple of minutes.

A remarkable film , bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much , much younger. I used to live in the East End of London and worked in the docks , and I've known all the characters involved , and been in the pubs , where they'll meet for the first time for 10 years or so. Brought back memories. But it's not just a personal film , but a history lesson for anyone who knows London , and of course there are the characters and their stories, that made the book such a classic.

The entire series, not just The Blue Planet, is nothing short of amazing. The best nature series we have ever seen. The episode on the deep is like traveling to outer space! We have watched this with our 10 and 7 year old boys and all four of us have not been able to pull away. We read a negative comment on this and could not believe it. There is so much new information that we never learned in school. Its also the best view we have seen from any television or movie into the delicate balance of our earth's eco-system.

Fata Morgana , the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog , filmed over several years in the Sahara desert, is an astonishing and moving cinematic experience. Herzog, who has been called “the cinematic godfather of the new documentary,” has a unique way of shooting his documentaries. As he himself has said he prefers “fictionalizing documentary” where he shoots his films like fictional features with actors. This gives him more creative control of his documentary shoots and also allows him to capture the essence and emotion of the subjects and stories he’s telling in his films.

Michelle , Anicée Alvina , was so nice , and I really fall in love with her . She died a few days ago . I'll miss her very much . Lovely Anicée, and very talented. What a shame that such a beautiful person had to die. RIP! I've seen her in 1998, when I lived in Brussels. She was living in Belgium. I was so happy. I was not her biggest fan, but the last time I was a fan and I was happy to see her, I was a big fan.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin. There aren't much left when it arrives.
