Not of the train and not of some passengers.This is a black comedy directed by Peter Dalle and acted like they used to act in the 40s and also photographed (in b/w) like they used to during that period. The actors must have had lots of fun making it. They aren't much of characters, like they weren't in the 40s, but the story is well narrated and everybody has timing.A deadly black and deadly funny film.

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park. Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to be able to say whatever he wants without getting in trouble. He is able to swear at the other kids at school. Kyle tells the Principal that Cartman is faking it. But, she doesn't believe it. Chris Hansen is planning on having Cartman to be on Dateline to talk about Tourette syndrome live and uncensored. But later on, Cartman starts to get so addicted to be able to say whatever he wants, that he later on starts to accidentally say embarrassing stuff.

I saw the movie in 1972, and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went back many more times to see it over and over ... I think 9 times in all. Just great is how I would describe it ... I was taken by the sound track, the beautiful panoramas of the south of France, the life style the kids began on their own. An ideal way to live is what they had set up ... of course the powers that be have to intercede, but when I forget that part I find myself wanting to be in the movie and live like that!

I'm certain that people from USA don't know anything about the rest of the world, but I think they mustn't talk about what they don't know. And they must remember that the rest of the world is not as hypocrite as the USA. The only places where consented sex between teenagers are illegal are the USA and Islamic nations. In France, for instance, the age of consent is 15. In Brazil it's 14. In Spain it's 12. So the teenagers actors, 16 and 17 years old by the time of production, aren't doing anything illegal.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments, Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air. The film is like no other I have ever seen. Director Neil LaBute proves that he can direct more then disturbing pictures of men and women and how they approach sex (his previous two films were the brillant In the Company of Men, and the almost brillant Your Friends and Neighbors). Renee Zellweger gives the best performance of her career as Betty, a waitress who, when she witnessing the brutal death of her asshole husband (LaBute mainstay Aaron Eckhart), and gets lost in a fantasy world.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning , and have felt it is overlooked at the award season, it is funny and has many laughs in the episodes I have seen. It is a funny show with some laughs. My favorite part is that the main characters are very well acted, and not over the top. The show is set in NY, and has a good feel to the set. I love that the characters are very relatable to most people. I would love for people to check out the show and see what they think.

The Killing Yard is a great film, although uneven at times. Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort as a mentally wounded and judicially jilted prison inmate, and the presence of Alan Alda as his defense attorney is none other than genius. The emotion and raw reality portrayed in this film's "flashback" scenes have the ability of putting viewers directly into the midst of the events being pictured. I was not even born when the Attica riot took place, however, through extensive research, I find that "The Killing Yard" does the story all of it's fair justices.

Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally , a true Colombian film crosses the border ( s ) to shows how good a film is made with a low budget. This is the debut of director Andrés Baiz, a young man in his twenties, who wrote, produced and directed this masterpiece. The film is the story of Andrés, the lead character, who is the son of a man that has spent many years in prison for drug possession and distribution. Andrés is a teenager and spends all his time with friends on the street. One day, he is arrested for stealing a motorcycle.

Just see it ! It 's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time . See it more than once to catch what you missed , it will make a lot more sense to you . This is a good movie and the ending is awesome . If you love sci-fi , you will not miss this movie. In the not-too-distant future, a man is sent to investigate and solve a murder on a distant planet. Upon landing, his mission is suddenly complicated by the discovery of a second alien life form.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

Brilliant film! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats how it is with post pulp era. Many pictures get automatically likened to it for only being a gangster flick. But this one is well written, funny coincidences, ordinary gangsters who are family men, resemble something from Tarantino, which is a good similarity!Anyway the film's about a guy bloke in Australia which is getting mixed up with a hard- core crime gang, and ends up in a debt and deep s*it.

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought a copy on DVD for 99p. I enjoyed the film, the twists and turns in the plot and that the file was mainly about the main character Sinuhe makes it more of a "family saga" rather than an action film. The costumes and attention to detail was remarkable for its time (1955). The back projection during the chariot ride now looks clumsy. My main interest was in the character of Akhenaton and his monotheistic religion.

When this show first came on the air , I saw it once or twice and thought it was another stupid reality show and never watched it. I have been thinking about getting it because I have been hearing about it from a few people and then I see it and it looks kind of interesting but I didn’t buy it until today. Well, I am so glad that I got it. This show is so great. It really makes you see what is important and how to live life. It is so amazing to see these people come together.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export ! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in the 60's, a very intelligent young scientist decides to create his own universe in his head, where he will be able to create his dreams. The dreams that come to mind have to do with women. The film is extremely funny in parts and at the same time extremely intelligent. This film is worth every penny of your time and you'll be able to relate to it. It's a must see and a must buy. Buy it!

Pat Conroy's autobiographical book "The Water Is Wide" proves to be something of a Southern "Up The Down Staircase", yet despite the teacher-going-against-the-odds formula, "Conrack" really does move the audience with each little breakthrough and creative flash. These students (uneducated black kids on an island off South Carolina) are actually shown learning, and their collective wide-eyed innocence is remarkably sweet. The one actual actress in the bunch (Tina Andrews, an amazing performer) plays the "tough nut" Conrack has to crack, and once she falls under his charms, it all seems a breeze.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film . It was when I was a teenager , around the time of the film’s initial release in 1996 . I guess I was 15 or so . So, the film is older than me . I think we all know what this film is about . We know it is about a group of people trapped on an elevator . We know the premise, and we know what will happen . So, why watch this film again? I am going to keep this brief . I will say that the acting is very good .

One of the better made for TV biopics, I just wish it had told us more. I have read many biographies and seen other things about the Carpenters, and this movie did what it could, based on the constraints placed on it by the family. Cynthis Gibb did a wonderful job trying to bring Karen to life. One of my disappointments is that there was not more insight into Karen's anorexia. In the reading I have done about the disease (especially Cherry Boone O'Neill's wonderful book, Starving for Attention) anorexia appears to be a disease of control.

It's interesting to watch how late 1950's society is depicted in this film. Men are lecherous, chain-smoking boozers with one thing on their minds (time hasn't changed men all that much, but "sexual harassment" has) & women are in the workplace only passing time until they find a husband & settle down. Some of the dialog is cringe-worthy but yet it's charming in an innocent, passé way. I love the opening credits that show a romantic, exciting view of Manhattan with Johnny Mathis singing "The Best Of Everything" on the soundtrack.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as the detective story. Although it had existed in the form of a subgenre in the late 19th and early 20th century (Dostoyevsky, Conan Doyle, G.K. Chesterton) it is the work of authors like Agatha Christie, Dorothy L. Sayers and Ngaio Marsh which really put the genre on the map and gave it the respect it deserved. They also made the form very popular, to the point that, in the United States, there was a great deal of imitation.

I do n't think I have ever seen a better movie parody . Mel Brooks is insane . EVERY time I watch, I see something I never saw before. I also like the cameos , like John Belushi and Leslie Nielson. This movie is a true classic and should never be missed, especially by the young ones . It is so funny, one of my all-time favorites ! It has been said that most of the funny scenes in the movie were not in the original script, but just improvisation in the movie itself. I would not doubt that.

If you are a fan of early Duke movies , this Lone Star oldie is a good one . What is great about Duke in these films is the fact he never has any lines , it is only him and his horse . He would ride along and do what needed to get done , he did not talk . He would talk to the animals , the Indians or anyone else . It is easy to sit and watch a movie and laugh at him , but if you really pay attention he is a great role model on how a man should act and do things .

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old . I am 77 years young and am delighted that it is still available to be re-viewed in 2009. I have since bought a DVD of it for my collection. I remember that there was much debate about it and whether it was suitable for children at the time it was first released in 1952. It has stood the test of time and I am very glad that it still continues to attract a new generation of viewers.

There are a few things in life that we ca n't experience more than once and the college experience is among them. There is nothing like walking across that stage to receive your diploma. There is no one who knows what it feels like to get that diploma than the family members who watched you grow and mature to the person who is about to walk out onto that stage and accept that diploma. Family members, friends, and fellow students all share this experience and the pride of being a graduate. In a world filled with "What's next?

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker . This is the only flick that I know that can make you feel sick when you view it with your eyes . This is one of the few movies that has ever left me feeling sick and nauseated and I think it's all due to the way they shot it and the way it was presented to us. The movie is the story of two sisters and their horrible family that they lived in. The father and mother were always at each other's throats because of the father's job.

King of Queens is comic genius. Kevin James, whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny, Leah Remini who plays Doug's wife Carrie is incredibly hot ( # 19 on Stuff magazine's hottest 102 woman list ), and very funny. The true magic of the show However is the scenes with Jerry Stiller, they are the funniest in the show. Jerry, a comic genius, plays Carrie's father, Arthur Spooner, whom lives in Doug and Carrie's always cold basement. I must admit that I never watched this show until this year, 2006.

Finally a true horror movie. This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes. I am a horror buff and I recommend this movie but it is quite gory. I am not a big wrestling fan but Kane really pulled the whole monster thing off. I have to admit that I didn't want to see this movie, my 17 year old dragged me to it, but am very glad I did. During and after the movie I was looking over my shoulder. I have to agree with others about the whole remake horror movies enough is enough.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about. Or, maybe it isn't: Herzog goes to the Sahara desert and nearby villages to film assorted landscapes and the locals. But this is just the broadest stroke. It's a feat that you either surrender yourself to, or you don't. He gets into the form of the world around him entirely, without a story, bound only to certain aspects of written poetry, as his camera (shooting on supposedly discarded film stock) wanders like in a pure travelogue.

It happens often, while growing up, a Hollywood movie impresses a youth. It not only lasts a lifetime, but inspire him to study ancient cultures as a career. Such was the case, with the 1954 film entitled "The Egyptian." Audience were awed with the sets, costumes and great acting of this film, so much so, other films soon followed in like vain. This is the story of a young Egyptian boy who was left parent less soon after he was born. With such a dubious beginning, it is not hard to wonder why he will spend his life, asking questions.

Fuckland is an interesting film . I personally love the Dogma movement . I wish it had lasted longer . It seems like there were only a few films under that label that had any real quality . This one is a good watch but not something I’d go out to see. It has a fairly simple story and the acting is not that great but I think the camera work really saved it from being just another movie. I’d have to say it’s worth seeing. It’s a bit slow in the first few minutes but gets into the meat of the story fairly quickly .

North and South is a miniseries from the `` golden age '' of television miniseries in the 1980s , which originally aired on NBC in four two-hour episodes on January 26, 27, 28, and 29 1985. It is a remake of the classic Civil War film `` Gone with the Wind '' by the same name, which was made 40 years prior. The remake starred Patrick Swayze , who had won the lead role by giving a convincing performance of the book's main character, Ashley Wilkes , in an audition tape.

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of `` Rawhide '' Charles Marquis Warren . The 70-minute program is set in 1850, and features a handsome cast, including Lon Chaney , Jr. , Ronald Reagan , John Ireland , Lee Van Cleef and others . This episode is also famous as the very first `` TV-Movie '' ever broadcast and as the pilot to one of the all-time great western series on TV , starring Chuck Connors . In this first season opener, two brothers are forced to fight to protect the family ranch.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford's best in my opinion. No major stars, but Ben Johnson shines in most everything he appears, and here he gets a rare lead as the title character. Matching him is Ward Bond as the crusty Mormon elder leading his people west. John Ford's stock of character actors, including Harry Carey, Jr., Jane Darwell, Russell Simpson and Hank Worden, provide ample support, as does eerily silent James Arness, a member of the outlaw Clegg clan that joins up with the wagon train.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris. We're all here on an exchange program. We all laughed so hard cuz so much of what was going on in the movie happened to us! I mean yeah sure some of it was pretty clichéd but still true, know what I'm saying.I think I related more to the quiet guy (the Italian) than Xavier because I'm more of the observer in our group. Anyway, I wish I had a hot roommate like Cecile de France.

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it 's rabbit season . But he doesn't want to hunt, and he's in for a world of trouble because he's in the one place on Earth a rabbit can't outrun a hunter. Bugs Bunny shows up on the scene, and, while he tries to convince Daffy to stop hunting in favor of taking up the easier sport of duck hunting, Daffy can't be deterred until the end of the cartoon when Bugs finally convinces him to let him take his gun.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if I can understand their relationship with each other. To be perfectly honest I'm not much of a romantic person and so most love stories just don't hit the spot. In this novel though, I loved the characters from the start because they were all so different and yet they all worked well together. The setting was definitely a unique one and the whole idea was very intriguing. The way the characters' stories interwoven with each other was pretty impressive.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend . It was a fun romp with some cool effects and I really liked the scene in Paris. There were some nice nods to 70s cult movies like Barbarella, Rollerball and Soylant Green and I thought it was cool that the lead had the same look as Richard Dean Anderson on MacGyver. There was a big debate at the time as to whether this was supposed to be funny or serious. It's a little silly but I'm glad that it wasn't just a spoof with a lot of irony because it is a fun ride.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are about to leave. The horse traders want to buy their horses, but the leader explains that the horses belong to God, not to man. The traders tell the leader they do not believe in God, and they are willing to pay a lot of money. The trader leader agrees to sell all of the horses if they are paid the agreed price. After the transaction is completed, the Mormon leader asks the two men if they believe they have acquired ownership of the animals.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight, he lives in this burned down old hotel, where eight teen convicts go to do some cleaning. Most of them die except for 3 of them. In my case it wasn't the best writing or the best ever. I still thought that the killing scenes were really well done. Like when the one girl go eaten by the hungry dogs. The best had to be when he shoved the cell phone down the Blonde Girl's mouth. Kane was a seriously great horror movie actor, he had this serious look the entire movie and it would never change.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim, California in October, 1976. While driving the tourist laden city streets , we saw a movie marquee advertising "ALICE IN WONDERLAND XXX." So before even checking out Disneyland's version of the Lewis Carroll classic a half mile away, our curiosity won out and we ventured into this cinematic threshold. I remember even before the movie began how surprised I was to see this kind of film appearing in staid, ultra-conservative Orange County.Thirty two years later, I came across ALICE IN WONDERLAND at a local video store.

King of Queens is comic genius . Kevin James , whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny , I think he is very good at comedy and his character is one of the funniest out there . He really does a great job . The other half of the show is Carrie ( Leah Remini) , she is Doug's wife and she has many funny moments . She is a strong character and she really makes the show funny with her sarcastic moments . The two together are one of the best comedic pairings out there .

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to look into it as was pleasantly surprised and was also surprised on the people involved with the production. If I remember correctly we had to watch it on a UHF station and this meant using a converter in those days UHF not part of regular TV to tune in the local station to watch the cartoon a big deal in those days which made the show even more mysterious. I remember all the sound effects that Gerald used to talk. A great memory from 50+ years ago.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War. My aunt actually played in this movie as an extra in the Justin and Madeline wedding scene, and my uncle was an extra on a horse. The script was genuine, and accurate. The costumes were tastefully done, the seqence was in order and even the accents were good. I dearly love Patrick Swayze and James Ried. They were the best 2 choices, and it even had a great supporting cast. The Civil War is my favorite thing in American History, and I love movies about it.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in Bogotá, you can feel the total meaning of the word "Bluff"(although is a Colombian film, the title is in presented in English); ! The story is about Nicolas Andrade (Federico Lorusso), a photographer who find his girlfriend Margarita (Catalina Aristizabal) having an affair with his boss Pablo Mallarino (Victor Mallarino), owner of a magazine; after this Nicolas is left without girlfriend and without any job.

I did n't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn . I do n't know why I keep buying books from authors with which I'm not overly impressed. I've read two others in this series and this is the weakest of them. The story just doesn't have the intrigue of the prior books. I can only assume that since it was written later that it wasn't a priority to the writer. It seems that some of the books I read are so bad I have to wonder about their author. This is one of those books.

Absolutely , I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting , fascinating and certainly beautiful film. I’d like to see the film to find out how they got these shots . The photography was so beautiful that it almost seemed unreal. The film was definitely made for the 3D format. I enjoyed watching it .I’m going to try to go and see it in the cinema again to see if I enjoyed it so much or if the experience of watching the film in the cinema makes me feel so much better. I thought this was a fantastic film.

I liked this a lot. The camera angles are cool, it's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch. And I thought they did a great job with the Sound when we see things from Kane's point of view. Lots of fun. He's a lot less one-dimensional than most horror heroes.Kane is a lot less scary and more believable than most movie psychos. It was not clear to me how he would react to various situations.

I have watched this show from the beginning , and I am a 45 year old man . To me its one of the best shows on tv. There are a very few shows on Tv that I like to watch over and over again and this is one of them . POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Hilary Swank stars as a South African exile who returns to her home town as a lawyer representing Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofer), a member of the South African parliament who was tortured by a prison guard, Pete Muller (Ian Roberts), who is seeking to escape prison by testifying before the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. They could certainly have found an actress who has or could imitate a South African accent; Ms. Swank makes no attempt whatsoever to cover her unmistakably American accent.

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie. Amy Jo Johnson (Susie Q) is a great Actress. I think she did a great performance. I hope that sometime that the Disney Company could put this movie on DVD. I think it's kind of cool and a little bit hilarious. It's kind of sad when Susie Q dies in a Car accident in the beginning at first it makes you want to cry or sob. But in the middle when no one suspects Susie Q it gets kind of funny and surprising. There is a little bit of mystery in this movie but not much.

"Americans Next Top Model" is the best reality show! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time watching it.I kept my eyes open the entire time. (well, I did blink) It can be sad, funny, or addicting. (mostly addicting)"America's Next Top Model" kept me wanting more and that's pretty much the point. It is also on more that one channel. Sometimes it's on MTV other times it's not. I hope it gets more fans and grows to be a hit series!

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am. My brother and I were channel surfing and who do we see but a young Russel Crowe. But not the telephone throwing Russel Crowe we had come to know and quasi-love back in the states. This movie, much to my surprise, was amazingly creative and hilarious. It stars a cast of awkward teens with hilarious stories of odd sexual experiences, including a slick salesman,prostitutes, and an unusual sexy mother. If you are lucky enough to come across this film I would strongly suggest picking it up.

'The Cell' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally. The film is about the journey, about the world it shows during this journey, the destination does not really matter. In my opinion this journey through the mind gives such beautiful images other things do not really matter as long as they are not distracting. In fact, the story is pretty good.We start with Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) in the mind of a catatonic boy. How this works exactly does not really matter, but it looks a lot like virtual reality.

`` L'Auberge Espagnole '' collected the audience wherever it was shown . It gathered audience awards on many film festivals and also the award for "best film" of the year on the French Film Academy (académie des arts et des lettres du film) . `` The Apartment 112 112 avenue de Champagne'' is in the same style of humor . It's a comedy about an apartment where different people have different life experiences . In my opinion this film was not as successful because of the fact that most people in France don't like comedy movies .

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I was expecting, and more of a drama. This is a very low key movie with lots of dialogue. The movie is really about four people: two men, and one woman who is one of their patients. The four are two doctors, and one of the doctors is their patient’s husband, the fourth man being the patient’s lover. There’s a great deal of interesting dialogue and backstory in the movie.

I didn't personally know Karen Carpenter, nor, Richard for that matter, so I must go by how the movie portrayed her. I think a better person to ask about it's accuracy would be her brother Richard. However, from what I did see and learn of Karen, I felt her pain, share her sadness, and she was a very special person to me growing up. I know that I wasn't born until 1965 so I didn't get to know her as much as some of you older fans but I definitely grew up listening to her music and I have fond memories of her music.

This comment discusses `` North and South Book I '' dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is very popular in the Russian literature. But it should be noticed, that there are two types of the works: one, which describes the process of the industrialization and modernization (Rosenberg`s 2-volume book on the history of the USA is one of the best example), the other one, which is dedicated to slavery and emancipation. The latter type is rather popular in today`s Russia, as can be explained by the general interest to history of slavery and modernization of Africa.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome; more bloodshed and very graphic details (a bit too much for my taste). "Two Hands" is an entertaining, funny story about Australian lowlifes. The screenplay contrasts the world of fast money and deadly acts with the inexplicability of fate and circumstance. In a subtle way we are asked to ponder the concept that major events in our lives are sometimes generated without our being fully aware of the root causes. The forces of fate and circumstance take Jimmy, the main character, into situations that bring about the realization of his shallow dreams and, ultimately, an understanding of a more personally promising world.The clueless Jimmy, portrayed with acumen by Heath Ledger, is a kid who grew up without opportunity.

I 've seen 'nurse betty ' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea ' in koblenz germany. the first time the film was shown without english subitles. after the screening there was an english speaking talk with the producer peter gould ,the director rachel tunnard, and the cast . I liked both versions the original with the english subtitles and the international version with the german english dubbing. but i'm not sure if the international version is out on video in english or in german. there were several interviews with all the actors, producer etc.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound impact on me at the time. This is definitely an excellent show. I don't have cable, so I started renting them, because my friend recommended it. I thought it would be a teen soap, you know, who's dating who, that kind of thing. But it was not. It is surprisingly deep. It is also very witty. It moves at a very fast pace, and there are more and more jokes you catch every time you watch it. It is a comedy-drama, which is rare when well done. It is about Rory and Lorelai's relationship.

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area, and it was quite clear that most people didn't get the movie. Even if you don't, it's a good movie with some interesting character development. It is a thoroughly human story about some very imperfect people in a backwoods southern town, and really speaks to the root of the blues. If you don't know what the "Black Snake Moan" is by the time you leave the theater, you didn't get it. And no.. it's not just a song.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships, 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the spotlight on his own family, Block covers terrain that is off-limits for most filmmakers. He explores a common but often unspoken family dynamic and does so without resorting to hyperbole or sensationalism. In fact, the film is deceptively low key at the outset. In addition to providing a probing look at one family - and, by extension, every family - Block has also chronicled a very specific period in recent history. I don't know if this was intentional, but unavoidable due to archival content.Highly recommended.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I've ever seen! I was not a big fan of Robin Hood, or Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, but this movie was a lot different! It made fun of Robin Hood, and was HILARIOUS! I was extremely pleased with how well it was put together, and how well acted it was! Besides Home Alone, Mrs. Doubtfire, and Houseguest, this was the funniest move I've ever seen! I especially love the song; "We're Men in tights!"

The best of everything. Just what is the best of everything? It is different for everyone but for most of us it is love. But alas not everyone knows where or who to look to for real love. Once we make those choices then we must live with them.

It was the sort of movie that doesn’t really stick in your mind afterwards but is still very enjoyable. It’s got a great cast in it.

This film was made soon enough after Karen's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen were feeling a little guilty as to how they may have contributed to her health problems. As the years have passed (almost 25 to be exact) it must have gotten easier to deny any complicity. Richard has spent the years after Karen's death endlessly remixing and recompiling the recordings he made with her. He married his cousin, Mary, and from what I have read, it looks like he may be planning a next generation Carpenters with his children.

1981's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there. However they are not alone in the wild. A hulking in-bred murderer, who seems to be in two places at once, is lurking and apparently hates trespassers.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times , this is a hilarious and gleefully entertaining film. It is funny, well written and well played by a strong cast of young actors. As a European , the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980 's . Even if I have never read the book , the movie takes me through a period of time that I lived through at university . I remember the time and the feeling and the social mood . This is the last movie by Bernardo Bertolucci so far in my life . A nice movie to close this part of my life . Thanks . 5/5 Great movie, good actors, great story. The film was a bit long, but worth the wait, very interesting.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are bound for a valley where they can settle and live in peace. The scenes of the corral in the town where Ward Bond and Ben Johnson negotiate prices, and Bond introduces the idea of them (Johnson and his partner played by Harry Carey Jr.) leading the train to this valley, are some of the best in the film, as Johnson, a real cowboy, whittles a piece of wood while he banters with Bond.

I saw it in Europe-plex . Great movie ! ! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the human experience, and a quest for the meaning of life. Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms , I thought I would get them all done now before I get back to filming for my own show! So, today we turn our attention to Hi De Hi!. A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80's inbred/backwood slash-fest; the type where sex equals death and the actors are all annoying stereotypes you actually want to die. However, "JBD" delivers considerably more.Rather than focus on bare flesh and gore (though there is a little of each- no sex however), the flick focuses on delivering impending dread/mounting tension amidst a lovely scenic backdrop. These feelings are further heightened by a cast of realistically likable characters and antagonists that are more amoral than cardboard definitions of evil.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V . and came across a news story of 2 brothers being attacked and stoned by 3 young men with stones. I could not believe my ears and my eyes. I could feel the blood of those 2 boys rush to my head and a burning sensation all over my body. I felt like a war was going to erupt. The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial. The films that featured their brood paved the way for television sitcoms that came after it and sought to emulate its winning formula. One obvious reference is 'The Beverly Hillbillies,' where the new home was bought with oil money, not having been won in a contest. You could even say the 1980s sitcom 'Newhart' borrows its idea of backwards rural characters from this series. Still, I wonder if Betty Macdonald, the Washington-based author who created these characters, didn't do more harm than good.

I got this girls from Romania when I visited my parents a year and a half ago ( I am living in the U.S now) , we took pictures of her , her little sister and her friend and this girls told me : you are my new friend ! I love you !

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic `` Alive '' , there was this film, which despite being about a mountain climber who never came back from an ascent on the North Face of the Swiss Alps was more than enough of a box-office draw to keep the studios interested in the genre for quite awhile, as it went on to gross over $50 million. It was also the most expensive and technically most advanced film to come out of the Universal studio in quite some time, and the studio's most successful film since the ``Jaws'' cycle.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall ! As an archivist I am often disappointed with the use of the term "reel" to denote a film that is not one. "Reel" was the traditional unit of measure for a film in the 1910s through the 1930s. It is not synonymous with "movie" or "film" or "video." If you want to be specific, a film is a "movie," a "film," or a "video tape."

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa’s Aids epidemic, but it is far from your usual sobby, overly sentimental portrayal of life in a black township in a country where more people have Aids than are alive in the United States. Red Dust is not about the disease or the politics, it is about love and loneliness and the courage of the human spirit. The story revolves around two young lovers, a poor black miner and a rich white woman who meet one fateful evening.

America 's next top model is a good show , it helps people with their careers , but lately i am getting tired of it because it feels like the girls are getting older . It never has, even after trying all the curling irons and brushes, and hair spray. What do you think would work? I'm glad that you're having fun with the new blog.

In dramatising Wilde's novel, John Osborne has condensed events, eliminated a number of characters, and generally implied rather than shown Dorian's essential wickedness. If you want a more explicit rendering, see the 1945 film. Wilde and Robert Louis Stevenson lived in about the same time frame, but were certainly vastly different men and writers. This story really treats of a theme similar to Stevenson's "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde", but note that Wilde chose to treat his story as fantasy, whereas RLS took the scientific route.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant references made to it here in North America as a porn film. Our obsession with what is, or should be, regarded as pornographic remains a relic of the 'guidance' provided to film makers by the Hayes committee many, many years ago and it is now really time that we relegate it to the past. So far we have not progressed far beyond establishing a somewhat arbitrary division between what we now term 'soft' and 'hard' porn, with both carrying the same pornography label.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect . Here Alice is a middle-aged mother and her daughter Lydia. Lydia’s father was in Afghanistan but has come home for the first time after five years. Lydia is having her birthday and her friends are coming to the party. Lydia is looking forward to the party but it is not going to be a good one. Firstly Lydia discovers she has a spider in her hair and then her sister brings in a mannequin as a birthday gift!

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50 's , along with my other items from this collection it has been passed down from my mother, I've never been able to part with these items as it brings back the memories of my mothers wardrobe that I'd look through as a small girl in the early days of the Egyptian tourist trade, and how it changed from then onwards. It's just so beautiful , it's a must have for any fan of Egyptian items , and would look just perfect on any vintage lovers door!

This small John Ford western with no 'stars ' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It's not as good as The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance or The Sun Shines Bright or Ford's masterpiece 3 Godfathers but it has a lot of heart and a good performance by Harry Carey, Jr., Ford's favorite, who he always wanted to star in his films. It's the story of a dysfunctional family that gets more dysfunctional when the oldest daughter gets sick with a fatal disease and needs a heart transplant. They go to New Mexico to find a replacement.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

I was drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Michael Kamen . A friend of mine introduced me to it in the 1990`s at the same time I discovered The Who and Led Zeppelin . And that`s how I became a Michael Kamen fan. I had the priviledge to see Michael Kamen conduct The Kirov Orchestra (in Moscow) and the London Symphonic Orchestra in London twice in 1991 . He was always so kind and welcoming in the presence of a few fans.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying . In their escape , they kill a number of the passengers . Among those killed is the Governor's sister . The Governor , a former policeman , sets out to find and punish the criminals , who are believed to be a gang of outlaws from a nearby mining town . - The criminals are holed up in a small ranch . In an attempt to capture the leader of the outlaws, the Sheriff and his men set fire to the ranch in order to lure him out .

I've seen 'nurse betty' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea' in vlissingen, the netherlands. It impressed me so much that I kept on smiling the whole day after I watched it for the first time and almost all evening again when I took the movie as the final taste of the festival. What I knew about 'nurse betty' was in short that renée zellweger would play a girl in love with a soap-opera-star. But what I saw was much more than that! Splendid roles for morgan freeman, chris rock ànd renée zellweger.

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old. I knew nothing of westerns then but recognized Ben Johnson from the movie "Mighty Joe Young." What attracted me to "Wagon Master" were the great songs sung by the "Sons of the Pioneers." Merian C. Cooper, who produced the movie, was the first to commission original music to fit the mood of a specific scene and so created the modern movie soundtrack. Cooper hired Max Steiner to create the mood for his classic creation King Kong.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars! I really don't care what people can say badly about this movie...because it's a really well played parts from Samuel L. Jackson, and mainly by Christina Ricci!! I'm a big fan of hers, right since I saw her in Addams Family...been trying to watch all things she makes, and this is absolutely one of the best parts she played!! I love her looks (even though people say she's not pretty...I think she is...and I love her eyes)!!

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this. I have been searching for it for a long time to show my daughter to show her and i can not find it anywhere. probably because it was only on video and they never made the DVD or VHS or idk.i saw this right off Disney back in 1996 and i think it would be the best video to show her. such a good movie that has every type of emotion displayed throughout the whole movie. also has a lot of actors that started their careers with this movie.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys, but providing a compelling story that was easy to follow.The plot, backdrop, music and talent were all top notch. It was great that you used so many African-American artists to tell the tale of the black cowboy. It was also good to see Billy Zane in this movie. Does he ever play a good guy?I would highly recommend this film to anyone who wants to broaden their way of thinking. This is an excellent movie and I feel privileged to have seen it.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth ? 15 park avenue is the name of a building on the corner of 57th and 15th street in Manhattan. The building which is located across from the famous Chrysler Building. 15 park avenue is a 42-story residential condominium building built in the early 1920s. According to a news report published in the New York Times in 2011. In that report, it stated that 15 park ave sold for more than 100 million dollars. The report also stated that it is currently occupied by a family who is willing to sell the apartment.

A classic late 50 's film . The superannuated headliners ( Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan ) are not at the peak of their powers as they try to save the world from being overrun by marauding insects. There is also a romantic interest between a scientist and the wife of his boss ( Crawford ) . . The movie was not that well received in its day but it has held up well over the years . . Rod Serling ( TV ) had a small part in the film and he was quite good . I watched the movie on TV years ago but it left little impression .

Very good "Precoder" starring Dick Barthelmess, which in a way, kind of reminded me of Hawks' "Only Angels Have Wings" (1939), in which Barthelmess also acted. This film was directed by masterful William Wellman, who was responsible for the landmark aviation Silent picture "Wings".Barthelmess plays a devil-may-care airplane pilot, who is a blamed for an aviation accident. Afterwards he meets and falls for pretty Sally Eilers, who participates as part of an Act in an itinerant Air Circus; but when Barthelmess' brother appears in scene, a triangular relationship ensues.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short. Every element of the piece assists in eliciting a pure emotional response to the script. Well acted, directed, shot and written. I was surprised to hear that there was no rehearsal before shooting, not even a read through. The performances stand as testament to some fine instinctual acting in response to a well written script. The actresses work was excellent and there was never an indication that their work would slip into the purely sentimental. Less is much better in this case.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm , wit , and charm . At age 16 Lorelai has two jobs ( one being the town's baker), her boyfriend, her ex-husband, and a daughter she gave up when she was 16 to her parents. Rory is a very smart, driven, girl who is always trying to get ahead of the other girls her age . She is also in search for the love of her life and the first time she falls for someone else she finds out the person has a girlfriend.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off . The first book in the series, by the way, was a best-seller so the sequel had to be even better (and it was). I love the first book and have to say the second is just as good. This time around, we get to follow along with Ma and Pa as they are off to Hollywood to film a movie. I'm pretty sure that most people have seen some Ma and Pa movies and they are pretty funny too.

I do n't usually like to see movies while they 're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but last night I made an exception. I went to see an advanced screening of Aeon Flux with some of my friends. I'll admit that I had no idea what the movie was about when I got there. I had heard of the short animated TV show but that was about it. I'm not much into action movies so my expectations were low but I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised. I really enjoyed the movie.

I have n't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater , and I have been looking for it on video for years, but I could never find it. Now I have finally found it . I have a hardcopy of the movie that I got in the early 70's, but I wanted a DVD version of it. This was one of the movies that made me a fan of Peter Cushing, in fact it was my first introduction to him , and it has been a lifelong love for me.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships , 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the camera on each person in the family, the viewer gets to know each of them, not just by the way they act, but even more, by their facial expressions. The story is told from their perspective, rather than the perspective of an outsider. The camera never wanders far, so we are with the characters throughout their daily activities. And the film is set in the house at 51 Birch Street - so we are always there too.

"The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends," says Marion Fairlie, who with her half-sister, Laura, lives in a vast mid-Victorian country estate. "And last night I found myself in Limmeridge churchyard. Normally, people who are dead stay dead, just as normally it is the criminals who are locked up rather than the victims. But then, there was nothing normal about what happened to us..." And we're off on a first-class Gothic story of madness, deception and villainy, based on Wilkie Collins' great novel of Victorian mystery.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through . It has a great ensemble of characters , it is well written, acted and directed . It is one of my favorite comedies of the past few years . I was actually shocked when I read in the paper today that this movie under performed . It was number one this weekend , but the paper said that it only pulled in 4,150,508 dollars . It should have made far more. Maybe the fact that this movie was nominated for a Best Screenplay Oscar was the problem? The movie was up against some big names.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little. If you like you murders, to be signature and serial, and your cops to be British, and shout a lot, and the gore to be bloody and have a religious slant then this hits every button. Not quite enough 'gov'ing to put the shouting into the Sweeney's rarefied heights, but otherwise highly rated. Ken Stott is excellent as the 'cop on the edge' and the guest stars are also well cast, including Edward Woodward and Art Malik. Recommended.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is . This is the true story of one woman and one dog. It's not a grand story of triumph. It's a personal and intimate story about how love changes and grows over the course of a lifetime, and yet it's not sentimental or overly emotional, either. I'm sure it's because the woman and the dog are very much like me, but I loved them both from the very first. The woman's name is Hollis, and she's a middle-aged widow who lives alone in the countryside in rural Georgia.

This film had me spellbound this evening . Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted . John Voight is the best. He was nominated for an Academy Award. It is an epic story , one that I can’t wait to watch again. If you have never seen this classic, you’ve got to. It will not let you go. And to think it was filmed in 1976. Wow. It’s not a great film about the war, but it did give an insight into what soldiers had to do to fight the Nazis.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film. It is an excellent entry point film to a side of history many are not aware of. This is a story of early black settlers, cow boys and infantrymen returning from the Spanish-American War with a cache of gold. The main character Peebles is haunted by memories of his murdered father. The racism applied to the new black settlers and infantryman is explored in this film with excellent casting including Melvin Van Peebles (Marios father), Billy Zane, Stephen Baldwin and a wonderful performance by Big Daddy Kane.

The Lone Ranger & Tonto set out to bring to justice a band of hooded raiders who have killed three Indians for what appears at first to be no apparent reason..that is until the Lone Ranger discovers from a conversation with the Indian Chief Tomache that each man possessed a medallion. The five medallions given by Tomache to his friends as gifts we later learn when combined will provide the mastermind behind the hooded raiders with a map to a legendary lost city of gold. Can the Lone Ranger protect the remaining two individuals in possession of the medallions before the hooded raiders get their hands on it?

America 's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense . It has a great hostess , the best contestants, amazing photographers and producers. The show was created by The New Yorker and Tyra Banks. This show was first aired in August 2003. It is now on its 19th season. Tyra has been the hostess from the beginning. There have been 20 seasons of the show. It started out on The WB network. From 2003 to 2007 the show was on The CW channel. After a few seasons the channel changed its name to The CW.

Our America is multi-cultural, with so many sub-cultures. This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time within one of these sub-cultures. It is basically an objective look at a group of forgotten people, living their lives oblivious to the rest of the world. Generally, a good movie. It entertained, provoked thought, and showed lives that would not be seen otherwise, right in our own back yard. Should be seen by all. Having lived in the U.S. all my life, I had no idea that there were citizens here that didn't know they were citizens.

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought the DVD of it for $1.02. I didn't expect much quality in the film, but was interested in the story. This film is an historical fiction about Akhenaton and how he came to be a Pharaoh in Egypt. This film is very old and made in the 40's. The quality is poor by today's standards. It is still an interesting story though. The film is based on a book by George Roden.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper, which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines tense dramatic moments, with very funny characters and situations, to give the film the right balance and feel. The comedy of the film occurs naturally, and the laughs haven't been set up too elaborately & haven't been too worked at. It really is very funny, thanks to the fact that each character in the movie is excellently cast, and that each actor/actress recognises and can relate to the Aussie humor. They portray it very well and very realistically.

I viewed The Reader at Sugar , which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything , and the movie wasn't anything special. The story is about an older man (Ralph Fiennes) who recounts to a young woman the events and aftermath of a Nazi war crimes trial he'd been a part of. The main character, a teenager, had a passionate affair with an older man. The man (now in his 40s) recounts his experience with a woman in her 50s who had been his babysitter when he was 16.

Robin Hood ; Men in Tights is worth watching , I recently watched it because I 've just become a big fan . I have heard good things about Robin Hood and I may check it out one day, I have not watched Robin Hood : Prince of thieves in a while so may check that out again. Muppets from Space is a great family movie , it has a few good songs in it too , it was also the last Jim Henson movie made before he died. I have not seen the other movies you mentioned, if you have not seen The Witches then you should watch that.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails . Because it was a little picture , John Ford and Jack Pennell had to make do with a small location , no special sets and not too many extras . And it succeeds because the picture is not a big spectacle , it is just a little story well told . Several other Ford pictures are as good , and a few others are as good and as good as anything that Ford ever made . But this picture is something else. It is one of only two of Ford's pictures in the public domain , meaning it is not under copyright in any country .

I love to see a female protagonist, in this movie her name was Rose. Rose brought out a lot of interesting questions in her journey of fulfillment.Is is possible to attain peace and internal fulfillment through external means? Does our society teach this? Can one be a victim of memory which may lead to victimizing others? Is one responsible for being a product of one's environment? To what extent can one control or take control of one's environment? How is a "typical" human alike or different than Rose? Lastly, would the outcome or story change if it were from another country like France or Italy?

When this film gets it right it really gets it right . And when it goes wrong ... I 'd hate to be responsible for editing this film. The movie was a mess and not a good mess, more like a really really bad mess . The characters were all a bunch of idiots who made stupid decision after stupid decision and then had no repercussions or real consequences for them. This is a movie you just sit and watch and say to yourself " What the hell are they doing ??? " The movie is about a group of students who go out on a boat to celebrate the school graduation.

After searching for 6 months , I finally found this DVD . All I can say is it was damn worth it! I am also looking for 50's and 60's movies and TV Shows.I have a complete collection of old movies from the early 30s up to 1960. Hi, i would like to buy that dvd too. Can you please send me the link for it. Hi, I’m looking for 60's to 80's tv shows on DVD. If you have it, pls send a link. This is awesome. I would like a link.

I 'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5 , but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 500 other 10's this movie has. I had a lot of anticipation for this movie and I have to admit, I've been disappointed by the last few Marvel films. The only reason this isn't any higher than 9/10 is because I feel the last half hour or so is rushed and could have used more time and/or action. But I loved everything else about it. The acting, I thought was superb.

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture , 'Wagon Master ' made after two big Indian-cavalry westerns in which he lost his star, John Wayne, to Republic Studios. This picture has none of the elements which make Ford's westerns special. There is no love story, no big-time star, no big battle scenes, no cowboys, no Indians, and little gunfire. This is Ford's most realistic western, but it is also the least interesting of the director's pictures. The plot involves a small wagon party composed of Mormon emigrants who have been forced to take shelter with a traveling circus family.

If I 'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty , I probably would n't have touched it with a 10 foot pole. A film in the same league as Beverly Hills 90210 is a bit too highbrow for me. But as fate had it: I watched it and liked it. Not only did I watch it, I rented a video copy (a DVD copy has not been released, at least not in the US). The DVD copy is actually a better presentation than the theatrical release. Bill Nye the Science Guy is a TV science show geared towards the education of kids 5 through 15.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much . The theme was well handled by the Director with great respect and understanding. This movie was one of my favorites. Criticism is all the rage, especially of the Trump administration, but it is difficult to think of a better movie in this genre than this one, which, like its source material, is based on fact. The story, about how a small town in Nebraska (Bridgeport, Nebraska to be specific) became the site of a 1968 protest at a courthouse against the Vietnam war draft, is riveting from start to finish.

I 'm not the type of person to watch T.V . shows because the acting normally sucks or it 's overly dramatic or predictable. However, this past year, I have started to watch some good shows. Here are some shows that have caught my attention. Dexter - this is the only show that I have never missed. I have also watched every season of it at least four times. Dexter is awesome. It 's very violent, so it might not be for some people. You follow a serial killer through his day job as a blood spatter pattern analyst.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas , Phoenix , Fresno , etc. , just single buildings with the name on it. I'd be curious to get a picture of each terminal at PIA and JFK with the full names of them. It's easy enough to find pictures of the PIA terminal but not easy to find a picture with the full name on the terminal building. Same goes for Penn Station or the GWB but that is a bit more difficult as there are a lot more buildings involved . There was a time when people would get out and run around taking random pictures.

Michelle, Anicée Alvina, was so nice, and I really fall in love with her. She died a few months ago! Friends? Really the best movie of my youth. The "seasons reprise" of Elton and his arranger Paul Buckmaster sings in my head forever... Please, if you know where i could find a VHS of the film, mail me!! My husband of 26 years & I saw this as Juniors in HS. Yes, he was my boyfriend then and still continues to be. I think we both cried our eyes out.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released . The controversy that surrounded the original release has made it into one of the most memorable sci fi movies ever made. What I thought of the controversy is, if the scene was intended to be realistic, what would be the point of making a film that portrayed an imagined future? If they intended to portray a scene that was supposed to look like a future, why didn't they just use makeup and special effects? The whole argument is pointless. It makes no sense.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty, easily one of the most charming, off-beat, and lighthearted comedies of the year.When soap opera obsessed waitress Betty Sizemore witnesses her insensitive husband's murder by two hitmen (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), she snaps and thinks the cast members on A Reason to Love are real. She decides to travel to Los Angeles to find famed heart specialist Dr. David Ravell (a character on the show).As the two oddly paired Hitmen, the caustic Rock and the pontificating Freeman generate some very fun chemistry, and Greg Kinnear also has fun with his smarmy offscreen actor persona.

I got this movie with my BBC `` Jane Austen Collection '' ( 5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations ) and I've watched it before, but I enjoyed it more the second time around. I just wanted to note, that it's probably the only time, I've seen, that one actor, who's in it, play three different characters with three very distinctive personalities - and he does it so well, too!! It was quite funny, really - watching him in all the different roles - and all three are so different from each other, too!!

At first I could n't tell if it was an art film or a documentary . The day after I was still able to see in my mind's eye some scenes of the film but I was not sure if they were my own memories of the film or just of life in general. The film had touched me so deeply that even the slightest trace had left a deeper impression on me then many films I've seen. One of the great things of this film is that it doesn't give you any answers. It doesn't force you into thinking about a specific subject.

If I'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty, I probably wouldn't have touched it with a ten-foot pole. But after I heard some positive buzz, and knowing it made some noise at Cannes, I decided to give it a try. What I got is a truly enjoyable movie, based on a very entertaining plot. Rene Zelleweger is impressive in her role as nurse' Betty, a woman who is sent into a delusional psychotic episode following a traumatic experience. I also liked Morgan Freeman (no surprise) and was pleasantly surprised by foul-mouthed comedian Chris Rock.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming , the kids were so adorable in it. I would watch it with my little boys when they are older so that they can see what real family means. It is very touching and it is great to know that parents can still be real parents no matter what the situation is or is not. I liked this movie and would definitely watch it with my daughter when she is old enough. I think this movie portrays a real story of what it takes to raise a family.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen. To explain my experience, let me use this word picture: Imagine that you have been binging on pixie sticks and paint fumes for the last month while watching nothing but Twilight Zone reruns. The resulting coma lands you in a hospital, where the nurse seems to get a kick out of shooting adrenalin into your IV. The dream that you have while in the coma will be something like this movie.SUMMARY: A man shows up at the door of a couple. He gives them a box with a button on it.

I 'm absolutely disgusted this movie is n't being sold . All who love this movie should email Disney and request it to be sold on DVD for everyone to see . There was a lot of great talent in this movie with great actors and a great story . This movie deserves to be sold and I feel that everyone should be able to see this great movie ! I'll be emailing Disney myself ! ! ! ! ! It is so difficult to find this movie anywhere on the Internet, I think it was never released on VHS. This is such a shame!

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee , it is evident in his movie . Forget the Black guy on White trash movie, this is the other way around . Brewer makes you laugh at the people who have been pushed down on by the world , but in the end you feel for them as well. This is a well made movie , a good script and excellent performances from the lead cast . You will enjoy this if you want to take a break from some of the big budget action movies out there. I am giving this movie a four star rating, I really liked this movie.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny (and fun) puns. The first shot we see in here is an island prison with the following written above its big gates: "Alka-Fizz Prison - No Noose Is Good Noose." Inside the prison, the first sign we see is "Welcome: have a seat." They then show an electric chair.Corny gives way to clever, however, as our favorite wolf is seen behind bars. With pen in hand, he literally draws a door next to him and then escapes through it!

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it. The film opens with images of planes landing at an airport, one plane after another diving into a mirage-filled runway. You will be able to accurately guess that this movie is not about a "story." At first viewing, it's even easy to think the opening images are repetitive shots of the same plane. The initial drama is in the acuteness of your perception, which is built on your willingness to experience the film simply as a series of images.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old , ( having an existing interest in this period of our history at the time ) and it has become a firm favourite ever since. Although at the time I could only guess at who these characters were , they left an ever lasting impression . I am therefore delighted to now have this film in my possession and it has certainly stood the test of time , I find it as watchable now as I did when I first viewed it at that age.

Strange enough , shorts like this get a 10 . Why ? They are hilarious . This is hilarious . It is a little slow in some areas , but not bad . I really liked it and I think you will too ! This movie is a lot better then the trailer made it seem . I liked the cast . I hope we will get a sequel . I will most definitely watch this again . I don't think I have seen anything from the director or the screenwriter but I would definitely check it out again . The director is new to the industry and he did a really good job on this one .

I had always heard about this great mini-series, but viewed it for the first time this week, July of 2007. I can see why it started the careers of so many young actors. The story is intriguing and gives wonderful insights into the period before and during the Civil War. I cared about the characters and how their lives evolved during this period. Some of them were stereotypes, but they still helped me see how people thought during the 1800's. Many historical facts were thrown into the story and it was interesting to see history books come to life.

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film ? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and a brilliant filmaker. This is one of his greatest hits, one of a kind and one of the most underrated movies in history of cinema. Say Anything....is not the greatest movie of all time. And it's not a great comedian movie either. But what makes it special is the cast. Say Anything... is a fun movie about a guy and a girl and how their relationship changes throughout their relationship. The best part is how well the movie was directed by Cameron Crow.

I loved this movie! OH MY GOSH! This movie rocked so hard! I found it amongst some old tapes and didn't know what it was and after having read the back of the cover to see what the summer had to say about it (Which btw, mentioned the fact that Elton John covered the soundtrack for the film more times than it mentioned what the film was actually about. ), I thought it sounded interesting, and I was even more interested in seeing it because it was an older film. "What controversy?"

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16. Now the daughter is 16 (in season 1) and they live like sisters. Sharing everything, trusting each other completely.I like The Gilmore Girls but I am not sure why. The mother, named Lorelai (Lauren Graham), and the daughter, named Rory (short for Lorelai, played by Alexis Bledel), are both very beautiful women, they are both funny and they are charming in their own ways. There are some funny supporting characters, such as Luke (Scott Patterson).

Awww , I love this ! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon does n't really need an synopsis to be read. But I would love to know more about the Tale Of the Cat and the Moon . I've got the book in my hands but I'm too lazy to read it right now... I'll do it after my mid term exam... I know you can't wait to read about it so, please write about it... :P.
This book is so so cute and funny ! The characters are so real. I love all of the stories and the funny little comments.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time , it definitely is in the top five . I first saw it back in 1978 or 79 I was 8 or 9 years old when I first saw this movie and it is one of those that I have seen many times over the past 31 years. It is so well written , and so true. This movie is more then a movie this is a piece of art that so many people have loved through the years . It has something for everyone and if you dont have it you should run out to your nearest DVD store and buy a copy today.

First love. Teenage love. We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the one the protagonists share. "Friends" could be considered an adaptation of the classic "The Blue Lagoon", originally from 1949, and its remakes from 1980 (the most popular one, with Brooke Shields) and 1999 (with a young Milla Jovovich). While "The Blue Lagoon" puts the two young lovers in a desert island, with no contact with civilization, "Friends" goes the opposite route and it is sure to ring much more true and be a more difficult movie with contemporary audiences.

This is a great concert which featured the best songs of the band 's 30 year career . Lee , Hillel, Bob and the others sounded and looked great! It is a true testament to Lee's staying power as the best rock and roll singer of all time! I highly recommend this album to any Bob Segers fans! This is a must have. I have it all the time. You can't miss it!! Great to have all my favorite segers tunes in one cd! WOW!!! Just WOW!!! I've always liked Bob but this collection is AMAZING!

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years . Great production design , appealing stars , story and photography are what I would expect from a director like Polansky . I am not a fan of CGI but it worked here and did not interfere with the movie . The movie is very good , entertaining and thought provoking . Loved it , highly recommend it for a great movie night at home , it is a little different than your usual movie but it will keep you entertained and is a must see. This is one of my favorite films.

"L'Auberge Espagnole" collected the audience wherever it was shown. It gathered audience awards on many film festivals all over the world. And it is not strange. We have the ability to watch a cheerful and an astonishing piece of art. And it is wise by the way. "L'Auberge Espagnole" is a very funny comedy about youth and growing up. But most of all it is about the lights and shadows of living in the European Union.The main character of the film is a French student of economy Xavier. For his future carrier his is sent for one year of studying to Barcelona.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made, "Murder in the Music Hall" seems to have undeservably faded into oblivion. A shame, because this lusciously produced, expertly directed and written, and crafty mystery-suspense item spins an enticing whodunnit thriller against the setting of Radio City Music Hall. A murder in one of the building's posh penthouse apartments casts suspicion on the luscious Rockettes--among them, Vera Ralston (who besides giving an appealing performance of subtlety and vulnerablity, provides a few dazzling ice-skating production numbers), Helen Walker, Ann Rutherford, Julie Bishop, and several other delectable B-movie starlets of the '40s.

Renee Zellweger is Betty , a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse , who is infatuated with a handsome stranger, played by Jim Carrey , when he checks into the local hospital where she works. The movie's story line was written by Steven Rogers , and is based on a 1980s British comedy television series called The Fall Guy that starred Bruce Forsyth and Ronnie Hazlehurst . The plot of the movie was said to have been the subject of many changes. The screenplay was the first of Zellweger's projects that was written specifically for her, after her breakout role in the movie Jerry Maguire (1996).

1981 's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there . It 's one of the only films that uses real wolves , so when you watch this film , it 's not the usual fake wolf that 's being seen on the screen . And the film does a great job creating the suspense that 's needed to be a successful horror film . So you should watch this movie . A group of three young women , Jessie , Sara and Gina , go up to a camp ground in the wilderness with a group of men .

THE CELL ( 2000 ) Rating : 8/10The Cell , like Antz , must be watched twice to be appreciated. Like Antz , The Cell has a lot of fun ideas that would work if the movie were longer, or shorter, or edited in the right way, or with a different script. The movie does have a few dumb scenes, but it's never so bad you want to turn it off. If you do turn it off or leave the room during it you'll want to come back and give it a chance to finish.

It came before `` the ten commandments '' `` land of the Pharaohs '' `` Ben Hur '' and it is the most successful book of the world. It is the bible of the civilizations of the whole universe, it is the book of life, it contains all the knowledge necessary for the development of mankind, because it is the book of love. It is full of good examples of what a person must be in his daily life with all his fellows, his neighbors and the others. It contains all the good habits, it teaches how to respect the others and how to love them.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film. The backwoods slasher pretty much started with films like Friday the 13th, The Burning, and Madman. Just Before Dawn is a step ahead of the typical backwoods slasher flick. The cinematography is gorgeous. The acting is top notch. The heroine of the film is not your typical 'final girl'.Constance is a 'woods' girl, but when it comes down to the primal instinct of survival, she's a step behind. Not until it comes to saving the life of her and her boyfriend, does the primal notion of survival kick in.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday ( 4 February , 2006 ) and came away with a feeling of sadness. Why should a film be so sad that it makes you feel blue for the next 2 days ? I felt the same when watching "Brokeback Mountain" a couple of months ago. It has something to do with the subject matter of these 2 films. There are 2 very good reasons why we should be grateful to Singaporean director Anthony Chen. One is the fact that this is probably the best Singapore movie I have ever seen.

Susie Q. is one of those rare, and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling. It's bittersweet, but wholesome, and it's characters are fun, and captivating.
