This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for ``The Good, The Bad and The Ugly``, and which was later used as the opening to the 1986 movie `Sharkey's Machine` starring Sean Penn (who plays a very young Sharkey here). In one of the opening scenes we are introduced to Sharkey (Dick Van Dyke), and a few moments later the scene changes as we see Sharkey sitting on a hilltop looking down upon the village below with his back to the viewers.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and , as mysteries should , ends with a satisfactory solution. But I find that, in order to be able to enjoy these books, it helps to know what was going on in previous entries in the series. This one, of course, is no exception. The Saint is in Spain, and an old friend - who was the Saint's first love but who later became the wife of an aristocrat - dies and leaves him an enormous amount of money, but only if he will marry her.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest. In many ways, it's like a 50s version of VALLEY OF THE DOLLS--with much of the excesses and sleaziness of VALLEY polished up a bit for the audiences of 1959. Like this later film, both are about three young ladies who are on the fast-track to success--though this time it's in the publishing world instead of the entertainment industry (though one of the ladies in THE BEST OF EVERYTHING does have aspirations of Broadway).The film begins with Hope Lange coming into the company for her first day of work.

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film: Who are the crazy people?The answer become less clear as the film goes on.Renee Zellweger loses the whiney note in her voice and, while her voice is still high, she is incredibly effective as the shell-shocked Betty. In fact, she is so effective I almost wanted her to be just a little more crazy because her created reality was so believable.This is the first time Ms Zellweger has been called upon to carry a film and she is more than equal to the task.Chris Rock  though as foul-mouthed as usual  is fairly subdued as Wesley.

Despite all it 's trappings of style and cinematic invention , this is basically another serial killer thriller , following the pattern of many movies which preceded it such as Zodiac , Silence Of the lambs and the aforementioned Se7en and Fight Club . If you follow this formula it's easy to get a sense of déjà vu . But in the hands of writer - director David Fincher the result is more than the sum of its influences . This is an intelligent, intelligible and intelligently made movie , with a superlative cast and an original screenplay .

Despite all it's trappings of style and cinematic invention, this is basically another serial killer thriller, following the same sort of plotline favoured by such old favourites as Silence of the Lambs ? team of cops follows the trail of (particularly nasty) murders, someone else gets taken and they somehow have to find out where they are before it's too late. Only in this case, the only person who knows, the killer himself (powerfully played by Vincent D'Onofrio) is in a coma and we need psychologist Jennifer Lopez' sci-fi mind-meld machine to get into his head and force him to tell all.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie . My teen-agers enjoyed it over the Easter holiday and found it a fresh take on the historical facts. I think they also liked the romance. I will be showing the movie to my students in the near future and I know they will also be engaged in the romance. I think it is important in today’s world that history is shown to be interesting instead of the usual dry lectures that many students have sat through. It is important that students learn to love history.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it and you will want to watch it every time you can. This film is filled with so many suspense scenes, it will really make it hard to keep your attention off the screen. It is one of the best horror films from the 80s and it will leave you with a chill all over your body. The plot is about a small group of friends who go on a trip together to find a cure for their friend who just recently had a nervous break down.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot. Bugs of Daffy. He's unsure of what season it is and Bunny and Duck arguing help matters not. Though Bugs proves he's the smartest once more by repeatedly using reverse psychology on Daffy in increasingly subtle ways. And when that runs out he does his trademark cross-dressing thingy. Daffy freaks out and demands the bunny be shot. Though Elmer is too stupid he is hopelessly in love with the girl bunny thing. Elmer really is to blame for all this.

That's a bad, raunchy, predictable, tacky, salacious soap opera? "The Best of Everything" is just such a guilty pleasure for me, something along the lines of "Valley of the Dolls". I mean, "Best" has everything. Somebody gets pregnant out of wedlock (when's the last time you heard THAT phrase? ), there are affairs everywhere, drinking, backstabbing, jealousy, and even a tragic but not altogether unexpected death.Caroline Bender (Hope Lange) and Mike Rice (the delicious Stephen Boyd) are the centerpieces of the goings-on.

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest , most clever , sharp-witted , sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I 've ever seen. Gilmore Girls should have at least gotten an Emmy for the acting of the cast, it was flawless , and the writing was also flawless . It is also the only show I have seen that is very intelligent and very well written. I started watching it as a freshman , when it first started airing on The WB in 2000. Now it is in the middle of season 6 on The CW.

Obsessed ! ! ! ! ! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love the show is because its the closest thing I have ever seen to my family. Its just the right balance of funny, romantic, and sad. I have a huge crush of Dean (I think they should have ended up together) and Luke, I'm sorry, but the guy is adorable! So I just thought I should let you all in on what I have to look forward to with the new season.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts , unlike many other great Ford films , like " Stagecoach" , or " The Searchers" or " Shane." That's a good thing, as this fast-moving B western is a well-done , exciting , fun action movie , with good performances by the stars. Most movies have one main character whose role is the most significant , as is usually the case here. Robert Preston, who starred in the "Music Man" on Broadway and later in Hollywood movies , is the main star here , playing a good-hearted but stubborn sheriff in a small Western town.

I saw `` The Reader '' at a film festival in Manhattan this week . It touched my heart in a very deep way . As I was watching it , one sentence was echoing in the back of my head : `` When you have a life long love , why do you leave ? Why do you leave when your love is so deeply ingrained in your soul ? '' It got me wondering . How would I react in a similar situation ? Would I give up everything I have , the very life that I have worked for years , in order to spend my life with the person I have loved ?

SPOILERS AHEAD -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - Mel has got it going on tonight as the 51st annual Grammy Awards show gets underway in Los Angeles. Taking place at Staples Center, and hosted by LL Cool J, all eyes will be on the singer-songwriter and producer-turned-vocoder-wielder to see whether he'll clean up at the 51st-annual-ceremony which takes place at LA's 18,340 capacity Staples Center. Spoiler: He Won. Daft Punk are up for six Grammys, taking the most nominations, including Album of the Year, Song of the Year (Get Lucky) and Best Record.

Brilliant film ! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats just because of the same writer. The main character is a man that lives his life on his own way. He has his own way of thinking about life and he does whatever he wants. He works as a fisherman that has a great respect to fish. He is really intelligent and has no friends but he has a daughter and lives in a flat with a woman. When the girl is grown up he has to leave her and start his new life again.

This movie makes you think . It shows how a woman 's weaknesses can result in nightmares for others . This movie was filmed in a different manner than many other movies. This movie is about the life and times of an old woman. It focuses on her thoughts and actions . It makes you wonder if she is insane .This movie takes you through a time of the 60's when the women movement was becoming popular . The movie is mostly about an old women who lives with her sister who works at the local movie theater .

Come on. Anyone who doesn't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic's panel. They should not be allowed to be heard, because they obviously have no sense of humor whatsoever. Anyone who does not love this here animated cartoon directed by Tex Avery should be chained to a chair and forced to watch "Huckleberry Hound" episodes for 20 years straight! The takes and double-takes by the Wolf in this cartoon are the finest examples of this important past of comedy that have ever been captured on film. Tex Avery should receive a posthumous Academy Award for this cartoon.

Sweeping drama with great sets, costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett, Scarlett, Melanie and even Lady Macbeth. Patrick Swayze and James Read are excellent as two men trying to maintain a friendship despite the ties of family and location. Splendid villains  you'll want them all to come to a very bad end. Lots of strong female characters in this one  both good and bad. Secondary story lines also are well developed. Several cameos by major stars of past eras. Good representation of history and conflicts for those caught between friendship and politics.

Surprising , witty , funny and totally engaging , the film grabs a little-known reality : that of the student life in a bachelor’s college . I am not quite sure where I have heard of this film but I liked the sound of it . I had no knowledge whatsoever about this film , but it seems to me that it is a very light-hearted , enjoyable and a complete laugh riot. The story is set in a small college named St. Francis college. The college’s student body comprises only of men. The film revolves around three of its students .

What can you possibly say? This is the uncut hardcore, musical Alice! It works too with a large energetic cast seemingly enjoying themselves to the hilt and whilst one could wish for a re-mastered version, I guess we are lucky to even have this video transfer. Pretty much a delight throughout. There are a couple of slightly off moments but this could have been embarrassing all through and it certainly is not. It also could have been and today would have been too camp. No, a very fine effort that is amusing, tuneful and just sexy enough.

I too saw this movie when it first came out. I was a teenager at the time, and I saw it with my girl friend who later became my wife. I remember the movie made me feel it was possible to beat the odds. The cinematography was very well done if memory serves me correctly. The boy was a little much, but the girl character was very interesting. I thought it was very romantic and that might have been the intro to the first time with my then girlfriend. I have not seen the movie since and I wander why it has gone to the wayside.

Hands down, the best drama/comedy show on television. A cleverly written show about a young mother and her 16 year old daughter exploring life and finding things out not only about the world but themselves too. Lorelai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) struggles to find a way to remain in close bond with her daughter but steer her in the right path, which through-out the show is becoming harder and harder. Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) caught in a world of books and learning is just beginning to discover boys and her own sense of rebelliousness, which surprises them both.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address `` Mithi/Mithali '' ( Konkona ) is in search for from the movies beginning with A. 15 Park Ave, San Francisco, CA is a 5 bedroom, 7 bathroom, 6,610 sqft single-family home built in 2003. The 15 Park Residences is a high-rise residential and commercial building located along the 45th Road in the city of Mandaluyong, Metro Manila.The property, which was previously a commercial building is undergoing a major renovation and will be converted into a 39-storey building with residential, office and leisure facilities.It will have.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom, which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of the Black Culture. The focus and outlook was a message of positivity for our people, and hope for change. I advise this selection for every American household to experience the struggle, and the reward. The show was never given the chance to blossom into the idea of middle-class Blacks becoming business owners of their own. The issue's were so compatible with real life situation's that impacted the lives of so many.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars ! I really do n't care what people can say badly about it ! This movie has a lot of potential to be a great movie. First of all the movie has an interesting plot. The main idea is pretty good and well thought ! Secondly the characters are amazing ! Every single one of them is so good ! I think the acting is brilliant ! The movie has such a great cast, and every character is very well portrayed. In addition to this the soundtrack is brilliant ! The movie has a great mix between classical and modern songs.

Cant believe it.... after all these years finally tracked this down.. it was meant to be named 'The Great Pretender' at production stage. I was living in Oz at time and through a friend was looking after one of the house locations through filming.... It was me that showed these guys how to speak Scottish and after all this time, I only realise now one was Russell Crowe !!! It has taken me all these years to track this down, was even unsure if it ever went to screen as I left Oz the following month after wrap up party.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction. This is what today's documentaries are all about. It's refreshing to watch something so personal, honest and real. Mr. Block's thoughts, opinions and disclosure are rarely seen these days and are incredibly well displayed here. It's a fine line to walk between personal truth and exploitation. This film treads very carefully and quite successfully.One would think that learning about how a seemingly normal couple falls short of society's expectations would give birth to pessimism...but it doesn't. Quite the opposite: it made me feel good.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south . The story follows a man (Christensen) who has to save a woman (Kidman) from lusting after a local musician (Kinnear). As she tries to redeem her soul, they form an intimate bond that threatens to ruin his marriage. I give this movie a 3.5 out of 5 stars and I have it as a movie worth watching, and a must own to all Rae's movie fans . Black Snake Moan will be released to DVD and HD DVD on June 5th.

Style over substance. But what a style it is. "The Cell" is the internal version of most serial killer movies. Unfortunately, the story hardly supports the visuals.Psychotherapist Catherine Deane (J-Lo) goes into her patients' dreams via artificial means to discover and help them over come their phobias and obsessions. A new patient whose fallen into a coma, is brought to her attention by the FBI. He's a serial killer who drowns his female victims then poses their bodies in grotesque scenarios like mannequins. Deane must enter the killer's mind and navigate through his sick fantasies in order to find and save his latest victim.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films (I still have a poster of it in my room!). I’m sure most of you have seen it already, but I don’t think I’ve ever reviewed it, so let me remedy that at once! The opening scene is brilliant. It starts with Nic Cake (Rose Byrne) talking about how her grandmother was in a car accident and, in her words, “she died, but it’s okay cause she died in a car accident.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage . I saw the first series and found the second not so good. However the last episode which looks at divorce was the most interesting and the one I kept watching the most. You need to be in a calm state of mind while watching it so you can truly appreciate it . This is the best documentary i have ever seen , it is so inspiring and really makes you stop and take stock of life and family relationships .

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement. This low-key Western is unusual for Ford in that it lacks any big stars. Johnson gets top-billing but his is basically a supporting role, although he and Carey work well together. Dru is given little to do other than provide the love interest. The best performance is given by Ford favorite Bond, playing the leader of the Mormons. In fact, this role helped him land a starring role in the long-running TV Western "Wagon Train" before his untimely death at age 57.

I Love this movie! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie, but I really disagree. The comedy is classic Mel Brooks style and the actors were superbly chosen. This was my first exposure to Cary Elwes, and Dave Chappelle and what a first impression they made. Cary Elwes shines as Robin Hood, the only British Robin Hood mind you. He has great comedic timing and the right attitude for this type of film. Dave Chappelle is obviously much bigger now, but at the time this was his first movie and he did an outstanding job as Achoo.

Great Movie! The sound track is awesome! Very relaxing sound. Elton was ahead of his own time even back in 1971. Lewis Gilbert did a magnificent job producing and directing this film! The movie was romantic and a breath of fresh air. The sound tracks written by Sir Elton complimented the movie to a T. Rex Morris does a great job with the tenor sax on the song "Honey Roll" and poem "I Meant To Do My Work Today" by Richard Le Gallienne was incredible! Kudos to everyone involved with this fantastic film!

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years, Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema perhaps more so than any other commercial filmmaker. I've been acquainted with Herzog for a few decades now and I've never not been impressed by both the man and his work. Last year I went to see Rescue Dawn and was somewhat surprised at how relatively mainstream the film was, yet couldn't help but imagine Herzog taking his actors and crew into the actual jungle to not only make the film, but to live it.

Fata Morgana is , by far , one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. Directed by Jean Cocteau, the film is more of a psychedelic dream sequence, than a story. There is no storyline in this film. You will not understand what is happening on the screen. That's what it is about. It is a dreamlike film, where you try to find some sort of logic or meaning, but you can't. This is the film's genius. You are left staring at the screen , trying to come up with a meaning.

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission, they blame him for his reasons. Feeling guilty, Peck goes on an almost impossible task of defending a fort, where they are outnumbered by the Indians. Peck chooses for this mission soldiers which he considers to be the scum of the earth and the actors that play these soldiers, Ward Bond, Lon Chaney Jr., Neville Brand among others, are excellent. The script is derived from a novel by Charles Marquis Warren who was a specialist in westerns, as a writer, director and producer.

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to give it a watch on Netflix on a night when my wife was out of the house. I found that it was much more enjoyable than I had remembered it and even my kids had a good time watching. I can’t say it is a great movie but for 90 minutes, it was good enough to hold my interest. The movie is a comedy about a family that takes a trip to visit a distant relative and finds out that they live in a town that is inhabited by giant animals.

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I expected. Instead the director Jeff Lieberman conjures up a wonderfully evocative and disquieting atmosphere for great stretches of the movie, building the suspense constantly until I was really unsure about what was going to happen but wound up tight as a spring waiting for it. The lack of action in many parts gave it a very Deliverance mixed with The Texas Chainsaw Massacre kinda ambiance, and when the action really kicks in, its truly shocking and dramatic, without ever even really needing to be gory.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

`5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters, stories of war, drag queens, kangaroos and koalas, and Australians in general being represented as nitwits living off the land, saying words like cobber' and generally being the classic underdog.Luckily Australian film has evolved over the last couple years and is churning out modern day classics' such as Blackrock, Moulin Rouge, Chopper, Yolngu Boy and Sample People.In this evolution of film we also find Two Hands.Set in Sydney's Kings Cross, Two Hands is a black comedy about crime and survival in the rough end of town.
